story:
If you're reading this, chances are you already know who I am. If not, let me introduce myself. I'm Jonathon Twiz. I'm a hiphop artist from Toronto Canada.

Music is something that has always been meaningful to me. Although I predominantly rhyme in my music. It serves no purpose to categorize me. My music is a melting pot of various styles, which is nothing more than a reflection of my musical tastes and influences. From being in an indie rock band to being apart of a hip-hop collective, I have chosen the solo route to be the best way to voice my opinions and perceptions of the world through the higher frequencies of my music. At this point in my life it has become important to make timeless music. Timeless as in, the type of music that isn’t hot today and forgotten tomorrow. It’s the type of music that is not a fad, but transcends the transitory nature of pop culture, impacting the listener on the same powerful level years later as it did when it was first released. I may not be Michael Jackson or The Beatles, but every artist should strive to make music that is as meaningful, powerful, creative, and thorough as theirs. Now, in hip-hop at least, we have sacrificed quality for quantity. Mixtapes flooding the internet with watered down garbage, hot today, forgotten about tomorrow type of music, rappers only putting their best effort when its time to drop an album. It’s just a bunch of noise… nothing but noise…. We need to rise above the noise.

Below are a couple links to my music videos.

Jonathon Twiz - One Life

Jonathon Twiz - The Decision

this is also a social expirament, this will show artists that we can make it on our own terms. It will show the big record companies that we don't need them (not to say that one shouldn't side with a record label but its assuring to know that we can still make it on our own). By taking part in this experiment you yourself are taking charge and helping to change how I make music. You are putting faith in me and directly impacting the quality of my music.

The record industry is backwards. Crowdfunding seems to be something that's working. Whether or not this is the next thing for the music industry, it's a way that supporters of an artist or band can know exactly where their money is going.

I'm doing this IndieGoGo campaign so that I can raise money to work on my latest project titled, EVOLVE. Reaching my goal with this campaign will enable me to get my original music out into the world and market it effectively.


Every dollar we raise from here on allows me to make the very best project for you that I can! Please continue to give, share and talk to your friends about this project!

The team has done a lot of the work already and have squeezed every dollar until it screamed! Being an unsigned artist, it is a challenge raising enough money to produce the kind of quality project that can compete for radio play with the big boys. It's a challenge, but it can be done and we've teamed with some very talented producers, and music industry professionals who are determined to do something really special!

This money will be used for the following Expenses:

BUDGET
   
Pre Production at $150 a song     $1,000.00
Music Video Budget                         $5,000 (viral videos)
Studio Fees     
Studio Time                                       $5,000.00
Producer Fees                                  $6,500.00
Other Workers (engineers, assistants)     $2,750.00
Gear Rental                                       $1,500.00
Gear Purchase                                  $1,250.00

After Recording     
Mixing Fees                                        $2,500.00
Mastering                                           $1,250.00
Artwork                                              $1,000.00
Other Expenses     

      
Grand Total                                       $25,000

Any money raised over the goal amount will be used for promotion of the release.

Join The J.Twiz Team

I want you to be a part of this with me. I'm blessed to have some amazing fans and together, we can form a team that can truly leave a mark on the music industry. Please help me prove that there's still a place in the music world for honest, real, nongimmicky, sincere music.

Other Ways You Can Help (Share! Share! Share!)

I know financially times may be tough right now. I understand if it's just not possible to participate, I'm cool with that.

If you can't make a pledge, you can still be a HUGE help by spreading the word about this campaign to all your friends via social media, email and simple word of mouth. If you don't know what to think about this idea and aren't sure you can commit. Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We don't expect everyone who's listened to and enjoyed our music to jump on board, just let people know this is happening. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach. Just use the social media buttons that appear at the bottom of this page.
 

Thank you for taking time to check out my campaign.

 

Peace!

 

Jonathon Twiz

 More info can be found about me at:

jonathontwiz.com
jtwiz.com


Follow Me On Twitter @ jtwiz

Facebook Page: facebook.com/jonathontwiz


SOUNDCLOUD/JTWIZ

Subscribe To My Digital Magazine "THE RUBICON" at THINKRUBICON.COM

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jon Bannan. I’m a Christian singer/songwriter, musician, artist, graphic designer, and actor. Four years ago, God called me to be a worship leader. Now, that's exactly what I'll be training to do.

Come August 2013, I’ll start the School of Worship, a yearlong internship hosted by the Honor Academy in Tyler, Texas. This program focuses on Worship Perspectives, Song Writing, Music Theory, Worship and Spiritual Leadership. I will be musically and spiritually challenged in many different ways, especially in my perspective of what worship is by diving into God’s Presence and the Word.

 

Why I Need You

And where your money will go

  • Funding classes
  • Paying for room and board
  • Supporting Teen Mania’s outreach to this Generation
  • Backing the production of my original 12 song album

 

The Impact

In recent years, there has been a strong call for Worship Leaders to unite and lift up the name of God in the youth of this generation. The heart and vision of the Honor Academy is to raise up these leaders and to equip them to impact the world for Christ. The Honor Academy is the perfect place to get my feet under me and start living God’s calling for my life. As an intern, I will also help support Teen Mania’s ministries such as Acquire the Fire and Global Expeditions for Christ.

 

Thanks For The Love!

And stay tight with the big man!

story:
Short Summary

Coax From Chuckanut is a two-piece, husband&wife, folk-pop musical duo (Ryan and Libby Sutherland) who are based in Northeast Minneapolis. Our sound has been described as "a more cartoonish Mates of State with a bit of Danielson Famile thrown in there." We write songs about marriage, Macaulay Culkin, and community.

This summer we're recording an EP at the Sound Gallery studio. This is our first recording in six years. Our friends and community have always been an integral part of Coax From Chuckanut and fellow Minneapolis musicians and creatives will be crucial in this project. We've invited Peter Bodurtha and Grant Adams (Good Diction) to fill-in our band for the recording. Jacob Mullis from Fort Wilson Riot will be our sound engineer for the EP. Graphics will be designed by Alxndr Jones. We see Indiegogo as another way to invite people into our music-making process. 

Contributors will help us produce a quality, special, and joyful EP and be invited along in the creation process.

What We Need & What You Get

The money will go for tracking, mixing, and mastering of the album. The album will be recorded in July and we hope to release it fall 2014. 

By contributing to this project:

You will receive many exciting perks including buttons, digital downloads, physical copies of our EP, posters designed by Alxndr Jones, apparel, tickets to our release show, writing coaching with Libby (MFA in Creative Writing), invitations to a pre-recording party at the sound gallery in July, and a private Coax From Chuckanut house show. 

The Impact

Your contribution will make this EP release possible while supporting various local artists.

Other Ways You Can Help

Promote this Indiegogo campaign via Facebook, Twitter, email, or messenger pigeon. Get your friends involved!

story:
In Short...

The Enterprise G is a gangster rap album that happens to be on the subject of Star Trek.  There are a number of such songs out there, but there has yet to be a full length studio produced album in this genre.

  • We are a team of professional music producers employed to produce music and videos for a living
  • We believed that this would be a fun project that would be entertaining and fun for a large number of fans, and felt like it was something we could really get behind and support.
  • Your contribution allows us to pay for the studio time necessary to produce an album that's high quality as well as funny, so each donation gets us closer to the goal of creating something that could entertain people for years.

Even just the purchase of an MP3 can help make the entire album a reality.  Share us on facebook and send us a link to get a free bonus track with any donation.

What We Need for the Trek & What You Get Back

Here's the Breakdown:

  • In order to create the entire 10 song album, we will need $8,500 in studio production time and cd production costs, this also partially covers the teams time, which will be hundreds of man hours before the project is complete
  • Our perks are simple, the first single off of the album, the album as a download, the album as a signed physical copy, or a chance to pick an episode of the original series and have us include a track on the album about it, stuff like that
  • If we don't raise the full amount, we will produce as many tracks as we have funding for, and then release them as an album or EP, dependent on how far the funding takes us

Pan-Galactic Impact

This kind of song or video is almost always fun for people and expands out one of the internet's favorite fictional universes in a cool new way:

  • For you, this is a chance to get the first single before it's released on ITunes and other outlets.  For the world at large, it's a new addition to a well liked sub genre
  • Because the team that will create this is made of industry professionals with a long track record producing professional material for famous artists, large corporations, and independent films, you can expect a product that is much better quality than the unfunded amateur efforts that dominate this genre
  • We've already taken the time to write and record 2 singles on our own, and have a complete list of songs to create, and associated products such as CD's.

Transparency Filter

 The money we raise via this campaign goes directly towards paying for the studio time, and the time of studio musicians that we bring in to work on the project.  All money raised will be spent in this way, other than a small percentage that goes to Indiegogo, and to the physical cd replication process.

  • We have a standing deal with a studio that will allow us to purchase recording hours in bulk, so if we are able to hit our goal, we can spend significantly more time at no additional cost, creating a better album for all to share.  This is why our goal is higher than normal for an album.  We want to go full scale with this and create something that rivals a commercial release.
  • Regular status updates will be available to all contributors, showing the progress on the album, and how your donations are being used.  We will publish these as a series of videos, available here, on Youtube, and on Facebook.

Other Ways to help the Enterprise

If you can't make a donation of any kind, it would help us tons to post about us on Facebook, Google +, an ancient myspace page, or simply spray paint information about the album in an alley somewhere.

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share quickly and easily
  • It's super easy to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • All the cool people are using the Indiegogo share tools
  • A Voodoo doctor told us it's bad luck not to use the tools.

story:
Help me afford loose-fitting jeans for $75 so I can visit my brother in prison without tempting rapists. 

 


Here is what's going on...

Hi! I'm Jane (not my real name) and I'm 20 years old. Recently, after spending 2 hours driving with my family in a minivan to visit my brother in prison, I got turned away because my jeans looked too tight. They fit me comfortably, but the prison told me I should wear looser jeans. Why? Because with female visitors, jeans that fit are too attractive and could tempt a convicted rapist in the visiting room.  Crazy, right? So, that's why I need to buy new loose-fitting jeans, because evidently, I have developed a motor in the back of my Honda.

I'm also working on getting my brother out of prison. To do this, we need a good lawyer. I do have a job, but all of that money is already going toward our legal expenses. We need about $7,000 to afford one, but I don't want to ask for that much. We can make up the difference, but that's really it. That's what the other $4,000 is for; I don't plan on spending $4,075 on a pair of jeans, folks!


Why My Brother is in Prison

I don't want to relive it or dig up the past, but without saying too much, I can just tell you that he tried to be the good guy and save somebody, but it just didn't work out as planned. My brother, who's only 32, feels horrible about what he did, and he has served 10 years already. He's finally eligible to file for an early release, and we believe he deserves to be released and allowed to return home.

The Jeans I Want

A small portion of the money donated (maybe $50-$75) will be used to buy a comfortable pair of jeans with a baggy fit. I'm usually a size 5, but I'll probably go up a couple sizes, so it doesn't hug any curves or make me look too bootylicious, to avoid arousing any unwanted attention from the other inmates. Definitely no designs on the pockets, don't want to draw the eyes where they don't belong! I'm leaning towards Levi's because they're durable and will last a long time on those uncomfortable chairs in the visiting room. After you make a donation, please feel free to suggest any brands that you think might be unattractive to a rapist!


And Also, The Freedom For My Brother I Want

A much larger portion of the money donated will be put towards legal fees to pay a lawyer to help try to get my brother released from prison. My family has driven 2+ hours countless times to multiple prisons over the course of a decade to see my brother. We have been willing to do whatever it takes to see my brother, even if it's just been for an hour at a time. But what we want so badly is to take him home with us and to never have to set foot in a prison again. All I want to do is be able to sit with my brother in our house and watch TV or play monopoly or just talk with him. I don't like to ask for money, but it's what we need to have a chance at finally getting my brother back. 


    Here's How You Can Help

    We can't afford a good lawyer on our own, and that's why I'm asking strangers for help. We only get one chance at this, so we have to make it count. I hope you will please make a contribution if you can. Thank you very much for your support and kindness. I appreciate you, my family appreciates you, and my brother appreciates you. However, the rapists will not appreciate this at all! 

    Names have been changed to protect privacy.

    For updates and news, follow @JeansForJustice on Twitter!

story:
Our Story, Our Need.

We are Live as Lions. We're currently raising money to fund our next tour, album and replace some of our broken equipment before we leave. We've released our EP that cost us $3,000 to create and after much prayer felt the need to make our first release free. But, in the midst of a decision like this, we've also had equipment break down, the need for merchandise, and anything and everything that we do for the band being an out-of-pocket expense. Now, we are honored with the privilege to play Cornerstone 2012, tour the lower 48 (May-July) and begin recording at Emerging Warrior Studios for our full-length album. But, funding a new album and even getting from Alaska to the "lower 48" is a 2-3 day drive and it is not a cheap venture by anyone's standard.
A new album doesn't just mean "more music for the sake of recording"; it's money for potential food, gas, and basic essentials while we are on the road. This tour is also not just a "tour for the sake of touring"; this is playing with other amazing bands and labels that have supported us from day one and the opportunity to turn this into the career we desperately want it to be.

Other Ways You Can Help

The funds we need for this are absolutely essential. But, if you are unable to give financially, or if you would like to give something else in-addition you can also donate airline miles to us before we leave for tour (May-July). While we are on the road drinks, food, or a place for us to sleep (other than our van) is always appreciated. If you have anything else you'd like to donate, please email us at liveaslions@gmail.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

Most importantly, after donating, help us by spreading the word about who we are, what we're doing and what we need. You're influence is invaluable.

Below is also the link to get our EP entitled, "Death is Overcome" for FREE from mediafire (YES, it is virus free and was established by us).

Everything we've done is to impact the world with our faith.
We want to continue - we need your help.

Thank you,

-Live as Lions
http://www.mediafire.com/?vgd39kvtl3tit

story:
Latest News!

We are delighted to upload the latest excerpt from our concert which is from the last movement of the Elgar Cello Concerto with cellist Jamie Walton.

The concert was critically acclaimed: "Awe-inspiring" Peter Woolf

Please help us to continue!

Who we are

The Northern Lights Symphony Orchestra is a London based young and vibrant symphony, who are currently emerging as one of the most exciting and innovative ensembles in the UK. Members of the orchestra come from across the globe and from the world’s greatest music conservatoires. Our website has extra details www.nlso.org

 

Our Appeal

Our season Voyages in Sound 2011-12 has already involved some of today’s finest international soloists, and has received critical acclaim. Our next concert features children from Bow Boys School as part of our ongoing education program to inspire children from underprivileged backgrounds http://www.bow-school.org.uk/

We are proud to welcome internationally acclaimed cellist Jamie Walton – www.jamiewalton.com – to the stage for a performance of Elgar’s famous Cello Concerto.

 

The cost of running a symphonic concert requires support and help from music-lovers worldwide. Our goal is to raise $7500 (GBP £5000) which will go a long way to pay musicians fees.

The money raised will help our orchestra:

  • Production and start-up costs
  • Orchestral musicians and soloist fee
  • Venue hire – St. Sepulchre-without-Newgate (National Musicians’ Church)
  • Music Hire – Elgar and Sibelius Symphony No. 5
  • Advertising through local and national press and publicity
  • Providing music for Tower Hamlets community and Bow Boys School, including parents from underprivileged areas.

 

Concert Programme

16th February 2012

St. Sepulchre Church, London EC1A 9DE

 

‘CELLO Jamie Walton

CONDUCTOR Adam Johnson

The Northern Lights Symphony Orchestra

 

JOHN BARRY A Childhood Memory (arr. Johnson) with Bow School  

ELGAR – Cello Concerto in E Minor Op. 85

SIBELIUS – Symphony No. 5

 

The NLSO is proud to welcome back to the stage, critically acclaimed cellist, Jamie Walton. Described by The Strad as “One of the true greats”, Jamie will be perform the extremely well-loved Elgar Cello Concerto, the recent recording of which won him 5 star ratings in national and international press. We are also delighted to welcome a choir formed from Bow School Bow School , who will form part of a rare performance of John Barry’s A Childhood Memory.

With the vast soundscapes of Sibelius’ Symphony No. 5, this concert will is sure to be a tremendous evening.

 

 

History

 

Formed in 2007, The Northern Lights Symphony Orchestra presents professional concerts at the highest level, offering valuable playing experience to young professional musicians who have trained in the leading conservatoires around the world. We are unique in our specialisation in repertoire of composers born within the Northern Lights

(Aurora Borealis) region, and our innovative programming includes composers from these territories alongside other orchestral works. So far our concerts have spanned the orchestral repertoire from Sibelius and Grieg, to Mozart, Arvo Pärt and Philip Glass. Soloists who have performed with the orchestra include Jack Liebeck, Jamie Walton, Martin Roscoe and clarinettist Emma Johnson MBE.

 

Education

The NLSO is proud to have recently acquired Association with Bow School for Maths and Computing. Our Mission is to provide intensive in-school Musical Educational Workshops which will enhance the learning of the Students by introduction and teaching of the various components of orchestral musicianship, classical music and integration into our rehearsals with the NLSO.

 

 

The Northern Lights Symphony Orchestra is a private limited company (Companies House No. 7031460) and is a registered Charity (Charity Commission No. 1136322). We can receive any donation payable by CAF Voucher from a Charity or Trust.


How does IndieGoGo Work?

 

It's simple! With IndieGoGo you can donate to the NLSO from anywhere in the world. You can contribute by selecting the amount you wish to give (in US Dollars) and clicking on "CONTRIBUTE NOW". We have a few donation suggestions, complete with perks - see right. You can use your credit card to make your donation.

Any amount you contribute will be helpful, and every bit goes towards our goal. THANK YOU!

 

How can I spread the word about the NLSO?

 

Help us spread the word by sharing this link www.indiegogo.com/northernlightsorchestra with your friends and collegues. Come along to our next concert. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

story:
Who We Are: EVERYPEOPLE WORKSHOP is a Chicago-based, multimedia performance community devoted to the development of new works of musical and visual art. EVERYPEOPLE was founded in 2009 by musicians/composers Mikel Patrick Avery, Nicholas Gajewski and Nick Mazzarella, who set out to create a body of musical compositions, recordings, choreography, paintings, films and photographs while promoting arts awareness that spans the diverse communities that are vital to Chicago’s makeup. In just three years EPW has produced four albums, created over 60 compositions, prompted collaboration from over 20 artists, created an original score for the acclaimed performance of A Bronzeville Ballet, made 4 short films and performed nearly 75 live concerts.

 

We want to provide a perspective unique to Chicago’s current art environment, structured around a core group of member artists devoted to the development of new works of music, dance and visual art. The members invite artistic contributions from Chicago’s diverse neighborhoods to promote multimedia collaboration through public showcases and recordings.

 

Our Project: Part of our regular programming is a monthly performance series called EVERYPEOPLE 2nd WEDNESDAYS. 2ND WEDNESDAYS was created in 2011 to serve as a platform for projects produced by the EVERYPEOPLE WORKSHOP. Each performance features a project that is led and directed by a member artist of EVERYPEOPLE, showcasing original music and visual works. 2nd Wednesdays is currently hosted at Village Records in Chicago and is free and open to the public.

 

What We Need: We are in need of your help to make sure the 2ND WEDNESDAYS series continues throughout the 2012-2013 season. Your contribution will help serve the components necessary to make this programming available, including:

 

                  • Space Rental   

                  • Booking, Management and Promotions      

                  • Advertisement

                  • Documentation                  

                  • Artist Fees

 

With your support, EVERYPEOPLE WORKSHOP hopes to reach our goal of $20,000 to secure a full year’s worth of programming for the 2ND WEDNESDAYS series. Your tax-deductible donations will help promote:

-  Collaboration among artists of different disciplines who represent otherwise disparate neighborhoods and artistic communities

-  Creation of new works of art that are not confined by genre but challenge artists to create in honest and meaningful ways

-   Commitment to Chicago artists of all ages by developing opportunities for cross-generational collaboration

-  Growth, communication and new perspectives in our artistic dialogue

- Accessibility of arts programming to diverse audiences and communities from Chicago's neighborhoods

 

YOUR DONATION IS FULLY TAX DEDUCTIBLE

 

For questions, you may contact Aaron Shapiro at aaron.epw@gmail.com. We encourage you to visit www.everypeopleworkshop.org for more information about the company and updates on our current projects.

 

We thank you for your time and continued support,

 

-EVERYPEOPLE WORKSHOP

story:
MUSIC VIDEO FOR OUR SONG 'AEROBIC RIDER'

We are vonLewald, a singing-songwriting electronica pop trio from Berlin.

We are Nicolas de Leval Jezierski on vocals, guitar, and visuals; John One and Joseph Turner on keyboards, percussion, and electronics. We write and produce our music, do are own design, create visuals for our live shows and programmed our website. We are a hard-working, ambitious band, and try to do as much as we can ourselves â€“ but for our next milestone, we need some support.


Together with dedicated and talented director Alex Forge, we will get together a great crew with which we will be able to produce, shoot and edit a great video.




WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Should you choose to contribute, your financial support will go directly towards the production of our video for the song "Aerobic Rider". This includes: Equipment rental, actors, location costs, set construction, makeup, transportation, catering and post production.  

â€¨

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: 

Help by spreading the word. Ever single person you tell about this, is another step closer to our goal.


Check out our website 

www.vonlewald.com


Find us on Facebook
www.facebook.com/vonlewald


Find us on Soundcloud
www.soundcloud.com/vonlewald


Check out Alex Forge's website

www.alexforge.com




HEAR US PLAY! 

Sunday, January 1

LIVE on 98.8 KISSFM/ GretelFM

turn on your radio at 7:15 pm


Tuesday, January 17

LIVE at Waschhaus Potsdam 

9:00 pm

http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?318111


Thank you so much for your support and taking the time to check us out!  

We can't wait to shoot a great music video! We'll keep you posted.

 


Nick, John and Joseph

story:
Friends,

We've spent the better part of the past 2 years writing, rehearsing, and recording 10 songs for our 2nd album, "Plush Up". We've put a lot of love and effort into this project, and now it's time to bring the album to life. We couldn't be more excited about this.

We've set up this Indiegogo campaign to help us raise money for the mixing, mastering and production phases of this project, which - even on our carefully-monitored budget - is going to cost over $5,000. 

Reaching this goal would take an enormous amount of pressure off each of us and our families. Despite the high costs of recording an album, we feel compelled to pursue our dream of completing this project sharing it with you — our friends, community, and fans. Thank you so much for considering a donation.

The Cost Breakdown:

We've committed a significant amount of our own money to this project, and are asking for your help in reaching these remaining costs, which are critical to the outcome of the album:

  • Mixing: $3,250
  • Mastering: $900
  • CD production & replication: $1,000
  • Total: $5,150

What This Means to Us

The 4 of us have invested a lot of time and money into our band, and though the money part can be challenging, we couldn't be more dedicated to Marble Party. Our goal is to create music that we're truly proud of, and hopefully, something you will deeply enjoy.

So we're here to ask your help in bringing this album to life by contributing what you can. It’s all in the name of being able to bring better music right back to our community, friends, and fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution helps and is so greatly appreciated! If you're unable to help financially, there are still ways you can support this project:

  • Help us spread the word and share this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools, or spread the word on Facebook.

Our sincerest thanks,

Eric, Dan, Greg, Andy

story:
Photo Credit: [http://utmostcreative.com/]

What happened?!

On the evening of August 16th 2013, just 1 day after the APU chapel band retreat, where the instruments were being used, Corey's car was stolen. 

The car was retrieved the next day, but quite a bit of valuable gear was stolen and not recovered.

Much of the gear was borrowed. 

With a large insurance deductible, we are left paying for replacement instruments out of pocket. We simply cannot afford any of these items. 

What Was Taken?

Here's a list of the stolen goods

  • James Brooks' banjo (Talmage)
  • The Wild Reeds Harmonium & Road Case
  • Natalie Nicoles' Glockenspiel (Branches)
  • James & Corey's 3 violin bows

Financial Breakdown

Long story short: This is our job and without our instruments we can't work and pay our bills. All of these instruments are vital parts to the bands affected and we wouldn't be asking for your help if we didn't really need it!

Banjo (Brand - Goodtime) - $400 instrument (includes pickup and installation) 
Harmonium (no distinct branding) - $300 instrument  + $100 shipping = $400.00
Glockenspiel (Rhythm Band 25 Note Chromatic Bells) - $87.00 (free shipping)
Three Violin Bows (Gard's Music) - $29.00 + $29.00 + $29.00 = $87.00

Total: $974.00 + Indie Go Go Fees = $1,065.00

What happens if we get overfunded? 

We bless these musicians for letting us borrow these things, being understanding, and for unintentionally involving them in this mess!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate (even a dolla billz would help!) then spread the word so we can get these instruments back to their owners.

story:
The Mission

The Bonazzoli Band has been playing live and releasing albums since the late 1980's.  It's time to take their sound to the next level and promote their music to a national audience.  

How You Can Help

We're trying to raise money to give our seventh album a proper release.  We've always been a self funded band with limited exposure and that has kept us relatively unknown nationally even with our local popularity.   By a "proper release" we mean a quality CD and digital album, music videos to promote it and a marketing budget to advertise and build on our success.

We've set out some great perks from copies of the album, credits on the album artwork, live performances and music lessons from the band and more.  

Regardless if we reach our funding goal or not, every penny raised will still go into the production and release of the new album.  We will get this album finished and on the market as soon as possible.

The Results

Have you ever wondered what's new in music?  What's out there that could get people of all ages excited?  Well, you can be a part of something big.  The Bonazzoli Band combines the best of 20th century music: Rock, swing, blues, country and gospel into an amazing new sound that almost everyone can enjoy.

This current album has been a 25 year journey.  The new album is called American Ghost Stories and it is a follow up to our 2010 release Quiet Little Towns.  Although our last album was critically praised and well received by fans the band was beset by tragedy with the loss of two band members during it's long production and early tour and this led to a fragmented release at best.  We hope to honor all of those people who have helped us out along the way with a proper release for this album and the upcoming singles.

Your support is very much appreciated.  

Even if you can't contribute yourself you can help us out by getting the word out about our band and our sound and what we're trying to accomplish.  

Again, thank you for your help and support,

Matthew Bonazzoli

The Mission
The Bonazzoli Band has been playing live and releasing albums since the late 1980's.  It's time to take their sound to the next level and promote their music to a national audience.  



How You Can Help
We're trying to raise money to give our seventh album a proper release.  We've always been a self funded band with limited exposure and that has kept us relatively unknown nationally even with our local popularity.   By a "proper release" we mean a quality CD and digital album, music videos to promote it and a marketing budget to advertise and build on our success.
We've set out some great perks from copies of the album, credits on the album artwork, live performances and music lessons from the band and more.  
Regardless if we reach our funding goal or not, every penny raised will still go into the production and release of the new album.  We will get this album finished and on the market as soon as possible.


The Results
Have you ever wondered what's new in music?  What's out there that could get people of all ages excited?  Well, you can be a part of something big.  The Bonazzoli Band combines the best of 20th century music: Rock, swing, blues, country and gospel into an amazing new sound that almost everyone can enjoy.

This current album has been a 25 year journey.  The new album is called American Ghost Stories and it is a follow up to our 2010 release Quiet Little Towns.  Although our last album was critically praised and well received by fans the band was beset by tragedy with the loss of two band members during it's long production and early tour and this led to a fragmented release at best.  We hope to honor all of those people who have helped us out along the way with a proper release for this album and the upcoming singles.
Your support is very much appreciated.  
Even if you can't contribute yourself you can help us out by getting the word out about our band and our sound and what we're trying to accomplish.  
Again, thank you for your help and support,
Matthew Bonazzoli

story:
El Projecto / The Project

Somos 6 musicoterapeutas recién graduadas de Berklee College of Music apoyadas por dos musicoterapeutas con mas de 20 años de experiencia. Estaremos en Guadalajara, México del 28 de Octubre al 1 de Noviembre para dar sesiones gratis de musicoterapia con la intención de promocionar la musicoterapia médica en Guadalajara.

La musicoterapia es un medio clínico no invasivo, familiar y predecible que se basa en la preferencia musical y necesidades del paciente para trabajar en objetivos y metas de varios dominios. Es accesible para individuos de todas las edades y varios diagnósticos. Es basada en la evidencia de las intervenciones musicales, buscando lograr metas individuales dentro de una relación terapéutica por un profesional acreditado.

En Estados Unidos cuentan con la Asociación de Musicoterapia de los Estados Unidos (AMTA), la cual se encarga de publicar investigaciones, apoyar la musicoterapia a nivel estatal y federal, promocionar la musicoterapia a travéz de los medios de comunicación social, entre otras cosas.

Actualmente en México la musicoterapia no cuenta con ninguna asociación que la apoye, y la musicoterapia médica es poco conocida. El propósito de este proyecto es darla a conocer y promoverla en hospitales públicos y privados para abrir paso a la musicoterapia en México.

Te invitamos a ver nuesta página con mas información: http://musicoterapiamx.yolasite.com/

 

 

We are 6 music therapists who just graduated from Berklee College of Music, and 2 music therapists with over 20 years of experience. We'll be in Guadalajara, Mexico from October 28th to November 1st to give free music therapy sessions to promote medical music therapy in Guadalajara.

Music therapy is the clinical, non-invasive, familiar and predictable use of music that uses the patient's needs and musical preference to work on goals and objectives of various domains. It is accesible to invididuals of all ages and different diagnoses, and is based on the evidence of musical interventions that aim to reach individual goals within a therapeutic relationship between a patient and a credentialed professional.

In the United States, the American Music Therapy Association (AMTA) serves as an advocate for music therapy on the state and federal laws, promotes music therapy through social media streams, publishes two research journals, among other things.

At the moment, music therapy in Mexico doesn't have the support of any association and medical music therapy is not a known intervention. The goal of this project is to introduce it to the medical community in public and private hospitals as a way to open the road for music therapy in Mexico.

We invite you to see our website with more information: http://musicoterapiamx.yolasite.com/

 

Qué Necesitamos y Cómo Nos Puedes Ayudar /
 What We Need and How You Can Help

Como el propósito de este proyecto es promocionar la musicoterapia, todas las sesiones que daremos serán gratuitas, sin embargo tenemos varios gastos que cubrir. Los principales costos vienen de los vuelos (ya que vendrán musicoterapeutas de Boston, Los Angeles y Chicago), el hospedaje, el transporte a los hospitales y la comida.

Con tu apoyo podremos hacer esta gira de musicoterapia y puedes escoger entre varios beneficios que creamos para agradecerte. Puedes escoger entre un agradecimiento, una postal, un recuerdo de México, canciones que grabaremos, recetas de comida mexicana de la abuela de Dany, clases por Skype, una piñata hecha a mano, y el gran paquete que lo incluye todo!

Todo el dinero que juntemos aquí será utilizado para los gastos del viaje, los cuales completaremos planeando varios eventos en las distintas cuidades en donde estamos.

 

 

Since the goal of this project is to promote music therapy, all the sessions we give will be free, but we still have to cover our expenses. Our biggest expenses come from the flights (since the team of music therapists will be flying in from Boston, Chicago and Los Angeles), housing, transportation, and food.

With your support we'll be able to do this service trip and you can choose between various perks that we created to thank you. You can choose between a Shout out, a postcard, a souvenir, songs that we'll record, Mexican recipes courtesy of Dany's grandmother, Skype lessons, homemade piñatas, and the big package that includes everything!

All the money we raise will be used for our expenses, for which we will do additional fundraising in the different cities we are in.

 

¡Gracias! / Thank you!

Durante los últimos años, varias personas del equipo han participado en viajes de servicio social de musicoterapia a las Islas Caimán (en tres ocasiones), Panamá y Atenas, Grecia. Todos estos viajes han sido posibles gracias al apoyo de gente como tú que creyó en estos proyectos. ¡Gracias!

Por favor considera compartir este proyecto con tus familiares y amigos poniéndolo en tu muro en Facebook, Twitter y platicándoles en persona mientras les invitas un café.

 

 

Over the last couple of years, people from the team have participated in different music therapy service trips to the Cayman Islands (in 3 occasions), Panamá and Athens, Greece. All these trips have been funded with the support of people like you who believed in these projects. Thank you!

Please consider sharing with your families and friends by posting it on Facebook, Twitter, and talking to them about it in person over coffee!

story:
The interesting thing as that for most of our lives and long before we ever met each other we've all shared the similar feeling; that all good music comes from the heart regardless of genre. It's for that very reason that we are blessed and lucky to have found each other and even more blessed and lucky to have had the opportunity to have met and entertained so many of you that have reached out to us and shown us support online. Our journey thus far has taken us on many adventures/twists and turns but it's our passion and absolute love for what we do that made it such a pleasure to tour and play cities such as:
Las Vegas, Prescott and Tempe AZ,San Francisco, Oakland, San Diego, Lancaster, Anaheim, Diamond Bar, Eugene, Salem and Portland Or, as well as Seattle and Bellingham wa.
We are Til All Is One and our philosophy is the same as the name suggests. It's about unification and solidarity and just basically doing and playing what feels right, regardless of typical molds.
With every place that we've played and seen as well as the people that we've met along the way we've grown and changed as a band; as is the rule of experience. The point is to keep trudging the road and gaining more and more experience and in turn sharing the joy of creating this music with all of you.
We've recently downsized to a three piece unit but in many ways it's spawned a rebirth and a revitalization of the band- Getting back to basics while at the same time continuing to expand our collaborative and creative efforts.
This new ep which is slated to be aptly titled "Trifecta", is a culmination of all of the ebb and flow of our journey as a band and we want you to help be a part of it. The record will be produced by the Prolific Mr. Danny Balistocky (revolution 9 studios Hollywood ca) and we couldn't be more excited to work with him. We have already begun the pre-production proceedings which tipped us off to the fact that we work really well with Danny. We truly believe that this will be our greatest sonic effort to date and to be able to share this experience with our friends, fans and family will make this record all the more special. It's a safe bet to say that this ep will fully represent the multidimensional level of songwriting, musical influences, and even some of our quirky humor and spirit. All we ask is that you find it in your hearts (and a little bit in your wallets as well) to continue on showing us the support you have in past times and to help us fund this labor of love. We have a slew of different incentives!!.. and of course the larger the donation the greater the reward. So please help us reach our goal of 3k and let's get this upcoming EP playing in the headphones of anyone with a working set of eardrums. If you are unable to contribute that is ok, please spread the word of our campaign and share with your friends. Thanks Again!

story:
Dave's Story

The jazz flutist and Grammy winner Dave Valentin (Music & Art, 1970) has toured the world as a headliner, playing with everyone from Tito Puente to McCoy Tyner. He started playing Latin percussion at the age of 5 and began performing professionally at 11. Dave has studied with Hubert Laws, Harold Bennett and Harold Jones.

After a career that would be envied by many, Dave is now mostly alone in his modest home of 59 years.  A stroke in 2012 left him paralyzed on his right side and though he is now walking and has recovered about 85 percent of his dexterity, he cannot yet practice or play. He requires an attendant, gets food from Meals on Wheels, and is finding it difficult to make ends meet. Like many other artists of his generation, most of his income came from playing onstage and royalties hardly cover his living expenses.  Without any financial assistance he will leave the only neighborhood he has known and find new housing.

For more about him, please read this New York Times article. A feature was also recently written up in the Times updating Dave's condition. You can find it here.

What We Need

Dave has become a well-known and loved figure in his neighborhood in the Bronx, where he's lived his whole life. We want to help him stay in his home where he has a strong support network in his community. He will need $25,000 to cover rent, utilities and medical expenses.

Throughout his career, Dave has given back to kids in the South Bronx, his community and elsewhere teaching Latin jazz to inner city kids and gang members. His work and dedication influenced many children to continue their education and he feels very proud to be a part of what they have accomplished. Dave has been an extraordinary role model, and always felt that it is up to people in his position to make a change. Now it’s our turn to give back to Dave.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page with your friends, fellow high school alumni and neighbors - anyone who you think could help Dave get through this difficult time. Thank you so much!

story:
Introduction
  • Dhwani Academy is a non-profit charitable organization established First in Kolkata, India about 12 years back and then in Los Angeles on 2004. Dhwani Academy was established by celebrated Tabla Player, composer and musician Abhijit Banerjee (www.abhijitbanerjee.com). Dhwani’s primary aim is promoting Indian traditional classical music throughout the world.
  • Besides its normal music classes, zonal concerts in the villages and suburbs of India and research work, Dhwani has been teaching the visually challenged students who want to learn and pursue music seriously free of cost. The academy started with class with few students in the evening after school hours at Calcutta Blind School. This was not included in the usual school curriculum of Calcutta Blind School. Now it has grown to the extent that Dhwani has started music curriculum there. The academy has appointed a regular teacher to take classes 5 days a week. Besides teaching Dhwani donates musical instruments, maintains them, give scholarships to best six students of the year. Now some of the students who have passed the school have taken tabla as their major in the colleges and takes classes from Dhwani’s own institute. 
  • Dhwani conducts regular classes in Los Angeles and New York, U.S.A to keep our great tradition alive amongst the new generation of Indian kids and also spread our tradition amongst those who are not aware of it. Dhwani yearly does several concerts in different dimensions to give platform and encourage the upcoming students and aspirants in U.S.A.

INNERSIGHT: This is one of the major projects that Dhwani (both INDIA and USA) has been pursuing since its inception. As been already stated that Dhwani has been working with the visually challenged students in different dimension and direction starting from regular classes to give them scholarships and platform and encouraging and helping them to learn music in their life, Innersight is the project which involves

1. Printing of Indian musical notations in Braille system. The work is already started and some portions of a Tabla book are already printed. As it is successful and liked by the students Dhwani Academy wants to print books of music and with Indian type musical notations in Braille.

2. Bring total 20 Students each year under the scheme of scholarship and increase the amount to Rs.5000/- per year (right now 12 students are paid Rs.3,000/- per year).

3. To give them placement. For that Dhwani wants to open a teaching system where visually challenged students will teach to earn money.  Dhwani also wants to start a studio of its own which will be run commercially to generate financial for support for the sustenance of project INNERSIGHT.

Dhwani Academy’s primary aim is to publish the book which is for free distribution to all libraries and schools dealing with Visually challenged students. Dhwani wants to print important music notation books such as BHATKHANDE (VI) volumes, Notation of TAGORE Songs. Its important for all of us since the success of this will motivate our volunteers and our committee members to move forward with the Third phase of the project.

Since Dhwani has been giving scholarships for last 10 years and has also started printing books, we can feel the magnitude of this work. We want to extend the work to bring it to the advantage of more under privileged Visually challenged students.

Remember that not all visually challenged students are under privileged but in a country like India, if a kid is visually challenged and coming from a poor family, mere academic studies becomes hard to pursue for him and his family so art and music becomes far reached dream for them.

Any contribution towards the project INNERSIGHT will be of immense help for the organization to provide following items to the aspired Visually challenged students.

1.  Increase number of recipients’ scholarships. (Recipients names will be declared and updated in the website.)

2.  To provide more musical instruments to students (will be updated in the website with photographs)

3.  An Immense help for printing Braille Notation books of Music. The main fund is needed for carrying on this project and free distribution of books. This project is an ongoing process and more books will be added in our list of printable books for free distribution.

4.  In our future center of Art and Music, To build a section for Visually Challenged Students for using of Library of Music CDs ( which can also be accessed by common interested people) and make a studio run by visually challenged towards attaining  self-sufficiency  for taking up and carrying on more projects.

Our excptation and our offerings

We have a budget of total US $28000 for two years project. We collected $9000 from private donations. Out of remaining $19000 we are expecting to collect $7000 from our well wishers, our personal contributions and some fund raising concerts during this year. We are giving the amount which we have kept hoping that we can raise from Indiegogo.

Students Scholarship (20 students Rs. 3,000/- each)    $ 968

Maintenance of Instruments yearly    $ 1,200

Braille Book      $ 2,518

Teacher’s Remuneration (@ 3,700/- per month each for 3 teachers)  $ 2,160

4 Workshops @ Rs. 20,000/- per workshop  $ 1,280

6 Zonal Concerts @ Rs. 45,000/- per concert  $ 4,355

Total    $ 12,481

We expect to raise this fund. We would like to acknowledge Indiegogo and donors of this project and would like to send a receipt for tax exemption as we are a 501.c 3 organization.

Those who are in Los Angeles area or Southern California are welcome to join our any organizational concerts throughout the year. For updated information kindly log on to our website and give us your email so that we can send you newsletter about stating the development of the projects (though it will be regularly update in our website). The most important part is that we would like to gift two books to anybody referred by the donor only at the cost of postage as the books will be going from India.

Any donation, any amount would help us to reach the goal or near to goal. If we get an excess of fund, that will be kept for continuation of this project since this project has been running for last 10 years and will be running for more developments in different sectors.

Other ways to support

Even spreading the word of our work or volunteer for this is also a very big help to us. To make people aware of our effort of spreading Music and working with Visually Challenged is a great help to us. Writing about our work in your known places or any press coverage are also of a great help to spread this word out and to carry on our work.

Thanks a Lot.

Abhijit Banerjee

Director, Secretary, Principal

Dhwani Academy of Percussion Music

(U.S.A and India)

www.dhwaniacademy.net

challenged students are under privileged but in a country like India, if a kid is
visually challenged and coming from a poor family, mere academic studies
becomes hard to pursue for him and his family so art and music becomes far
reached dream for them.
Any contribution towards the project
INNERSIGHT will be of immense help for the organization to provide following
items to the aspired Visually challenged students.
1.  Increase number of recipients’ scholarships. (Recipients
names will be declared and updated in the website.)
2.  To provide more musical instruments to students (will be
updated in the website with photographs)
3.  An Immense help for printing Braille Notation books of
Music. The main fund is needed for carrying on this project and free
distribution of books. This project is an ongoing process and more books will
be added in our list of printable books for free distribution.
4.  In our future center of Art and Music, To build a section
for Visually Challenged Students for using of Library of Music CDs ( which can
also be accessed by common interested people) and make a studio run by visually
challenged towards attaining 
self-sufficiency  for taking up
and carrying on more projects.Our excptation and our offerings
We have a budget of total US $28000
for two years project. We collected $9000 from private donations. Out of
remaining $19000 we are expecting to collect $7000 from our well wishers, our
personal contributions and some fund raising concerts during this year. We are
giving the amount which we have kept hoping that we can raise from Indiegogo. 
Students Scholarship (20 students
Rs. 3,000/- each)    $ 968 
Maintenance of Instruments yearly    $
1,200
Braille Book      $
2,518
Teacher’s Remuneration (@ 3,700/-
per month each for 3 teachers)  $ 2,160
4 Workshops @ Rs. 20,000/- per
workshop  $
1,280
6 Zonal Concerts @ Rs. 45,000/- per
concert  $
4,355
Total    $ 12,481
We expect to raise this fund. We would like to
acknowledge Indiegogo and donors of this project and would like to send a receipt
for tax exemption as we are a 501.c 3 organization.
Those who are in Los Angeles area or
Southern California are welcome to join our any organizational concerts
throughout the year. For updated information kindly log on to our website and
give us your email so that we can send you newsletter about stating the
development of the projects (though it will be regularly update in our
website). The most important part is that we would like to gift two books to
anybody referred by the donor only at the cost of postage as the books will be
going from India. 
Any donation, any amount would help
us to reach the goal or near to goal. If we get an excess of fund, that will be
kept for continuation of this project since this project has been running for
last 10 years and will be running for more developments in different sectors.
Other ways to supportEven spreading the word of our work
or volunteer for this is also a very big help to us. To make people aware of
our effort of spreading Music and working with Visually Challenged is a great
help to us. Writing about our work in your known places or any press coverage
are also of a great help to spread this word out and to carry on our work.
Thanks a Lot.
Abhijit Banerjee
Director, Secretary, PrincipalDhwani Academy of Percussion Music(U.S.A and India)www.dhwaniacademy.net

story:
Short Summary

After working harder than I have ever worked in my life during my time after The Voice of Germany, I spent EVERY dime I made on making the first CD, a Video of the Single, the musicians' salaries, the producer, the studio, the artwork, the tour in 2012 and and and! It was SO hard, but it was worth it to get my own music out there the way I wanted to without a recording company, which is the way it should be for artists these days. I am very happy I did it all on my own, but those costs added up! I had some successes and made some mistakes. And I learned from them all!

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is a budget to finish producing some NEW TRACKS and some NEW VERSIONS of some of the songs on the present album, NEVER SHUPT UP! which have never been heard! Luckily I am already in demo-stage with some of the songs which are sounding much better than the present album! One of the new tracks called, "Fixing You", I will be singing with my friend and colleague, Elen Wendt (also 1st season of The Voice of Germany), an AMAZING singer who also was able to fund her album here on INDIEGOGO through her many followers, friends and fans!

I am also looking for help to fund the upcoming Tour as those costs can be crazy! I have to make sure we have a rehearsal space, transportation, food, hotels or MOTELS and gas money. Sometimes one has to 'rent' the venue out as well which is the biggest cost! I have a couple of clubs in Germany which will do a 'door' split with me, but most clubs do not work as easy as this...

The Impact

People who contribute to my New project can help in so many ways! Some of us don't have the budget really to do more than buy a CD when it is released! I know myself not too far in the past, when there was NO money for music, and sometimes not even enough to buy food! :-)  But spreading the word and posting and reposting to your friends and colleagues who might like what I do will help me as well! The support here would keep my music moving and growing and keep me on the tour and nearer to my fans who are as much part of my music world as my music itself, and for that I thank you!!

story:
Check out the video we've crowdsourced from friends and fans around the world! We hope you like it and want to be part of 'One Of These Days'.

 Versión en español más abajo

Please share our campaign with your friends: 
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/yossarian-one-of-these-days

The 'One Of These Days' campaign

In 2012, thanks to your help and generous crowdfunding contributions, we recorded our debut album, 'The Little We Know' after a successful Indiegogo campaign. We hope that if you are reading this it means you enjoyed the album and you believe that the money you invested in us was well spent. In case you need a reminder of our music, here’s our award winning video for God Gamble:


We are now ready to record our second album (hooray!). As mentioned above, our campaign target is £6,000. This money will help us cover two thirds of the costs for the project. This includes recording, mixing and mastering the album; printing CDs, T-shirts and tote bags, as well as pressing the album in glorious vinyl.

What You Get in return: 'One Of These Days' T-Shirts, Vinyl, CDs, Tote bags !!!

We've listened to your comments from our previous campaign and this time we’ve included perks featuring T-shirts and tote bags. By popular demand, for passionate music fans and collectors we’re going to print vinyl albums; and for those who'd like something graceful to adorn their living room wall, we will be preparing a framed Yossarian signed vinyl record as part of the Platinum Package. There are also 2 original paintings available as well the opportunity to pick a song for us to record if you're feeling particularly generous. You’ll find all the perks detailed in the column on the right. 

Just as we did with our previous campaign, the names of absolutely everyone who contributes will have their name featured within the album sleeve.

Additional Perks & Requests

We will be adding new perks during the course of the campaign and we would also be delighted to hear from you regarding any particular perk requests you may have. We aim to be as accommodating as possible, even if you'd like us to play a gig in your living room.

This is how the T-shirts and tote bags may look:


This is how the framed vinyl may look:

These paintings were created exclusively for our debut album 'The Little We Know' in 2012. They are the only 2 that remain from the original 10. As well as sending you these beautiful paintings, we will also send you a set of 10 art prints from our debut album campaign in addition of course to all of the other perks available as part of this current campaign.



Cost breakdown:


Release Date: Spring/Summer 2015 

We learnt a lot during the recording of our debut album in 2012 and will be using that experience during this project to ensure that we have 'One Of These Days' completed and ready for your listening pleasure by next summer. 

Thanks for your support and please get in touch if you have any questions.

Yossarian x

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Versión en español

Yossarian necesita recaudar £6,000 para grabar su segundo álbum, 'One of These Days'. 

¡Mira al principio de la página el nuevo vídeo de la campaña que hemos hecho con la ayuda de nuestros fans y amigos de alrededor del mundo! Esperamos que te guste y que quieras formar parte de 'One Of These Days'.

Comparte la campaña con tus amigos: 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/yossarian-on...

La campaña de 'One Of These Days'

En 2012, gracias a tu ayuda y generosidad grabamos nuestro álbum debut, 'The Little We Know', luego de una completar una exitosa campaña de crowd-funding en Indiegogo. Esperamos que si estás leyendo esto es porque disfrutaste de nuestro álbum y crees que el dinero que contribuiste fue una buena inversión. Si necesitas una ayudita para recordar nuestra música, aquí tienes el galardonado vídeo animado de God Gamble:


Ahora estamos listos para grabar nuestro segundo álbum (¡hurra!). Como mencionamos más arriba, el objetivo de la campaña es recaudar £6,000. Este dinero nos ayudará a cubrir dos tercios del coste del proyecto. El dinero será destinado a grabar, mezclar y masterizar el álbum; enviar a hacer los CDs, camisetas y bolsas de tela, y también para grabar el álbum en vinilo.

Lo que recibes a cambio: ¡Camisetas, vinilo, CDs, bolsas de tela de 'One of These Days'!

Luego de escuchar las sugerencias que nos hicieron sobre la primera campaña, hemos decidido incluir camisetas y bolsas de tela especialmente creadas para el álbum. Por demanda popular, para los apasionados de la música y coleccionistas vamos a grabar el álbum en vinilo; y para aquellos que quieren gastar algo más de dinero para decorar su casa vamos a preparar vinilos enmarcados y firmados. También tenemos dos pinturas originales disponibles de nuestra anterior campaña, así como la oportunidad de elegir la canción que tu quieras para que grabemos, si alguien se siente especialmente generoso. 

Debido a que en la columna de la izquierda solo podemos poner los detalles de las opciones de contribución en inglés, las explicamos en español a continuación:

£5 - Digital Download - descarga digital

La versión digital del álbum. Te la enviamos dos semanas antes del lanzamiento e incluimos tu nombre en el CD y vinilo + nuestras gracias infinitas

£20 - BRONZE PACKAGE - CD firmado

El álbum en CD firmado por la banda. También te enviamos la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

£50 - SILVER PACKAGE - Camiseta y bolsa de tela

Camiseta edición limitada diseñada para este álbum (todos los tamaños disponibles, podrás elegirlo al terminar la campaña) + una bolsa de tela edición limitada diseñada para este álbum + el CD + la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

£75 - GOLD PACKAGE - El Vinilo

Edición limitada del álbum en vinilo de 12 pulgadas + camiseta y bolsa de tela + el CD + la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

£150 - PLATINIUM PACKAGE - Vinilo enmarcado.

Edición limitada del álbum en vinilo enmarcado y firmado por la banda, para decoración + el vinilo adicional (para escuchar) + camiseta y bolsa de tela + el CD + la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

Painting No. 1 : "2 Cubed" (ver la pintura más abajo)

Esta pintura fue creada por la artista Citlali Mercer exclusivamente para nuestro álbum debut 'The Little We Know'. Es solo 1 de las 2 que quedan de una serie de 10 pinturas. Además de la pintura te enviaremos el vinilo enmarcado de decoración + el vinilo adicional (para escuchar) + camiseta y bolsa de tela + el CD + la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

Painting No. 2 : "Hola!" (ver la pintura más abajo)

Esta pintura fue creada por la artista Citlali Mercer exclusivamente para nuestro álbum debut 'The Little We Know'. Es solo 1 de las 2 que quedan de una serie de 10 pinturas. Además de la pintura te enviaremos el vinilo enmarcado de decoración + el vinilo adicional (para escuchar) + camiseta y bolsa de tela + el CD + la versión digital y tu nombre en el CD y vinilo.

Como hicimos en la campaña de nuestro primer álbum, vamos a poner los nombres de todas las personas que contribuyan en álbum en la caja del CD y el vinilo.

Opciones extras y Peticiones

Vamos a añadir otras opciones de contribución durante la campaña y nos gustaría que nos digas si tienes alguna petición especial. Intentaremos incluir todas las preferencias, incluso si quieres que toquemos un concierto en tu sala de estar.

Éstos pueden ser los diseños de las camisetas y las bolsas de tela:


Éste puede ser el diseño del vinilo enmarcado:

Éstas son las pinturas creadas por la artista Citlali Mercer exclusivamente para nuestro álbum debut 'The Little We Know'. Son las únicas 2 que quedan de una serie de 10 pinturas. 

El desglose de los costos:

Fecha de lanzamiento: Mayo de 2015

Aprendimos mucho cuando grabamos nuestro álbum debut en 2012 y utilizaremos ese aprendizaje durante este proyecto para asegurarnos de que 'One of These Days' esté listo para que puedas disfrutarlo el próximo verano.
Gracias por tu apoyo, y si tienes alguna pregunta ponte en contacto con nosotros.

Yossarian x

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
After several years of Mountain Sky Festivals, Concerts, Camping and Creativity, we decided to develop a state of the art Mountain Sky Internet Radio Station simply for the profound love and desire for the Northeastern Pennsylvania music scene. Through combining this passion with the strengths, volunteers and abilities utilized in our current festival work, we created a new vision for the future of Mountain Sky.  A way to interact with our friends, family, patrons and music lovers of all ages. 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.  Mountain Sky Internet Radio!

In order to achieve these goals, we need your help!  Well, we need some legal tender!  We have a lofty goal of $10,000.00.  This will provide the costs for the equipment we'll need for our internet radio journey!

By helping us achieve this goal, you'll be a major contributor to bringing original local music to the masses - a way to better advertise our future festivals by spreading the message of our new music venue, 

Mountain Sky has escalated its business year after year and there are many reasons for that.  One being lots of elbow grease!  Not to say there aren't many struggles we currently endure.  But with the hard work of our volunteers and the vision of our owners we know we can grow our internet radio station to amazing heights!  We want this to be a place to keep informed of the local music scene, but also make it a place to shift focus away from the big fat cat radio stations.  We will focus on the local music scene, our future festivals, weekly local band interviews, live on air band recordings, local weather and local news announcements to name a few.  Yes, we will run commercials and generate ad revenue from local businesses and establishments.  The businesses in our own backyard!

Become a part of our new team!  Feel the pride by being a part of funding a new and exciting journey for the Mountain Sky Family!

There are many risks and challenges for our new internet radio venture.  We have a dedicated team of professionals who have been in the radio broadcast field for many years.  We have the tools!  We need the seeds!  Help us on our journey!!

Thank you from the Mountain Sky Family. 

Check out all of the cool perks you'll receive with your donation today.  Please spread the word! 

See you at one of our festivals and keep your ears out for Mountain Sky Internet Radio!!!

After several years of Mountain
Sky Festivals, Concerts, Camping and Creativity, we decided to develop a state
of the art Mountain Sky Internet Radio Station simply for the profound love and
desire for the Northeastern Pennsylvania music scene. Through combining this
passion with the strengths, volunteers and abilities utilized in our current
festival work, we created a new vision for the future of Mountain Sky.  A way to interact with our friends, family, patrons and music lovers of all ages. 24 hours a day, 365 days a
year.  Mountain Sky Internet Radio!In order to achieve these goals, we need your help!  Well, we need some legal tender!  We have a lofty goal of $10,000.00.  This will provide the costs for the equipment we'll need for our internet radio journey!

By helping us achieve this goal, you'll be a major contributor to bringing original local music to the masses - a way to better advertise our future festivals by spreading the message of our new music venue,  Mountain Sky has escalated its business year after year and there are many reasons for that.  One being lots of elbow grease!  Not to say there aren't many struggles we currently endure.  But with the hard work of our volunteers and the vision of our owners we know we can grow our internet radio station to amazing heights!  We want this to be a place to keep informed of the local music scene, but also make it a place to shift focus away from the big fat cat radio stations.  We will focus on the local music scene, our future festivals, weekly local band interviews, live on air band recordings, local weather and local news announcements to name a few.  Yes, we will run commercials and generate ad revenue from local businesses and establishments.  The businesses in our own backyard!Become a part of our new team!  Feel the pride by being a part of funding a new and exciting journey for the Mountain Sky Family!There are many risks and challenges for our new internet radio venture.  We have a dedicated team of professionals who have been in the radio broadcast field for many years.  We have the tools!  We need the seeds!  Help us on our journey!!Thank you from the Mountain Sky Family.  Check out all of the cool perks you'll receive with your donation today.  Please spread the word!  See you at one of our festivals and keep your ears out for Mountain Sky Internet Radio!!!

story:
Finally, it's time...

After years of off & on production, the painful loss of our friend and band leader Jamie Lavo, and other insane hurdles we present "Providence" in it's final physical CD format

What We Need & What You Get

We've all chipped in time, money, and effort to finish the album in the studio and at home. Now all we need is your pre-order to help with pressing and releasing of "Providence. We're only offering a $10 purchase of the album. The only perks are shipping of the album. Sorry, this isn't a flashy "tons of perks" page, we're simply only interested in getting this pressed and released! 

This is a flexible funding campaign with a bare minimum of $500 (indiegogo policy), we're not looking to make any profit, just looking to see how many we should press. The current plan is to have them pressed and ready by early November!

Thank you to everyone who's help us get to this point, we're all very grateful for our friends and families and for your support! Now let's get this sucker out there!

Thanks again

love, Trials & Tribulations

story:
Short Summary

Brown Sugar A Cappella was founded at Northwestern University in 1999 as the world's first South Asian co-ed a cappella group by two students who wished to express their South Asian roots through music. Since the group's founding, Brown Sugar has gone on to showcase nationally from Bhangra in the Burgh in Pittsburgh to performances in St. Louis and Ann Arbor as well as participate and receive accolades at national competitions. In 2010 and 2011, Brown Sugar was awarded First Place at Gathe Raho, the nation's largest South Asian a cappella competition. In addition to live performances, the group has released three studio albums – Pehla Nasha, Rhythm Room, and Cubed – and is currently working on a fourth album, which will hopefully be released in spring 2013.

What We Need & What You Get 

The album-making endeavor is costly, and in order to achieve our goal of releasing a new album in the spring of 2013, we need to raise $4,000 to finance the rest of our recording and production efforts. In exchange for your support, we have lined up some exciting perks that we think you'll really enjoy - from an early release of one of our favorite songs off the new album (a mix of Shukran Allah/Halo) to having us arrange a song of your choice and sing it for you!
 
We would be honored and extremely grateful for any support you can provide us. With your help – our friends, family, and fans – we will will finally be able to complete a four-year-long recording effort, and have the ability to share our music with the world.
 
Please make a pledge to support us with any amount. You are an integral element of our success, and we can't accomplish this without you!
 
As an added bonus, no matter how much you choose to contribute, we will put up a personalized thank you shout-out on our Facebook and Twitter!

Our Dream

Creating and sharing our music, a fusion of songs that pay tribute to both South Asian and Western traditions of music, is an important venture for all of us. For fourteen years we have shared our music through live performances and three other albums; now we would like to release a fourth. It is our dream to share our music with as many people as we can reach.

This album will showcase the voices and arrangements of six generations of Brown Sugar members, from students who graduated in 2010 to students who will graduate in 2016, – capturing their timeless talent and passion for music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a donation, you can still help us reach our goal!

We would really appreciate it if you shared the link to this page with your friends and family – anybody who would be willing to support our cause.

And to all our fans – thank you so much for your support! We are eternally grateful!
