story:
BIOGRAPHIE

Rise Of Doom est un jeune groupe de Metalcore Grenoblois.

Formé en 2009, Rise Of Doom se lance immédiatement dans la composition, en cherchant à donner vie à son imaginaire et à créer son propre univers.

Le groupe commence par se produire localement. En 2012, Rise Of Doom décide de sortir son premier opus : un EP de 4 titres enregistré chez CORROSIVE RECORDS, suivi d’un clip live en 2013, réalisé par MARTIN REVIRON, sur le titre UNDEAD’S EYES. Mais le groupe gagne rapidement en maturité et en notoriété rendant ce premier EP obsolète.

Aujourd’hui, le groupe impose son propre style à travers des influences telles que Betraying The Martyrs, The Browning ou encore Caliban. Les titres se distinguent par leur atmosphère épique et mélodique très marquée. Guidés par un chant saturé et un chant clair, ils nous emportent dans un monde où la Terre se retrouve littéralement dévastée par le poison de la nature humaine.

A son actif, Rise Of Doom compte de nombreuses dates en France et l’opportunité de partager la scène avec des groupes tels que Atlantis Chronicles, Shoot The Girl First, Everytime I Die (US), Devil Sold His Soul (UK), Vera Cruz, The Walking Dead Orchestra, ou encore Nightmare.

Désormais, Rise Of Doom compte deux nouvelles recrues talentueuses : un second guitariste, Anthony, et le batteur, Tom, sortis tout droit de la Music Academy International.


Rise Of Doom, “Undead's Eyes” – EP 2012 :

MEMBRES DU GROUPE

Florian Gatta – Scream (voix principale)

Romain Herouart – Basse/Chant

Anthony Bertrand – Guitare

Jonathan Soler – Guitare

Tom Leichnig – Batterie


NOTRE PROJET

Après avoir tourné localement pendant plusieurs années, nous souhaitons nous professionnaliser, en commençant par pousser les portes du studio NDSE RECORDINGS à Paris (BETRAYING THE MARTYRS, OUR THEORY, NOVELISTS,…), pour enregistrer notre 1er album.

Notre album sera composé de 9 titres, plongés dans une ambiance profonde où des rythmiques massives se heurtent à une symphonie omniprésente, et où se conjuguent scream et chant clair épuré, le tout plongé dans une atmosphère saisissante et inquiétante.

La sortie est prévue pour janvier 2015. Il s’en suivra une tournée en France, puis en Europe cette même année.

Cet album est indispensable pour nous, afin de concrétiser notre projet et de promouvoir notre musique aussi bien à l’échelle locale qu’internationale. Nous avons choisi Nicolas Delestrade (NDSE RECORDINGS) pour l’enregistrement de ce premier album pour différentes raisons : le son moderne de ses productions, sa qualité sonore, son efficacité. Mais le NDSE RECORDINGS c’est aussi et surtout une valeur sûre dans le mixage/mastering de groupes ancrés dans un style similaire, tel que BETRAYING THE MARTYRS, NOVELISTS, ou encore MERGE.

En vous proposant la qualité digne d’un groupe professionnel, nous espérons gagner en visibilité et avoir l’opportunité d’entrer en Label.

Nous avons maintenant besoin de vous, de votre passion, de votre curiosité pour soutenir notre projet!

Le nom de l’album sera révélé quand le défi sera relevé !


BUDGET STUDIO

Enregistrement :   10 jours x 100€ = 1000€

Mixage :   9 titres x 200€ = 1800€

Le mixage est une technique d’unification du son. Cette deuxième étape suit les enregistrements. Elle consiste à harmoniser les différentes prises sonores et donner au morceau toute sa cohérence sonore et artistique.

Mastering :   9 titres x 50€  = 450€

Le mastering est la dernière étape du processus. Elle permet de rendre homogène l’ensemble des morceaux de l’album, et de déterminer le caractère acoustique/musical du produit final.

TOTAL ALBUM = 3250€

L’atteinte de notre objectif nous permettra de couvrir les frais d'enregistrement et de mixage, soit 2800€. Toutefois, si l’objectif est dépassé, vos dons nous aideront à payer le mastering, la commission INDIEGOGO de 4%, et/ou encore nos frais de déplacement  à Paris !


COMMENT PARTICIPER ET SOUTENIR RISE OF DOOM?

Le concept est simple, efficace, et sécurisé. Vous êtes libre de contribuer financièrement selon le montant de votre choix, dans la limite du temps imparti de la campagne de financement. En effet, les jours sont comptés, alors il n’y a pas de temps à perdre !

Pour vous remercier de votre soutien, RISE OF DOOM vous propose une série de contreparties en fonction de vos dons. Ainsi, vous pouvez choisir le montant de votre contribution par rapport à la contrepartie qui vous intéresse ! Pour cela, il vous suffit de cliquer sur la contrepartie de votre choix puis d’effectuer la transaction !

Et surtout, n’oubliez pas de partager et relayer cette campagne autour de vous et sur les réseaux sociaux, pour que nous puissions ensemble mener à bien ce projet !

Car grâce à votre  soutien, cet album verra le jour, et sera aussi le vôtre !

story:
Dreams...


We all have dreams; some of us dream forever, and some of us chase them and make them a reality. Together ours is just out of reach. We've been hard at work putting together our brand spanking new 5 song EP "Sound Of Flight" which promises to be heavier and more bad ass than Godzilla riding a motorcycle.

We've found our basement, that's right we said "basement", where we will be working with producer Quinn Cyrankiewicz (Red Threat). This guy produces amazing recordings out of his house... don't believe us? here's proof:


We've written the music, done our research, found the studio and producer, and now all we need is your help! Yes YOU there reading! You can help 4 artists make their dreams a reality simply by making a small contribution anywhere between $25-$1000. Every donation has a perk! perhaps you just want a kick ass Monarch Sky limited edition t-shirt and a copy of the new EP, or maybe you were thinking BIGGER? The amount is up to you, and every contribution counts. 


Who The Bleep Is Monarch Sky?



Monarch Sky is a female fronted alternative metal group from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. The band formed in 2012 and is comprised of Brandy Black on lead vocals, Jason Cullen on guitar / back up vocals, Jeremy Pond on bass guitar - back up vocals, and Mike Belitsky on drums.


Although currently unsigned, Monarch Sky has moved mountains in a short period of time. Since joining forces in 2012, they have headlined out of town shows and local music festivals, they released their EP titled "Embryo" in June 2013, toured western Canada in the summer of 2013 to promote their EP, and were nominated for “Metal Recording Of The Year” for their song “Circles” at the 2013 Edmonton Music Awards. 


Their performance is a sight to be witnessed live; Monarch Sky shares a powerful connection on stage both musically and lyrically. Their sound has been compared to a mix between Evanesence and Tool, with some musical influences being Tool, Chevelle, Deftones, Lacuna Coil...etc



The Breakdown


Now that you know who we are and why we need your financial support, here's a detailed breakdown of where your money is going:

Recording including mixing & mastering @ $800/song

$4000

CD Duplication including shipping costs for 250 CDs

$675.81

If we reach our goal, Indie Gogo takes 4% of the funding

$200

Third Party Fees (3-5% for PayPal & credit card processing fees)

max $250

Wire Fee (Charged once when non-US campaigns have raised funds in USD via Direct Credit Card)

$25

Any charges over $5000 we will cover with our band fund which varies over time depending on shows we play and merchandise.


The Perks


Now you know what we need, here's what you'll get for your contribution:

$25 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
         - Limited Edition T-Shirt

$50 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
         - Limited Edition T-Shirt
         - Our current EP "Embryo"
         - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)

$75 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
         - Limited Edition T-Shirt
         - Our Current EP "Embryo"
         - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)
         - Our renowned "Rib" T-Shirt

$100 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
           - Limited Edition T-Shirt
           - Our Current EP "Embryo"
           - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)
           - Limited Edition Hoodie

$250 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
            - Limited Edition T-Shirt
            - Our Current EP "Embryo"
            - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)
            - Limited Edition Hoodie
            - Special thanks on our upcoming album

$500 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
            - Limited Edition T-Shirt
            - Our Current EP "Embryo"
            - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)
            - Limited Edition Hoodie
            - Be and extra in our upcoming music video

$1000 - Our new EP "Sound Of Flight"
              - Limited Edition T-Shirt
              - Our Current EP "Embryo"
              - Limited Edition Poster (Artwork by Brandy Black)
              - Limited Edition Hoodie
              - Private show from Monarch Sky within the Edmonton area

Risks & Challenges


There of course is a chance that we won't reach our goal, if this happens we will still receive the funds raised. Depending how short we are from our goal there's a chance we won't be able to finish our recording right away. If this happens, your money will be going toward our recording regardless. Perhaps we won't be able to complete the album as quickly as we had hoped, but we will get as much done as we can and try to cover as much of the leftover cost as we possibly can. The greatest downfall to this happening is that it may set back our delivery time a bit, so please be patient.

If everything goes as planned, we will be recording in September and will hopefully be ready for the album release in late November 2014.

Other Ways You Can Help


We can't stress it enough how important it is to support your local music scene. Besides your financial contribution, the best way you can help is to attend our live shows, rock out with us, and buy our merch. This goes for not just us, but any other band that you love. If music is important to you, then attending shows should be too, because YOU are what keeps us doing what we love!

You can also help by spreading the word about Monarch Sky!

Here are some links:

Website: www.monarchsky.ca
Facebook: www.facebook.com/monarchsky
Soundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/monarch-sky
Reverbnation: www.reverbnation.com/monarchsky
Twitter: www.twitter.com/monarchskymusic
YouTube: www.youtube.com/monarchskymusic
Instagram: www.instagram.com/monarchsky


Thank You Thank You!


Your contribution will help us in so many different ways, and we appreciate every little bit! Thank you!

There of course is a chance that we won't reach our goal, if this happens we will still receive the funds raised. Depending how short we are from our goal there's a chance we won't be able to finish our recording right away. If this happens, your money will be going toward our recording regardless. Perhaps we won't be able to complete the album as quickly as we had hoped, but we will get as much done as we can and try to cover as much of the leftover cost as we possibly can. The greatest downfall to this happening is that it may set back our delivery time a bit, so please be patient. If everything goes as planned, we will be recording in September and will hopefully be ready for the album release in late November 2014. 
  Other Ways You Can Help
We can't stress it enough how important it is to support your local music scene. Besides your financial contribution, the best way you can help is to attend our live shows, rock out with us, and buy our merch. This goes for not just us, but any other band that you love. If music is important to you, then attending shows should be too, because YOU are what keeps us doing what we love! You can also help by spreading the word about Monarch Sky!Here are some links:Website: www.monarchsky.caFacebook: www.facebook.com/monarchskySoundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/monarch-skyReverbnation: www.reverbnation.com/monarchskyTwitter: www.twitter.com/monarchskymusicYouTube: www.youtube.com/monarchskymusicInstagram: www.instagram.com/monarchsky
 Thank You Thank You!Your contribution will help us in so many different ways, and we appreciate every little bit! Thank you!

story:
Dear Family and Friends,

 I have been working on my 2nd album, “PROMISE FULFILLED,” and in the beginning of this year I also begin the outreach portion of my ministry titled: “MAKING CHANGE IN COMMUNITES M.C.I.C.”

ON MARCH 31, 2012 M.C.I.C had its first community event. This event, allowed everyone (especially the elderly) to be involved, engaged in developing better social skills while having lots of fun gaining knowledge and information, to better equip community members in their everyday lives.

 

WHAT’S NEW!

Now it is time for the release of my 2nd album and the M.C.I.C gospel concert & Outreach. However being an independent artist, and single parent of two, it has been a challenge trying to pay for everything. So far, I have basically funding everything and with deadline approaching and limited funds; I am reaching out to you for your help. I hope that if your able, you would help me fund the rest of this project & movement. You can give as low as $5 and as much as your able. I have a few gift packages for you for your generous gift, including a free copy of my songs before the release date.  :)

 

MAKING CHANGE IN COMMUNITIES M.C.I.C CAMPAIGN

On June 30, 2012 I will be releasing my 2nd album, at Keisha Dream Presents, “ Making Change in Communities M.C.I.C Gospel Concert & Outreach.” I want to make a positive impact in our communities by donating some of my CD’s to some of the DYS programs, other programs and women & children shelters. As well as being able to give free tickets, provide food, and possible free gift bags to some youth who may not have the funds or opportunity to attend M.C.IC Gospel Concert & Outreach other wise. If we can save our youth, we will save our future. This is one of the reasons why this campaign is so important to me. Our young people really need our support and love.

 

The Plan (Raise approximately $1500)

Need EXTRA financial support to go towards:

  • Remaining balance of studio cost
  • Printing of CD’s
  • Payment for rental Space for M.C.I.C.  Gospel concert  & Outreach (which I will be releasing my new album)
  • Sound Engineering during M.C.I.C Gospel Concert & Outreach, etc
  • Gift bags for DYS kids

 

P.S. ALL OF THE PROCEEDS WILL GO TOWARDS KEISHA DREAM nothing personal

 

The Impact

With your contribution you will help me reach the lost, the hurting, and those who have given up on their lives, those who struggle with addictions, depression, and those people have thrown away. The 1st album impacted lives in a great way; the young and the older are still being blessed by it. I strongly believe that the 2nd album and gospel concert/Outreach will do even greater. And with your help we will make change in our communities.

 

Others Way you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Share this campaign on face book, twitter, text, email

 

Thank you so much for your time, and your generosity, I truly thank you for being a blessing in what the Lord has given me to do.

 

God bless,

Keisha Dream

“I believe in you.”

www.keishadreams.com

www.twitter.com/KEISHADREAM

story:
Short Summary & Impact

Hello! My name is Grace, and I am currently attending Madison Media Institute working toward a bachelor’s degree in Entertainment and Media Business. To help me expand and apply the knowledge I’m acquiring during school, I’ve started this page to help raise money so I can attend the largest film and music festival of the year—South by Southwest, or SXSW. 

 What is South by Southwest? 
 SXSW is an internationally known set of film and music festivals, along with interactive conferences, based in Austin, Texas. The music aspect of the festival is quite a large event, as there are near 2,000 bands placing shows simultaneously throughout the venue during the week. One thing that is super cool to me is the fact that when you—as an artist—attend SXSW, you have to find your own way there and are in charge of your own keep. I feel this gives the festival its authenticity. 
 The film festival is just as widespread, with many indie directors bringing new films and ideas to the table. SXSW features many different filmmakers and voices in search for the newest wave of film. Now the conferences and interactions are what I truly want to attend! The amount of emerging technology ideas that SXSW discusses is just amazing to me. The focus on creative ideas is very welcoming and exciting to someone aspiring to work in the business of media entertainment. Going to SXSW, I’d know I’d be going to a place that is not just looking for the “next best thing” but is striving to better what emerging artists have to offer now. Welcoming new technology and finding new ways of not just communication but everyday life is something I crave! I could really go on and on about this, but if you would like to look at more about the conference here’s a great link: http://sxsw.com 
 This campaign is an opportunity to help me achieve a goal to not only gain a once in a lifetime opportunity, but to help me further my education in this field and network with like-minded artists. This is a place to learn from and meet a diverse group of people who can help me invest and strengthen my knowledge and experience. My goal is to gain as much knowledge from professionals in the field and enjoy some brand new music and film at the same time! I will be taking this opportunity to make a short documentary about what I experience during SXSW, as well as the journey to and from the festival! It'll be a great way for you to see just how awesome and productive this experience will be for me. I do have a schedule of what I plan to attend, but I can't RSVP a spot until I buy a badge, and I can’t buy a badge until I raise enough money to attend. 
That’s why I need your help! Examples of conferences I will attend are: Digital Creative Job Markets, Using Emerging Tech, Using Emerging Technologies to Reach Your Audience, #ageofdamage: Be the Company You Want to Keep, Business Models for the Social Mobile Cloud, Equity: Making the Most of Your Other Paycheck, How to Rank Better in Google & Bing, How Twitter Has Changed How We Watch TV, and that’s just to name a few! Many of you know me personally and know my passion for technology and business...and my undying love for music of all types. I found my holy grail, and it's SXSW.

What We Need

For this trip we have an estimated cost of $4000.00 which includes gas, tolls, modest hotel accommodations, food, passes to SXSW, and basic upkeep of our car thats traveling across the US!  



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate any money to me, anything you have to offer to me would be helpful and greatly appreciated.

Got a couch I could crash on? Lovely!

Want to invite me over for breakfast or dinner? I'll be there, I'll even help cook!

Or even just sharing my campaign on your social media sites would be appreciated immensely! 

Remember that share button! Use it! 


THANK YOU!!

story:
The Hi Matics:

The Hi Matics are made up of Graham and Brad Prellwitz, Augie Dougherty, Daniel Waterman and Eli Frieders. For the past two years we've been performing and writing our own brand of Folk Rock Music. In September 2013 we released our first Album, "Analog Fades". It was an incredibly beneficial project for us. We're hoping keep progressing in a positive direction and record a new EP in time for Summer 2014.

A new EP will allow us to showcase our progression as a full band. We feel so fortunate to have such great friends, family and fans. Your support helps us out so much as a developing band.

We've been writing new material and are excited to bring you all some quality original music. With your help, The Hi Matics will be able to record, mix and master our new Hi Matics EP.

Thank you so much for your backing.

Expences:

We've planned out our expenses for this new project, and we've set a goal of $2500. This money will help offset the following expenses that go along with recording a CD.

Studio Space: $30-$50 per hour ($600-$900)

Mastering: $40 per song ($160-$200)

Production: $2.80 per unit ($1400)

Copyright: $35 per song ($175-$210)

Perks:

We appreciate all donations, so we've put together some gifts and unique experience to give back to you.

For a Contribution of $1.00

by donating $1.00 to The Hi Matics and sending us your groovy vibes, we'll email you our first single from The Hi Matics EP before it is released.

For a contribution of $15.00

We'll send you a copy of The Hi Matics EP upon completion. 

For a contribution of $25.00

We'll send you a copy of The Hi Matics EP upon completion

 AND some exclusive The Hi Matics Swag (Stickers and Button)

For a contribution of $50.00

We'll send you a copy of The Hi Matics EP upon completion

AND some exclusive The Hi Matics Swag (Stickers and Button)

WITH a collector 8" X 8" print of Analog Fades cover.

For a Contribution of $75.00

We'll send you a copy of The Hi Matics EP upon completion

AND some exclusive The Hi Matics Swag (Stickers and Button)

WITH an Autographed copy of Analog Fades and an 8" X 8" collector print of Analog Fades cover

For a Contribution of $150.00 - Co-Producer Donation

You'll get all of the above and get your name credited as being a Co-Producer for The Hi Matics EP.

For a Contribution of $500.00 - The Hi Matics Performance and Co-Producer

We'll come out and play you a show (public or private) Within the State of Wisconsin

AND you're name will be credited as being a Co-Producer for the Hi Matics EP

For a Contribution of $750.00 - Music Video Producer

We'll let you pick our first single from The Hi Matics EP and determine the theme for the music video of that song.

AND You will be featured as a Co-Producer of The Hi Matics EP and Music Video.

Other Ways To Help:

You can help us by spreading the word. The best publicity is still WORD OF MOUTH!

Use the handy "Share Tools" Indie Go Go has provided!

story:
About the Recital

On August 22, 2015 at 8pm at the Hofheimer Theater at Virginia Wesleyan College I'll be offering a program of art songs in collaboration with Sharon Foxwell, pianist. The evening will feature works by Caccini, Purcell, Schubert, Brahms, Wolf, Fauré, and Satie, and the program will conclude with a tribute to a few favorite contemporary popular songs. I plan to make this a fun evening both for art song aficionados and friends new to the genre by creating a more immersive experience through projection, dance, and other surprises. With your support I can bring this unique program out of my head and into the concert hall. 

About Me

I'm a native of Hampton Roads who studied music at Virginia Wesleyan College and received a certificate in church music from the college's Center for Sacred Music before pursuing a Master of Divinity at Union Presbyterian Seminary. As a recitalist I participated in programs with the Virginia Art Song Society, was featured in VWC's Familiar Faces Concert Series, and founded Liedermorgen, an educational series designed to introduce German language students to Kunstlieder. I also produced several solo recitals of sacred music while often returning to my great love of German art song. Most recently I appeared on the program of the Bach Festival at Trinity Lutheran Church in Norfolk, VA. As a candidate for ministry in the Presbyterian Church (PCUSA), I have served churches as a musician, teacher, and preacher, and I am currently filling the pulpit at Belle Haven Presbyterian Church in Belle Haven, VA.

About the Campaign

I've long wanted to offer a program to both my new friends and those in the music community who have supported me, but recitals are expensive! Between renting a space, hiring an accompanist, buying sheet music, and working with coaches, it can be a daunting undertaking. And don't get me started on coordinating publicity and printing programs and finding something to wear! With your help I can produce this evening without being too deep in my own pockets and without burdening people with a ticket charge. I'd much prefer to offer free events so that this wonderful music remains accessible to all. 

My goal of $700 covers the bulk of the expenses involved in renting the performance space and compensating my collaborative musician. I'll still be investing my own funds in many other aspects of this program. Your contributions would be greatly encouraging and help alleviate my fears that I'm squandering my savings on a vanity project.

This recital is happening. I've signed a contract on the theater. I've given sheet music to the pianist. I need your help now to make it the best evening it can be.

About That Raffle

I'm hoping that you'll consider contributing the price of a concert ticket to this campaign, but as an added incentive, I've included an element of danger. All contributions include entries into a song raffle with the winner having the ability to choose a love song for this program. Do you have a favorite Schubert piece that you've never heard performed live? Can you think of a Billy Joel song that deserves more respect as an American standard? Do you think it could be potentially hilarious to hear me tackle a bit of Beyoncé? Challenge accepted. Anything goes as long as the song fits the broad topic of love and the music is accessible to the musicians. No opera.

You'll note that for a contribution of $100 you can skip the raffle and call your own tune. Three songs are available at this price, although you are welcome to offer a contribution at this level without claiming a song. Any songs not claimed will be added to the raffle thereby giving ticket holders additional chances to win their choice of song.

Does that sound crazy? Probably, but I'm running this campaign early to give us plenty of time both to rehearse your chosen songs and to program them so that they become a seamless part of our evening. This is a truly unique opportunity for you to make a very personal investment in the arts.

Please note that the raffle is now closed, and we drew the lucky winner on May 15, 2015. You can still support the recital with a contribution and see your name acknowledged at the program. 

About the Future

Please put this event on your calendar and help me spread the word by sharing this campaign on social media. You can also join this event on Facebook for more frequent updates and reminders. I want to see you and your friends on August 22, 2015 at 8pm.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hailey Ward, and I am an 18 year old singer/songwriter from Williston, Vermont. I am currently studying Songwriting at McNally Smith College of Music in Saint Paul, where I have been recording my second EP! For any of you that don't know, "EP" stands for "Extended Play", which basically means you are getting a short CD with 3-5 songs. On this EP, titled "Home", there will be five songs PLUS a bonus remix! Four of these songs are brand new, written this year at McNally. 

I am so excited to share this project with you because I have been very lucky to work with very talented people at McNally, and I know this will be the highest quality project that I have released yet. I previously released my own self-produced EP in July 2014. While the songs are still bearable, I can't stand to listen to the production (which I thought I knew how to do at the time). Here at McNally, I have had the pleasure of working with Eric Michael, a production student. He has put so much time into recording me, we only have one session left! I could not be more thrilled! 

If I am able to reach my goal, you will have helped me release the biggest project that I have ever done..... And we have big hopes for this project. Once Eric has finished with the recording and production, I will send the tracks to Mozu Mastering in Connecticut to be mastered. Once they have been mastered, and I am ready to release the project, I will order physical copy's of the CD through CD Baby, and send it out to the digital distribution sites (such as iTunes, etc). 

What I Need & What You Get

The new songs on this EP are very personal to me. I have written from the heart, and the songs say exactly what I want them to. I am extremely proud of this project. Eric and the other musicians on the project have all worked for free up until this point, using this project as a learning experience. However, I would like to be able to repay them in some way.

I will break the costs down for you:

Mozu Mastering, a company in CT, has offered to master my EP as their contribution for my campaign! WAHOOO. 

-$50 to pay my drummer, Dan May

-$50 to pay my guitarist, Trevor Ohlsen

-$50 to pay my bassist, Joe Barron

-$300+ to order 100-200 physical copies of the EP with colored sleeves. Cover will be done by my younger sister, Lindsay. 

-$100 for Digital Distribution to iTunes and other sites. 

-$50 to register these songs on ASCAP to get the copyrights. 

-The remaining $400 will be divided into Promoting this album and getting my name out there, and a music video of some kind. 

-There will be perks for the different contributions you make. These perks may include a physical copy of the CD bundled with a copy of the first one, pins of different logo designs I have, a personal song written for you (topic of your choice), and more!

If I am unable to reach at least 50% of my goal, I will use what I have made to pay the musicians and people who have worked so hard on this project.

If I reach more than that, but not 100%, I will use what I can to cover part of the physical duplication, and pay the people who have worked so hard on this project.

If I am able to raise MORE than 100% of my goal.... HALLELUJAH I will be eternally grateful, and be able to afford every goal listed above and more. PLUS you will receive one or more of the perks listed!

The Impact

As a young songwriter, I am learning that the music industry is ever-changing. I don't need to go into a professional studio to record and release an EP. There are SO many resources at my fingertips! It's harder to just "get famous" now- and you should know, that I am not trying to be completely famous. If I am able to make enough money to support myself and whatever family I will have around me, I will consider that success. I really value my personal life and privacy. (Of course I want to win a Grammy too, but we take it one dream at a time) I have access to these incredible professional-level studios at McNally, where we have recorded the entire EP. Why should you contribute? As musicians and supporters of the arts, I think it is so important to pay attention to the aspiring youth that surround us. I am ready to start chasing this goal at full speed. 

How can you trust my motivation? Let me tell you that I have achieved almost every goal that I have ever set out to do. I face every challenge head-on, and I won't stop until I am satisfied. In summer 2011 I was fortunate enough to attend Interlochen Arts Camp, and I knew when I got home that I had to go back the next summer. I was accepted into their two-week High School Songwriting program. The camp tuition was expensive, but I knew what I had to do. With a bake sale, pasta dinner, and carwash, I was able to raise $3000 in two weeks. I was fortunate to attend camp at Interlochen that summer and go on to attend two years at Interlochen Arts Academy, where I graduated from a year early, in May 2014.

I don't like to give up, and you can trust that I won't do that this time. This goal is just as important to me as fundraising for my tuition at Interlochen, and every other goal that I have tried to achieve. 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks to this fundraiser, as there are to anything in life. Putting myself out there is scary! However, I have learned that as a young songwriter in the music industry, putting myself out in the open is the only way to achieve my goals. 

  • I am determined to reach this goal. This project means everything to me. I have had a wonderful first year at McNally Smith College of Music, and I truly believe that these songs and connections I have made wouldn't have come about if I wasn't here. 
  • If you know me, or follow my Facebook page, "Hailey Ward Music", you can count on seeing a lot of this link. Don't let it annoy you, let it motivate you! If I can reach this goal, you can reach whatever dream you may be chasing right now!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is able to make a contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Tell your friends and family about this project!
  • SHARE this page on social media websites like Facebook and Twitter! Exposure is everything!
  • THANK YOU. Even just by clicking on this link, you have made an impact! I will never be able to fully express my gratitude for the support and love I have received.
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Hailey Ward, and I am an 18 year old singer/songwriter from Williston, Vermont. I am currently studying Songwriting at McNally Smith College of Music in Saint Paul, where I have been recording my second EP! For any of you that don't know, "EP" stands for "Extended Play", which basically means you are getting a short CD with 3-5 songs. On this EP, titled "Home", there will be five songs PLUS a bonus remix! Four of these songs are brand new, written this year at McNally. 
I am so excited to share this project with you because I have been very lucky to work with very talented people at McNally, and I know this will be the highest quality project that I have released yet. I previously released my own self-produced EP in July 2014. While the songs are still bearable, I can't stand to listen to the production (which I thought I knew how to do at the time). Here at McNally, I have had the pleasure of working with Eric Michael, a production student. He has put so much time into recording me, we only have one session left! I could not be more thrilled! 
If I am able to reach my goal, you will have helped me release the biggest project that I have ever done..... And we have big hopes for this project. Once Eric has finished with the recording and production, I will send the tracks to Mozu Mastering in Connecticut to be mastered. Once they have been mastered, and I am ready to release the project, I will order physical copy's of the CD through CD Baby, and send it out to the digital distribution sites (such as iTunes, etc).    What I Need & What You Get
The new songs on this EP are very personal to me. I have written from the heart, and the songs say exactly what I want them to. I am extremely proud of this project. Eric and the other musicians on the project have all worked for free up until this point, using this project as a learning experience. However, I would like to be able to repay them in some way.
 I will break the costs down for you:
Mozu Mastering, a company in CT, has offered to master my EP as their contribution for my campaign! WAHOOO. 
-$50 to pay my drummer, Dan May
-$50 to pay my guitarist, Trevor Ohlsen
-$50 to pay my bassist, Joe Barron
-$300+ to order 100-200 physical copies of the EP with colored sleeves. Cover will be done by my younger sister, Lindsay. 
-$100 for Digital Distribution to iTunes and other sites. 
-$50 to register these songs on ASCAP to get the copyrights. 
-The remaining $400 will be divided into Promoting this album and getting my name out there, and a music video of some kind.

This project means everything to me. I have had a wonderful first year at McNally Smith College of Music, and I truly believe that these songs and connections I have made wouldn't have come about if I wasn't here.  If you know me, or follow my Facebook page, "Hailey Ward Music", you can count on seeing a lot of this link. story:
You guys! It's time. We've played Brooklyn. We've played Manhattan. We've played D.C. We've played Philly. We've played Detroit!  We've played Naragansett. We've played Bars, Spiegeltents, backyards, basements, your weddings, your friends weddings, fundraisers, drag shows and puppet shows! It's time to test our mettle and bring our finely tuned Dolly Parton experience to the homeland. We have booked venues throughout Tennessee including Dolly's hometown of Pigeon Forge (!) now we need a way to get there. Your kind, generous, super fabulous donations will cover gas costs, plane tickets, lodging and fried foods.

Over the past 4 years we have grown from 3 girls singing at a bar to a rockabilly, bluegrass-y quartet! This has been years in the making and we are following our dreams to go to the land of DOLLY!

story:
June 5 update:
Thanks to all of our donors so far through Indiegogo and Shunpike! Between the two venues we've raised the first $12,000 and have about $2,000  left to raise by June 12. We're so excited as we get closer to the goal that makes this great project possible, and we hope you can join us!

Meet the youngest (ever?) performers at BEMF

Join us on June 12 at First Church Boston to see our Handel opera adaptation for all ages! Early Music America is presenting Seattle Historical Arts for Kids on the Young Performers' Festival, side by side with some of the nation's finest college-level early music ensembles. Our cast of kids and teens will be right in the midst of the Boston Early Music Festival, hailed by The Times (London) as "the world's leading festival of early music." This is an amazing opportunity for our adventurous and skilled young students to see and be seen by the early-music community.

About the show

Alcina is a tale of sorcery and adventure. SHAK's adaptation of this Baroque masterwork – delightful for adults and kids alike – is a revival of our successful 2014 performance. It's a one-hour spoken play enriched with a sparkling dozen and a half of the best arias, choruses, and dances from Handel's opera. A cast of singers and actors aged 6-17 take center stage, accompanied by a chamber orchestra of professional Baroque violins, cello, theorbo and harpsichord. The story is told by Ludovico Ariosto, author of the 16th-century tale that inspired the opera, in competition with the visiting Handel himself. Sparks fly as Renaissance and Baroque visions collide, and there's even a duel or two in period style!

Why this project matters

In Alcina, as in all of our projects, kids are empowered to connect with history and bring it to life. Imagining oneself into the past is a cross-cultural experience that develops sensitivity, imagination, and compassion. All of our students are learning about the craft of performance, working with experts in the field, and taking their places in the chain of people keeping these old arts alive for future generations.

Our young performers are sure to be inspired for the rest of their lives by what they see and hear at the festival. Alcina is the "jewel in our crown," and we hope that sharing it will inspire more high-quality historical-arts education for young people. There is simply no other program anywhere that does what we do! At the Festival, Shula will be honored with Early Music America's 2015 Laurette Goldberg Award for education, in recognition of this work.

In their own words

“Things I value most about SHAK are the people, the music and all the hard effort. I developed the skills to sing, dance and talk in public. You really get to know all the other people, so the cast feels almost like a family.” --Cast member, age 12

"For me, SHAK serves as a kind of time machine. I could have been born in the baroque time period and it would have worked out fine. And I think anyone who's interested in Baroque opera is kind of inherently awesome." --Cast member, age 11

"I’m so impressed with SHAK’s ability not just to teach material but to thoughtfully engage each kid. They have a real knack for seeing each kid’s strengths and finding, or creating, roles for them, which creates a group that is really able to shine. SHAK is encouraging a life-long engagement with history and early music, and in the process our kids are learning to navigate a group with integrity and a strong sense of self." --Parent of two cast members

    Our funding goal

    We begin with good news: with the generosity of our supporters close by, we've raised over $9,000 already, in just eight weeks! We have about another $5,000 to raise by June. Gifts can be made either through Indiegogo or via our fiscal sponsor (see below) -- hence a goal of only $4,000 for the Indiegogo campaign itself.

    Early Music America gives us a venue to perform in and publicizes the event; in return, they keep the door money. All other expenses are up to us to cover. We're taking the opportunity of this revival performance to add (and learn, and stage...) a couple of great vocal numbers. We're also spending a lot more time with a vocal coach -- the great Nancy Zylstra -- and with live instrumental accompaniment in rehearsals. Here are the things donations will pay for:

    • Costumes: fabric, shoes, wigs, ready-made costumes, custom sewing fees
    • Directorial staff time: Stage director Carmen Mettler; project director and music director Shulamit Kleinerman
    • Guest coaches: Vocal coach Nancy Zylstra, fencing coach Cecil Longino
    • Musical accompanists: Our Seattle rehearsal players on baroque violins, cello, theorbo, and harpsichord
    • Musicians to play for the performance in Boston
    • Rehearsal space rental, March-June
    • Travel & lodging costs for directorial staff
    • Those little things that add up: costume shipping/checking, program printing...
    • Travel scholarships for families who need them

    What about the cost of getting to Boston? Most families are paying their own travel expenses. All participating families have donated to the artistic budget in some way, with an average donation of almost $300 per cast member. There's a tremendous amount of commitment and dedication behind this project!

    Ways to donate

    Option 1. Here on our Indiegogo campaign. Advantage for you: Fun! Easy! We have perks! You'll see your name listed on our campaign (unless you prefer to be anonymous) and you'll watch the dollar ticker click toward our goal with your help.

    Option 2. Through our fiscal sponsor, Shunpike. Advantage for you: Shunpike is the way to go if you prefer for your donation to be tax-deductible. If your employer does matching for charitable donations, we would love for you to donate through Shunpike and make use of that opportunity. You can make a gift via Shunpike either by check or by credit card: Just visit http://historicalarts.org/support.

    All donations made through either venue reach SHAK, minus a modest processing percentage in both cases.

    Other ways you can help

    Please help spread the word -- about SHAK in general or this campaign in particular. We're very happy for others to know about what we're doing, and we hope to inspire more in-depth historical arts work with young people.

    • Share news of our work with your friends: historicalarts.org
    • Help us connect with other donors by sharing this campaign. Thank you!
    "People should come to our performance because they could be a part of reviving history." --Cast member, age 12

    ***

    SHAK is a proud program of Shunpike.

story:
Hello folks we are the Wandering Sons, a Glasgow-based band of full time musicians who make a living exploring, wandering and playing music at the side of the street. We are looking to fund the recording of a new EP featuring a whole bunch of fresh music that we have been working hard on over the last year and are very excited to share with you.

We feel incredibly lucky to have had the opportunity to perform over the last two years, not many people can say that they love their career choice as much as we do. And while we do have the occasional rough day –everyone does – it’s still a blessing to meet and perform for so many wonderful people.

 This EP has been in the works for a while now, however recently life has been getting in the way a wee bit with valuable equipment being damaged and other various setbacks. Expenses have been unusually high and the £2000 that we had saved has unfortunately been exhausted on other band-related emergencies.  

We’re looking to raise £4,500 in total. All of the money raised will be used for; a producer, mixing & mastering, session musicians, equipment hire, CD production and artist fees.

As you can imagine, a whole heap of work, time and talented people are required to record and produce an EP so anything that you can offer is greatly appreciated! If you can’t contribute – don’t worry, you can still help by sharing this page via the social media platform of your choice.

We have come up with a series of perks for those who can back us which we hope you’ll be as excited about as we are. Details are at the side of the page.

 Thanks for taking the time to read this page and thank you also for all of the support and encouragement that we have received from fans, friends and family over the last few years.

David, Barney & Timmy

story:
THIS IS ALL ABOUT SUPPORT

Have you ever been so driven by something that it consumes your entire existence?Have you ever been so passionate about something that your heart beats soley for it? Have you ever been so close to conquering a mountain that you can taste the air that passes the summit? That's where we are RIGHT NOW!

 DROPSHOT

As a hard-hitting hard rock band, we pride ourselves on consistantly executing the traditional elements of our live show: intense energy, emotionally charged songs, and a personal connection to our fans. 

At the same time, we believe that we're only as strong as the scene we support. That's why, either individually or as a group, DROPSHOT spends endless hours supporting other bands. We love to help local, regional, and national bands come to our hometown!  That's right! We bring tons of bands to town, open our homes, give them our stage, our crowd, and even sometimes our money! While unusual, this process is the very thing that helps us build strong successful relationships in the industry around the globe! 

-HISTORY-

Since our 2013 sell out debut at Club Detroit in Downtown St.Petersburg, Fl, DROPSHOT has played every major rock club stage in Fl. From Jacksonville's FreeBird Live & Tallahassee's Club Atmospshere to Orlando's Haven Lounge and Miami's Hard Rock Cafe,  we've logged thousands of hours and hundreds of miles on the road. 

In September 2014, DROPSHOT took a little time off to catch our breathe and write some new tunes. Six short months later, we received a call inviting us to headline the annual "Rock The Park" benefit fundraiser in New Port Richey, Fl. With charity work near and dear to our hearts, we said yes with out hesitation. Once the word got out that we would be in Fl, it set off a frenzy of phone calls from clubs and promoters and BOOM! we had a Florida Summer Tour booked.

After announcing the details for the Fl dates, calls immediately started coming in from rock clubs further up the East Coast.  Suddenly we were looking at a potential full-on East Coast Summer Tour!! I know! Crazy right!? 

-NEW JOURNEY-

So here we stand, on the plateau between staying status quoa or digging deep to climb higher! We have worked too hard to turn back now, but we need your support to go for the bigger vision! 

Over the last two years, we learned a lot of things. Besides learning not to let Nick go near the ladies room after the shows, three of the most valuable things we've learned is that our fans are die hard loyal, love to have a good time, and will travel great distances to support us. That is why we are calling on you now.

-TAKE THIS SHOT WITH US-

We need your support more than ever! 

We have an opportunity to take DROPSHOT to new places, for new faces, and we want you to take this shot with us!

We are asking all of you loyal fans and new fans to help us by donating. Every donation help us climb further up this mountain.

-WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?-

Besides the fact that you get to contribute to the success of your favorite band ;), you get some really cool REWARDS! Look over there to see them! -----------------> 

-IN THE END- 

We love to rock the stage for you and love to party with you, but most importantly, we love to share our music with everyone we can. So please make your pledge now. 

Don't forget to share this campaign page with everyone you can so they too can TAKE THIS SHOT WITH US!! 

We love you all and couldn't do this without you! 

-DROPSHOT
story_txt: THIS IS ALL ABOUT SUPPORTHave you ever been so driven by something that it consumes your entire existence?Have you ever been so passionate about something that your heart beats soley for it? Have you ever been so close to conquering a mountain that you can taste the air that passes the summit? That's where we are RIGHT NOW! DROPSHOTAs a hard-hitting hard rock band, we pride ourselves on consistantly executing the traditional elements of our live show: intense energy, emotionally charged songs, and a personal connection to our fans. At the same time, we believe that we're only as strong as the scene we support. That's why, either individually or as a group, DROPSHOT spends endless hours supporting other bands. We love to help local, regional, and national bands come to our hometown!  That's right! We bring tons of bands to town, open our homes, give them our stage, our crowd, and even sometimes our money! While unusual, this process is the very thing that helps us build strong successful relationships in the industry around the globe! -HISTORY-Since our 2013 sell out debut at Club Detroit in Downtown St.Petersburg, Fl, DROPSHOT has played every major rock club stage in Fl. From Jacksonville's FreeBird Live & Tallahassee's Club Atmospshere to Orlando's Haven Lounge and Miami's Hard Rock Cafe,  we've logged thousands of hours and hundreds of miles on the road. In September 2014, DROPSHOT took a little time off to catch our breathe and write some new tunes. Six short months later, we received a call inviting us to headline the annual "Rock The Park" benefit fundraiser in New Port Richey, Fl. With charity work near and dear to our hearts, we said yes with out hesitation. Once the word got out that we would be in Fl, it set off a frenzy of phone calls from clubs and promoters and BOOM! we had a Florida Summer Tour booked.After announcing the details for the Fl dates, calls immediately started coming in from rock clubs further up the East Coast.  Suddenly we were looking at a potential full-on East Coast Summer Tour!! I know! Crazy right!? -NEW JOURNEY-So here we stand, on the plateau between staying status quoa or digging deep to climb higher! We have worked too hard to turn back now, but we need your support to go for the bigger vision! Over the last two years, we learned a lot of things. Besides learning not to let Nick go near the ladies room after the shows, three of the most valuable things we've learned is that our fans are die hard loyal, love to have a good time, and will travel great distances to support us. That is why we are calling on you now.-TAKE THIS SHOT WITH US-We need your support more than ever! We have an opportunity to take DROPSHOT to new places, for new faces, and we want you to take this shot with us!We are asking all of you loyal fans and new fans to help us by donating. Every donation help us climb further up this mountain.-WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?-Besides the fact that you get to contribute to the success of your favorite band ;), you get some really cool REWARDS! Look over there to see them! -----------------> -IN THE END- We love to rock the stage for you and love to party with you, but most importantly, we love to share our music with everyone we can. So please make your pledge now. Don't forget to share this campaign page with everyone you can so they too can TAKE THIS SHOT WITH US!! We love you all and couldn't do this without you! -DROPSHOT

story:
Hear Another NEW SINGLE FROM THE ALBUM!


HEY YOU GUYS!

So here it is, the preorder for the brand new David R. Elliott album, Sunshine.  The reason this preorder exists is to help out with costs going forward.  The album has already been recorded and mixed, which I have already shelled out the dough for over the course of the last 6 months, now comes go time!  The album release date is June 4th, so between now and then I need to master the album and reproduce it.  These things cost a considerable amount of money, so I thought you all might wanna help a bit with that.  The $2000 goal is pretty straightforward, half of it to mastering and half of it to pressing.  That's actually a pretty conservative estimate but I think I can make it work.  Regardless of how close I actually get to my goal, those that contribute will indeed receive the perks described in this campaign.  Also as I said in the video, there are free ways to help as well, by sharing the campaign around and even just by sharing songs and videos and whatnot from the album.
LOVE, 
David R.

story:
Full length album, "Structures of the Universe"

Progressive Metallic Sounds

We are Spire - a five-piece metal band based in central New York. Since our formation in 2002, we have released three albums, two EPs, and a single. Over the last five years there has been a lot of writing, shows, pre-production, re-writing, shows, re-re-writing, re-pre-production...you get the picture. What has come out of all of this time spent is a full length album just shy of an hour containing the best representation of what this band has been striving to achieve. And though hard work pays off, we definitely had to pay hard for this work to bring it to life. Furthermore, we have to pay to get our music to you. That's where your support comes in. Our success in this project is in your hands.

The music for the album is done! The mixing and mastering is done! The album artwork is done! The new merch designs are done! And we really want you all to have this!

Now why are we asking for your contribution? Our budget for the album release is $3000. This covers the cost of pressing the album as CDs and releasing new merchandise in celebration of the album. By contributing to our campaign, you are helping us to release music in a straightforward and genuine way. Simply put, if you enjoy what we have to offer, you can take part in building the momentum this album deserves. 

To hear a preview track off the album, you can stream "The Myside Bias" by visiting spiremetal.bandcamp.com

**When placing your order, please indicate the size of the hoodie and/or shirt by typing the size next to your name OR into the ADDRESS 2 line (to the right of Address 1)**

story:
Free Fall cover, also available in Poster size as part of the USB Bundle!

Personal Introduction

Hey y’all, I’m Brittany Bexton, a Nashville country artist, with a bluesy, soulful edge. Musically, I’ve accomplished amazing things, and the only reason, I’ve come this far, is because of incredible support from people like you! I’m so very grateful to all of my generous fans, friends, and supporters, for getting me this far. Music has always been a part of who I am. For as long as I can remember, I knew that creating and performing was my calling. I have trained extensively in acting, dance, and music. I Studied voice for 15 years privately, and I attended college at the musical theater conservatory, PCPA. After college, I focused my energy back on my true passion, music. I moved to Nashville two years ago to pursue my dream full-time, and learn the business from the inside out, and it has been a whirlwind of a time in a lot of great ways! Now it’s time to take things to the next level! 

What We Need & What You Get

What the Campaign is for

I recorded a brand new single, called FREE FALL, in August, and released it in October. This single has been gaining traction in the music business, (top 5 on Music Road Radio, indie label offers, publisher interest). In order to maximize its full potential, I plan to bolster its visibility through a secondary market radio campaign. And, because my fans have been itching for more new music, I plan on recording a complete FREE FALL, EP. This funding goal will allow me to record 3 new songs, along with the necessary promotion. This is extremely expensive, but together I know we can make it happen!

After moving to Nashville, I quickly learned that the only way to “make it” in today’s business is to make it happen yourself. It is no longer about being discovered, but about creating your own business that thrives so much that a label might want to buy into what you have already begun. So, I started to build my business. Although I have experienced a lot of success on my own the last couple of years, both touring in more than 7 states, growing my fan base, and even gaining some airplay internationally, the challenge is that I’ve been doing all of this business work myself. This includes: marketing, booking, writing, radio promotion, practice/shows, recording, updating my website, and running my social media. Although I can do these things, I can’t do all of them effectively by myself. I know that I’m at the point that I need help from some industry pros to move to the next level. Unfortunately the promotional help I need costs a lot of money. This is why I need your help.

Hear FREE FALL here: https://soundcloud.com/brittany-bexton/free-fall-mp3

Cost Breakdown

 

I know $15,500 is a lot of money, but the cost of promotion and recording is very expensive. Below I have provided a breakdown of the costs, so that you can see with complete transparency exactly where your contribution will be going.

 

Radio Promo:

-$7,500 -  This includes radio promotion, tracking spins/adds & charts, & advertising.

-$1,500 – Cost of CDX disc delivery to stations.

Cost to record:

-$6,450 – this includes mixing, mastering, tracking, studio time, and production.

Additional Costs:

-$1,000 – Cost to print CD’s

-$3,000 – Cost of the Perks

-$4,000 – Cost to book and go on a radio tour.

-$3,000 – Cost to make a music video for FREE FALL

-$2,150 – Cost to record a 4th song

        

As you can see the costs add up quickly. You may have noticed that I have expenses listed that aren’t included in my funding goal. This is because I wanted to set a more reasonable goal to avoid the extra expense from Indiegogo (9% vs. 4% if I don’t meet my goal). However, these additional expenses are where the funding money will go if we exceed the goal.

 

*These are the most reasonable costs I could find for quality recording and promotion. The cost can be far more.

 

Perks

          

Enough about what I need! Have you checked out the awesome perks I’ll be giving away to my amazing contributors?? 

          

For anyone willing to take part in this effort, I’ve come up with many specialty merch items, and music offers. Some of these perks are special edition items, and only available through the campaign, like a specialized FREE FALL print painted by Sarah Greenman, numbered and signed. Or the never before offered MEGA Download! I even have the option to come join me in the recording studio for a behind the scenes peek, and photos! Check out the panel on the right to see what perk is right for you! THANK YOU!!!! 

Custom Free Fall Print by Sarah Greenman is one of the awesome perks!!

Other Ways You Can Help

      I know that not everyone is able to help financially, but you can ALL help by spreading the word! Please share this campaign with your friends and family. Post it on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and whatever other social media you use, email your friends about it, and use the Indiegogo share tools.  Again, thank you so much for your help and support over time! It means the world to me!

XO,

Brittany

story:
The making of a hit duo act? Yes!

For as long as we can remember, we (Jim Ambler and Pierce Peter Brandt) have been singing, acting, and dancing on stages from New York to California and beyond, in blockbuster Broadway productions, concerts, and professional regional theater. [For more details on our careers, scroll all the way down!]

We hit it off as pals when we were cast as the celebrity singing duo, "Wallace and Davis" in the hit stage version of the classic film, White Christmas. Our chemistry as singers, actors, and friends was a smash onstage and off, so we were inspired to keep the ball rolling, and the duo, Ambler & Brandt, was born. Our musical focus is songs from Broadway, classic standards and great "oldies," as well as light rock, popular music, and contemporary classics. We need your help to launch Ambler & Brandt and get this show on the road!

Scroll down for photos and details of our long list of fun PERKS including unique items for fans of Broadway musicals from our engagements in the Broadway productions of Les Misérables, Footloose, The Producers, Saturday Night Fever, Martin Guerre, and Jesus Christ Superstar.

So what's the plan?

To launch our duo act and make it viable for a variety of venues, we're currently in the process of building three shows that will range from 45–75 minutes each. These shows will be aimed at bookings in cabarets and nightclubs, concert halls with pops orchestras, cruise ships, and other venues. Building shows of this nature is a labor of love that we are absolutely passionate about, as it is essentially a culmination of our combined, nearly four decades of work in the professional performing arts, working on all sides of the footlights (in addition to performing, we have also worked as directors, vocal directors, choreographers, and teaching artists).


Our first show, Two on the Boards, will debut at one of San Francisco's top cabaret/nightclubs, Feinstein's at the Nikko on September 9, 2015. [See a behind-the-scenes preview in the video!] Two on the Boards is something of a hybrid – it's a retrospective of songs from many of our Broadway shows, and it's a nod to some of the famous duos and duets of our time.

Other shows in works include Five O'Clock Shadow (standards from classic crooners) and Something's Gotta Give (popular music and contemporary classics).

Once we've made our debut in Two on the Boards at Feinstein's, we'll be seeking the right management company to represent us for bookings across the country and internationally.

And what does it take to make it happen?

Art isn't easy, and it certainly isn't cheap! To get these shows up and running and ready for audiences, and then to pursue the right representation (management) there are significant costs involved...

  • Music Director
    For our first show, Two on the Boards, we've hired cabaret veteran, pianist, and music director extraordinaire, Billy Philadelphia. Billy is giving his expert guidance on creating the show and is writing the "charts" (see below) for the band, including custom arrangements of many of the songs. Billy will be at the piano for Two on the Boards at Feinstein's and is in charge of organizing the band. In the near future, we'll bring other music directors on board to help shape and build our other shows. When it comes to expert music directors (like Billy), their time, expertise, and finesse on the piano are like gold! A music director can make or break the show; it's as simple as that.
  • Music Charts
    For every song that we'll perform, custom charts (sheet music) need to be made for each instrument in the band. For smaller venues, a trio is ideal, but for others more instruments will be needed. Some venues will have bands of around 8 pieces, while others may be around 12. Of course, pops orchestras will be much larger; anywhere from 20-65 pieces! And charts aren't cheap, especially if you want them done well.
  • Band (musicians)
    Good musicians expect good pay. For Two on the Boards, Billy Philadelphia is bringing on board some expert players: Chuck Bennett on bass, and Mark Rosengarden on drums. In the near future, when we work with larger bands, our cost for paying musicians will soar to new heights! And it's worth it!
  • Suits and Tuxedos
    A class act has to look classy!
  • Photographs, Videos, and other Advertising/Promotion
    We created our first still photos and videos (such as those seen here) ourselves, learning our way as we went along. But, to promote ourselves for representation and future bookings, we'll need some great professional photos as well as professionally shot and edited promotional videos.
  • Travel and Hotel
    Getting the show on the road is a multi-faceted journey! In the near future, we will likely be flying across the country to meet with potential managers. We'll also be traveling to and from rehearsal venues and show venues once the new bookings begin. Of course, travel costs add up fast!

Perks! What you get for helping us out...

We've put together a great, long list of fun perks that we hope will entice you to join us on this journey! If you're a lover of theater and musicals, there's a list of Broadway fan giveaways that we hope will tickle your fancy, including memorabilia from Les Misérables, The Producers, Footloose, Saturday Night Fever, Martin Guerre, and Jesus Christ Superstar.

A quick summary:
PERKS from $15 (Sotto Voce Level) to $1700 (Fortissimo Level) – these include everything from online thank yous to our full professional show with a trio.
GIVEAWAYS of awesome Broadway memorabilia from $110 to $300 – these also include everything in the Mezzo-Forte Level.

    Your contribution is (y)our ticket to soar!

    Every little bit counts, and we will be so grateful for whatever you can chip in. When we're singing and making music, we often feel like we're spreading joy and giving those in our audiences the opportunity to step back from and/or reflect on their daily lives with humor, love, hope, and a sense of optimism. We'd like to share that with as many audiences as we can. As you can see from our extensive backgrounds in world-class performing arts, we each have the track records – and the passion for what we're doing – to ensure our continuing success as we venture into "duo territory!"

    Want to know more about our backgrounds?

    Jim Ambler made his Broadway debut in the original cast of Footloose (creating the role of "Lyle" and understudying/performing the leading roles of "Ren" and "Chuck") and also performed in the Broadway cast of Saturday Night Fever. He has performed in the touring Broadway productions of The Producers, Saturday Night Fever (in the pivotal role of "Bobby C"), and Cats. One of Jim's most cherished theatrical experiences was performing in the seminal revival production of West Side Story at the famed La Scala Opera House in Milan, Italy (in which he played "Riff" opposite Il Divo's David Miller as "Tony").

    Pierce Peter Brandt has performed leading and featured roles in the touring Broadway productions of Les Misérables and Martin Guerre (original cast), and the national tour of Jesus Christ Superstar. He's also a frequent guest concert soloist with metropolitan orchestras, as well a recording artist (including the upcoming studio cast album of the new musical The Fourth Messenger), and has performed at many of the country's finest professional regional theaters. He is a recipient of two DramaLogue/Backstage West Awards and a San Francisco Goodman Critics Award.

    For even more information on Jim and Pierce, visit their website!

    Are there any risks & challenges?

    Well, of course there are! As we said earlier, art isn't easy because there are so many variables involved. But when it's driven with the passion and excitement we have for making Ambler & Brandt soar, there's really no hurdle we can't jump. No matter what happens, our vision for making Ambler & Brandt a success will stay intact, and with that, we'll always succeed because we won't quit. Even if we don't raise the money we need, we'll find a way to make our vision come alive.

    Other ways you can help...

    Even if you can't or don't choose to contribute to our fundraising campaign, please help us by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign! And, come see us at Feinstein's at the Nikko on September 9th in San Francisco!

    • Tell people about this campaign!
    • Tell people about our upcoming performance at Feinstein's on Sept. 9th!
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

    Thank you so much for checking us out and for your consideration!

We've put together a great, long list of fun perks that we hope will entice you to join us on this journey! If you're a lover of theater and musicals, there's a list of Broadway fan giveaways that we hope will tickle your fancy, including memorabilia from Les Misérables, The Producers, Footloose, Saturday Night Fever, Martin Guerre,  and Jesus Christ Superstar.A quick summary: PERKS from $15 (Sotto Voce Level) to $1700 (Fortissimo Level) – these include everything from online thank yous to our full professional show with a trio.GIVEAWAYS of awesome Broadway memorabilia from $110 to $300 – these also include everything in the Mezzo-Forte Level.










Your contribution is (y)our ticket to soar! 
Every little bit counts, and we will be so grateful for whatever you can chip in. When we're singing and making music, we often feel like we're spreading joy and giving those in our audiences the opportunity to step back from and/or reflect on their daily lives with humor, love, hope, and a sense of optimism. We'd like to share that with as many audiences as we can. As you can see from our extensive backgrounds in world-class performing arts, we each have the track records – and the passion for what we're doing – to ensure our continuing success as we venture into "duo territory!"Want to know more about our backgrounds?

Jim Ambler made his Broadway debut in the original cast of Footloose
 (creating the role of "Lyle" and understudying/performing the leading 
roles of "Ren" and "Chuck") and also performed in the Broadway cast of Saturday Night Fever. He has performed in the touring Broadway productions of The Producers, Saturday Night Fever (in the pivotal role of "Bobby C"), and Cats. One of Jim's most cherished theatrical experiences was performing in the seminal revival production of West Side Story at the famed La Scala Opera House in Milan, Italy (in which he played "Riff" opposite Il Divo's David Miller as "Tony").
Pierce Peter Brandt has performed leading and featured roles in the touring Broadway productions of Les Misérables and Martin Guerre (original cast), and the national tour of Jesus Christ Superstar.
 He's also a frequent guest concert soloist with metropolitan 
orchestras, as well a recording artist (including the upcoming studio 
cast album of the new musical The Fourth Messenger),
 and has performed at many of the country's finest professional regional
 theaters. He is a recipient of two DramaLogue/Backstage West Awards and
 a San Francisco Goodman Critics Award.
For even more information on Jim and Pierce, visit their website!

Are there any risks & challenges?Well, of course there are! As we said earlier, art isn't easy because there are so many variables involved. But when it's driven with the passion and excitement we have for making Ambler & Brandt soar, there's really no hurdle we can't jump. No matter what happens, our vision for making Ambler & Brandt a success will stay intact, and with that, we'll always succeed because we won't quit. Even if we don't raise the money we need, we'll find a way to make our vision come alive. 
 Other ways you can help... Even if you can't or don't choose to contribute to our fundraising campaign, please help us by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign! And, come see us at Feinstein's at the Nikko on September 9th in San Francisco!  Tell people about this campaign!
Tell people about our upcoming performance at Feinstein's on Sept. 9th!
 Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!
   Thank you so much for checking us out and for your consideration!

story:
The music industry has changed. Most of us have to work a day job in order to survive and creativity comes at a price.

My music is made on expensive instruments, which I fund myself, but now I am reaching out to my listeners to help my dream of creating an experience through my music continue to grow.

I create experimental psychedelic trance under the name 'Satori'. In recent years I have moved from a laptop based studio to hardware. I sold my record collection and anything else I could find with worth to fund my synth purchases and I have built up a nice modular system and have a few other things, but i've run out of things to sell!

If I have ever reached you through my music, please consider giving back. My music will only continue to grow through the support of the people who listen to it.

This is a flexible funding campaign so even if it doesn't reach the target the money will go into purchasing equipment for the studio.

What I Need & What You Get

I am hoping to fund the purchase of a Dave Smith Pro 2 Analog Synthesizer. This instrument will be used as a central 'brain' of my studio, acting as synth, sequencer, effects and more.
This synth will be used in the creation of my upcoming album and any other future releases.
In return for pledges I will offer various rewards, from remix kits to exclusive unreleased music.

I thank you for your time and support.


Regards

Rory.
