story:
Opéra FOE's new album Notre Damn

Le nouvel album d'Opéra FOE - Notre Damn

 

We are five singers and musicians from Montreal, Quebec, who have created a new opera album, Notre Damn, which we'll be launching in January 2020.  With this pre-sale campaign, you have the opportunity to buy the album before its official launch, so that you (and your friends!) can enjoy it over the holiday season. 

The proceeds from this pre-sale campaign will help us recoup some of the costs associated with the album's manufacture, and also help us promote it in 2020. 

Nous sommes cinq chanteuses et musiciens de Montréal, Québec, et nous avons créé un album d'opéra actuel intitulé Notre Damn.  L'album sera lancé officiellement en janvier 2020, mais vous avez l'occasion, par cette campagne de pré-vente, de vous procurer une copie (ou plusieurs!) avant le temps des fêtes .

Les profits de cette campagne serviront à payer les frais de la manufacture du disque compact, ainsi qu'aux coûts de promotion de l'album.

 

Notre Damn, the Opera / L'opéra Notre Damn

The music in Notre Damn was composed by Rachel Burman (also artistic director of Opéra FOE) for an opera of the same name, which we presented at Montreal's Théâtre La Chapelle in 2014.

L'opéra Notre Damn a été composé par Rachel Burman (directrice artistique de la compagnie Opéra FOE) et présenté au Théâtre La Chapelle, à Montréal, en 2014.

The opera imagines the (fictional) lives of renegade nuns who left England during the Victorian era to found a mission in a far-off land.  Eventually abandoning their religious vocation in favour of a life of radical freedom in their new home, the ‘sisters’ birthed and raised children.   

Cet opéra mettait en scène les descendantes d’une bande de sœurs-renégates, parties de l’Angleterre à la fin du 19e siècle, sous prétexte de fonder une mission dans un pays lointain. Ayant rapidement abandonné leur vocation religieuse pour une vie d’indépendance radicale, trois générations de ces femmes expriment les états et les conflits inhérents à leur situation.

 

The songs from the opera delve into the inner lives of these imagined women and their descendants.

Les chansons explorent les vies intérieures de ces femmes imaginées, et de leurs descendantes.

If you're interested  in knowing more about the origins of the project and the artists involved, you could have a peek at the crowdfunding campaign we ran in 2014, to raise money for the production.  https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1207585601/opera-foe-creates-and-produces-its-first-opera

S'il vous intéresse d'en savoir plus sur les origines du projet et les artistes impliqués, on vous invite à consulter notre dernière campagne de sociofinancement, menée à l'orée de ce spectacle en 2014.  https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1207585601/opera-foe-creates-and-produces-its-first-opera

The Recording / L'enregistrement

We received a grant from the Canada Council for the Arts to turn this opera into an album, and so for three days, recording engineer Danys Levasseur moved his studio Le vent dominant to Holy Trinity Church in the bucolic village of Irlande, Québec - an intimate, inspiring place to record.

Le Conseil des arts du Canada nous a accordé une subvention afin de produire un album de la musique de Notre Damn.  Pendant trois jours, l'ingénieur de son Danys Levasseur a déménagé son studio, Le vent dominant, dans la petite Église Holy Trinity dans la municipalité d'Irlande, Québec - un endroit fort inspirant pour enregistrer...

What followed were three intense and deeply fulfilling days of recording.

Les sessions d'enregistrement qui ont suivi on été intenses, productives et joyeuses. 

 

This was followed by a prolonged period of mixing with sound engineer Raymond Legault, in his groovy studio.

Après l'enregistrement, c'était le mixage audio, avec Raymond Legault, dans son studio groovy à Montréal.

Mixing (at least in our case) was a very important and creative stage of the process. We were searching for our sound... and we were also creating textures, colours and atmospheres that fit with the imaginative world of the opera.

Il s'agissait d'une étape essentielle au développement du timbre dominant de l'album, du son de l'ensemble.  Nous cherchions à reproduire les couleurs et atmosphères du monde imaginaire que nous avions créé sur scène, qui représentaient pour nous l'essence de l'écriture.

I won't say how long we took to mix the album, but I will say that from Raymond's 15th floor balcony, I got to see Montreal's Mount Royal in various states of dress and undress.

Je ne vous dirai pas combien de temps nous avons mis à mixer l'album... juste que, du balcon de Raymond au 15ène étage, j'ai pu voir le Mont-Royal habillé de toutes sortes de façons.

 

Fast-forward a few months...  The CDs have just been delivered, and they're lovely (thanks to graphic design by Marie-Love Petit).  Here's a preview of the outside cover.

Quelques mois plus tard... Les CDs sont arrivés, tout beaux, grâce au travail graphique de   Marie-Love Petit.  Voici un aperçu de l'extérieur de la pochette.

 

We are very proud of this album and can't wait to share it with you!

Nous sommes bien fiers de cet accomplissement et nous avons hâte de le partager avec vous!

 

About Your Contribution / À propos de votre contribution

Here's how we'll use the proceeds from this campaign:

  • The first 1500$ will reimburse CD manufacturing costs. 
  • Any funds exceeding this will go towards promoting the album.

 

Another fantastic way of helping us out is by talking about us to your friends, playing the album for them, sharing the link to this campaign on social media, and all that sort of thing...

Voici comment nous utiliserons vos contributions à cette campagne:

  • Les premiers 1500$ rembouseront les frais de la manufacture du disque compact
  • Toute récolte excédant ce montant servira à la promotion de l'album. 

 

Une autre façon de contribuer à cette campagne est de la partager: parlez-en à vos amis, faites-leur écouter notre musique, partagez sur les médias sociaux, etc...  Merci à l'avance!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our campaign.  Wishing you all the best for the holidays.  Rest up, we'll have work to do in the next decade!

 

Merci infiniment de prendre le temps de connaître ce projet.  En vous souhaitant de très belles fêtes... Reposez-vous, la nouvelle décennie s'annonce exigeante et nous aurons besoin de réunir nos forces!

story:
About Us

We are a Progressive Metal band from Melbourne, Australia with a united goal to release an amazing album and music video for release early 2015.

After the acclaimed success of our last release Esoteric Symbolism,  we are excited to incorporate an even greater progressive style and direction with this concept album.

Nathan Peachey (Vocals), Dave Holley (Keyboards) and Luis Enrique Eguren (Bass), together with founding member and guitar extraordinaire Dean Wells and long time drummer, Dean Kennedy, we are set to release an amazing, progressive concept album that will retain our classic Teramaze sound whilst exploring some new musical ground we haven't been before.

    We are all genuinely excited to share our new music with you and cannot express enough how helpful reaching our funding goal would be to us and to the final product.

    Why Crowd Funding?

    We are aiming for a total of $15,000 AUS.

     This will enable us to record and release a world class progressive album together with a full HD, professionally shot music video to promote the release.

    As dedicated and committed as we are, we cannot achieve this alone and we are asking YOU, our fans to assist and join us on this journey.

    There will be different PERKS available enabling you to choose what's best for you. No matter how big or small your contribution, it ALL helps and together we can get to where we need to be to get the best Teramaze album yet into your hands.


        What this will achieve

        Reaching our goal will enable us to spend $10,000 towards the album mixing, mastering and art design, whilst $5,000 will go towards an amazing, professionally shot music video to promote the release.

          With an already impressive fan base across the world, of which YOU are already a part of, reaching this goal will result in a world class progressive release that will gain more interest from progressive circles, media and promotion companies. Hopefully this will gain more exposure to the new album and maybe just maybe, assist us in a tour of your Country.

            What if we don't hit our goal?

             Every single dollar we generate will in someway, help.

            Should we not hit our full target, the funding raised will be prioritised. Our number one priority is the album itself, its recording, packaging and marketing. We want you to hear our new music. Worst case scenario is the music video doesn't get done.  Ideally we want to release the full package of the Album and Video, if not, the album comes first, always.

            If for whatever reason you can't make a pledge, that is perfectly fine! You can still be a great help by sharing and promoting our cause.

            We are forever grateful for everyone's help, THANK YOU!

story:
‘Allo, Teal Nation! This is String of the Lost Boys writing to you once again with some fantastic news: we are on the verge of completing an urgent and long-standing goal of ours, the rerelease of Bedlam, our second CD, which has been out of print since the fall of 2008! 

Bedlam was a true milestone for us, recorded during our first real rush of success, the moment when we realized that we were actually on to something! We knew we had some good ideas when we recorded our first album, Rogues in a Nation, but Bedlam was created on the wave of energy that came from all of you in our audience, when we first experienced your enthusiasm and your amazing reaction to our music. For the past six years we've been working towards the moment when we could on once more present this important collection of songs to you, but we need your aid in completing the final stages of the process!

This new edition of Bedlam will feature the talents of the original line up in all their glory: Clarence the Destroyer, Johnny Ozbourne, Michael Starr, and String, as well as some important contributions by current band members William, Son of William (we think) and Sgt. David Pepper Harrison-Harrison.  The many extras will include some long-missing documents from the 2002-2004 period, such as the Boys' studio rendition of the Star Bangled Banner (as performed at many a sporting event during the time), as well as "Boys Only" versions of "My Reward," "Kiss Me, You Fool," "Alms for the Poor," and "Loch Lomond."   In addition, there will be 3 brand new songs specifically recorded for this collection, along with fan favorites "Art Thou Ready?," "Mystic Caravan," "Bedlam Boys," and many, many more from the original release!

The music itself is nearing finalization, but we need help raising the money to pay for the finished artwork ($500), to have the final audio mixed and mastered ($1000), and to have the CD’s physically manufactured ($2500); $4000 should do it! 

Completion of this project will get us one step closer to having our entire catalog back in print, and allow us up to get on with the creation of a brand new full length album. So, the new Bedlam will serve both the old and the new: presenting once again a key document in our development as well as providing some new Teal Madness for you to enjoy!

We have once again devised numerous perks not only to thank you for your ongoing support, but also to help us get our new sounds into your hands as quickly as possible. There are lots of options to choose from, everything from a simple copy of the new record to a DVD of our 15th anniversary show (featuring 11 Lost Boys all on stage together) to an opportunity to actually appear on our next full length CD (Seas of Fate, due towards the end of 2015), so please choose an option below, and help us on our way!

We’re confident that we’ll all band together and meet our goal, but if for some reason we fall short, all of the money that does get raised will be used to finish as much of the CD as possible, while we continue to save our own pennies to complete the project. So all of the funds will go towards the cause, and your generous contributions will help us to get it done far sooner than we otherwise would be able to! 

As we all know, the creation of new music is vital to the ongoing development of any group, and the Lost Boys have got a lot of material that we want to share with you. Raising the money to pay for the production of our albums is an ongoing challenge, but we think going the extra mile to present as high a quality of production as we can definitely pays off in the end. The extra time and care that we put into our records does cost more than it otherwise might, but the results sure speak for themselves. We just want to keep making these CD's, and with your support we've been able to get several titles out there in recent years: the new Rogues in a Nation in 2013, our Collected Quarto compilation in 2014, and now the rerelease of Bedlam in early 2015. Let's keep the trend going!

Thank you so much for your support! Please choose a perk, and use Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word about our new project. As always, we couldn’t do this without you! 

Lots o’ love from all of us,

The Lost Boys-

 String, Will, Bombast, Harry, & Asheen

So all of the funds will go towards the cause, and your generous contributions will help us to get it done far sooner than we otherwise would be able to! As we all know, the creation of new music is vital to the ongoing development of any group, and the Lost Boys have got a lot of material that we want to share with you. Raising the money to pay for the production of our albums is an ongoing challenge, but we think going the extra mile to present as high a quality of production as we can definitely pays off in the end. The extra time and care that we put into our records does cost more than it otherwise might, but the results sure speak for themselves. We just want to keep making these CD's, and with your support we've been able to get several titles out there in recent years: the new Rogues in a Nation in 2013, our Collected Quarto compilation in 2014, and now the rerelease of Bedlam in early 2015. Let's keep the trend going!Thank you so much for your support! Please choose a perk, and use Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word about our new project. As always, we couldn’t do this without you! Lots o’ love from all of us,The Lost Boys- String, Will, Bombast, Harry, & Asheen

story:
Banjo Picker. Holler Rat. Radical. 

I am an old-time musician who has spent most of his adult life studying the masters of Kentucky repertoire, the women and men deep in the hills who have kept these traditions alive one song at a time. I am also a student of Little Feat, Tribe Called Quest, and Sex Pistols. Coming out of Van Lear, Kentucky, where my family for generations worked in the mines, I'd say I'm also a student of rock-scrabble wealth: the love and loss you're gifted when you have to work for a living.

GONE BOY, my long-awaited second solo record, is a genre-crossing tour of traditionals remembered and revamped, surprising covers, and new originals that sing together something about hard work and dignity, something about faith. 

                    


I've long-awaited it, I mean. My first record, Cold Icy Mountain (JuneAppal, 2008), was recorded on a dime but received praise from Sing Out, Bluegrass Unlimited, and Maverick. I've wanted to make GONE BOY every day since. With your help, I can.  


The Give & Take.
I'm asking $8000 to support the basic needs of GONE BOY. You know: the recording studio bills, the mastering, the pressing. Things like that. My stretch goal is $15,000, which will pay for all outgoing expenses, including hiring a PR firm and paying the band. Trust me, the band is tired of free pizza.

Your support will help me do this and do it right:

The band is Carla Gover and Owen Reynolds (of Zoe Speaks) and master fiddler Jesse Wells, with cameos from Arthur Hancock IV, David Prince, and Diane Timmons. 

  


The album cover is by Dirk Fowler of F2 Design. This premier letterpress designer from Lubbock, Texas has worked for Merle Haggard, The Bottle Rockets, The Mavericks, Wilco--you name it-- and he has been praised by everyone from PBS to the New York Times. 


Shangri-la Productions of Lexington, Kentucky has worked with Jim James, Daniel Martin Moore, These United States, Sturgill Simpson, Ben Solee, and Vandaveer. GONE BOY will be recorded, engineered, and mixed by Shangri-la's wizard, Duane Lundy.

Independent Mastering of Nashville, Tennessee offers 20 years of Grammy nominated excellence. Dixie Chicks. John Prine. George Straight. GONE BOY. Just kidding. Not really. 


We got this.

Indiegogo is telling me now it's time to build trust with you. But if you know anything about me, you know I do what I say I'm going to do. Y'all ready know that for the last fifteen years I've worked on boards and staffs alike across the Commonwealth to help celebrate cultural heritage and spread traditional arts. I helped start the Morehead Old Time Music Festival and The Lexington Old Time Music Gathering; I've been core staff for Seedtime on the Cumberland: Festival of Mountain Music and Arts for years. You also know my first solo record, which I talk about above, is not my only record; I've recorded on projects like Rich & the Po' Folks' When the Whistle Blew and The New Young Fogies compilation in these intervening years. My word is good. You'll get your copy of GONE BOY soon, plus all the extra treats you raise up for and maybe some surprises too. And it will be a record that draws deeply from within the truly multi-ethnic, politically progressive histories of the Kentucky repertoire tradition, while also exhibiting the innovation and creative boundary pushing those masters were practicing all along.  

  


The Gamble. 

Well without your contributions, both of the dollar and sharing kind, I might not meet my base goal of $8000. I'll be honest, this won't mean that GONE BOY doesn't get made. But it will mean I'll have to pile up a heap of bartending hours and credit card debt. And I'll have little means left over to do much else with GONE BOY once it's made. Further in that scenario, your dollars would do less work: if a campaign doesn't reach its base goal, Indiegogo takes a higher, not a lower, percentage of the gain.

If we meet the $8k and don't meet the $15k, the record gets made on the promised, but unjustly promised, backs of the musicians, who have all ready donated 80 + hours to the project. It also sets at risk the involvement of a PR firm, which will ensure reviewers and radio stations receive the record package.


The Odds. 

The band and I are hard at work all ready. We didn't want to come to you without having accomplished the song list, arrangements, and rehearsals. We even have most of the recording complete. And, yes, the bills are piling up and, yes, they're getting paid by way of my living paycheck to debt to paycheck. But the short term financial insecurity was worth it to me to be able to come to you with something real. I'm not asking you to take any risk I haven't been willing to make myself. Think of GONE BOY, not as the horse leaving the gate, but as the horse leading in the last furlong, and, somehow, the bet is still on. 


You broke too? 

I get it. I do.
  • Join the community. I don't use that word lightly. You're coming with us, friends. We'll be sharing our journey on this page as we move forward, and supporters will be included in special offers as we grow. 
  • Ask for a signed LP as a birthday gift from your ma. Or be the one to give it to her! Our $25 level is a cheap trip to Target and it comes without the stress of parking. We'd love to be your current CSA (community supported art) for all holidays, anniversaries, divorce celebrations, and get well soons. 
  • Have a venue where you'd like to host an event to raise funds for the campaign? PM me. Know about a grant that supports traditional arts and artists? PM me. Teach a class wherein I can offer a Skype visit q&a and earn support? PM me. 
  • Help us get the word out! If you share to your social network, your email list, your fellow board members, your staff, your family, you will heroically make everyone's $25 go a long, long way.

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm Allie, a Berklee alumni and current music teacher and vocalist in Hudson Valley, NY!
  • I have an opportunity to work with Tangent Music, LLC again to create yet another ground-breaking professional recording/music video using their arrangement of a brand new pop tune!
  • A large production such as this comes with many expenses. Your contributions can help us bring this project to life as well as pay each and every one of the musicians/production staff what they deserve for their valuable time and effort! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is $2,000. This includes: Use of the recording studio ($300), an engineer and assistant engineer ($200), mixing & mastering ($200), arrangement/production ($250), video ($550), and paying the players ($400). * As well as IndieGoGo fees at 0.5% (100).
  • Our unique perks include early downloads, Skype voice lessons, shout outs included in the final video description on YouTube, and more! 
  • With IndieGoGo's flexible funding, we're able to put any funds we DO raise from this campaign towards paying our musicians and production team! With that- any and all contributions help us out!

The Impact

  • By contributing to this campaign, you're supporting over a dozen musicians as they come together to create yet another elaborate production of music.
  • You may have seen last year's "Always Starting Over" video - This was produced by the same team, only this year, we've added a second videographer!

Risks & Challenges

  • With this campaign, we of course run the risk of not meeting our goal. Our crew is entirely made up of musicians- These professional musicians deserve to be paid for their time, work, and art, just as anybody else would deserve to be paid for their services.
  • If we do not meet our goal, we will not be able to put the pieces of this elaborate production together- BUT, we're confident that your contributions will help to support this large group of musical humans!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us by sharing this campaign page on any and EVERY social media outlet you can think of! IndieGoGo makes it super easy with their nifty share tools!

story:
If you follow my music career, know me personally, know of me; any of these things, then you already know what I am trying to do. For those who don't, my name is Evan Barlow. I am a 24 year old person in long term recovery. For me, this means I haven't used a drug or had a drink in over four years. Now, don't read this and take it the wrong way. Just because I don't drink doesn't mean I dislike people who do; it's just I can’t have a drink or use drugs of any kind, because of my addiction.

At the age of 16, I became addicted to heavy pain killers. Believe it or not, pills were a completely normal thing to experiment with, at that age, when I was growing up. Kids are being exposed to more and more drugs at an early age now a day. My addiction eventually progressed to the point where i became an IV heroin user. This was the drug that took me all the way down. After years and years of countless rehabs, jails, institutions, putting my family through all sorts of misery, lying, manipulating, and just all around torture, I finally got clean. It wasn't until I hit a very hard rock bottom that I finally made the decision to turn my life around. In early February of 2012, my mother passed away from a heart attack. At the time of her death, I was in jail for things I had done in my active addiction. I can’t even begin to describe the sense of loss, guilt, and hate that I felt, for myself, at this time in life. It's like a light went off in my head that was making me feel like I caused this. Her blood was on my hands; in my eyes. Because of my selfish, manipulative and addictive behavior, I now had to bury my mother. Since her death, I have not touched or taken one drink or used any drugs. This was truly was a blessing in disguise. I believe it was my “wake up call”. She was in much pain due to the fact she had undergone back surgery that left her bed ridden for years prior to her passing. I know, in my heart, she is with God in a much better place.

Since becoming clean, I have discovered that I have a beautiful gift. The gift of life. The gift of purpose. The ability to touch souls with my voice. The ability to make a difference. Growing up, the one drug that I could always count on, the one thing that was there for me when no one was, the one thing I could turn to at any time, was music. Music is the best drug! It’s the greatest way to enter someone’s heart and soul, without even knowing them personally. God gave me a story, a message, and a platform to share it on. About two years ago, I made the decision to start pursing my career in music, seriously.

In the past two years, we have accomplished quite a bit. We’ve been on huge stages, worked with huge names, and made a positive impact on a lot of people’s lives. I sat down with some close friends and family, developed an A1 team -who I love dearly- and we hit the ground running. The end goal, here, is to speak to my people who see no way out of their addiction. The people who don't even realize there is a way out. The people who struggle daily with addiction and have no idea that recovery is possible!

I want to reach the masses with my story. One way or another, I know I am going to. I will not quit. I will not give up. Because it’s not my will to quit, give up or let you all down. This is the will of the greater good, to make a difference in this world. I want to speak to the addict who still suffers from the monster that is Addiction, through my music. From the kid who has no idea what he's getting himself into when he picks up that beer for the first time, the mother of two who thinks sticking a needle in her arm is the only way to feel normal, or the sister who take pills to fit in with the "normal" people. I do this not only for the individual who suffers, but for the families and friends who suffer just as much from the individual’s actions.

In order to continue our career in changing the world, we need your help. We've made a lot of great music, a lot of great videos, and accomplished more than I could have possibly imagined two years ago. But, everything we have created has a price; the high quality videos, the mastering of music, the traveling, the merchandise, everything. For the most part, we have given away everything we have created so far, for free. I really wanted to take this as far as I could without asking for money from my people, but now we are at the point where we just need a little more to keep this project going.

On top of what we have already invested, we need about $11k to comfortably reach our goal. We've got the videos covered; the Public Relations locked in, the songs written, and everything in between. This money will go toward the creation of a brand, new project; our first album. We just released our final mixtape, Fabrics. With the promotions we have set in place for Fabrics and by the time we are ready to release our album, our movement will have grown substantially. I truly believe that the music we have in store will finally reach the masses with our message. I say, “Our,” because that's what it is. It's not just me, it's all of you. It's everyone who believes, everyone who helps, everyone who is a part of this journey. This is Our Success.

Hopefully something I've said here helps you see our vision. If you can help us reach this goal, it would mean the world to us and we would be forever grateful. This is the final push to the next level, the final step. Please come with us as conquer this mountain and overcome our obstacles. Anything helps, and every bit matters.

Sincerely,

Evan Barlow

Here's a song we did for the rehab that saved my life, the Mcshin Foundation, for an idea of what we do. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b9jNEivnn-A

story:
Short Summary

I've recorded an EP with three original songs that I will be selling starting November 1st on bandcamp.com. The EP was an idea that I had as for a gift for actor Ryan Kelley, who plays Deputy Jordan Parrish on MTV's Teen Wolf.  Two of the songs on the EP are based off of his character, and another one is based off of season 5 of teen wolf, in which Parrish plays a key role. On the show, Parrish is a hellhound, so I had the idea to title the EP Hound, and donate all the profit to Welcome Home Dog Rescue, a non profit organization that aids abused, neglected, and homeless dogs. Although the songs on the EP are based around Teen Wolf and Parrish, they also have relatable qualities and they stand on their own, so if you don't watch the show, you won't be missing out! This indiegogo is to raise money to produce the CDs and merchandise which will be sold to raise money for the organization. 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to not have to pay myself back on any expenses, like merchandise or CD production, so that all of the money can go straight to WHDR. The money raised will go to funding CDs, shirts, tanks, buttons, and other merchandise that will be sold to raise money. Without this fundraiser, only about $3.00 would be raised for each shirt, whereas with these funds, $20.00 can be raised for each purchase, since I won't have to spend my personal money on the product. You will get rewards which you can choose from as a thank you for donating! 

The Impact

By donating to this, you are helping to make it possible for more money to be raised for WHDR. Since they are a non profit, and the workers are volunteers, the money goes straight to rescuing and taking care of more dogs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to this, it still helps if you buy a copy of the EP when it comes out, or just spread the word on social Media! Use the tag #HoundEP on instagram and twitter to let people know!

The money raised will go to funding CDs, shirts, tanks, buttons, and other merchandise that will be sold to raise money. Without this fundraiser, only about $3.00 would be raised for each shirt, whereas with these funds, $20.00 can be raised for each purchase, since I won't have to spend my personal money on the product. You will get rewards which you can choose from as a thank you for donating! 
    The Impact By donating to this, you are helping to make it possible for more money to be raised for WHDR. Since they are a non profit, and the workers are volunteers, the money goes straight to rescuing and taking care of more dogs.
    
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't donate to this, it still helps if you buy a copy of the EP when it comes out, or just spread the word on social Media! Use the tag #HoundEP on instagram and twitter to let people know!

story:
Departure's New Destination

www.departureduo.com

Hello and welcome!

We are Departure, a Boston-based soprano and double bass duo that specializes in the performance of pieces written specifically for this unusual combination. We are also Nina Guo and Eddie Kass, two friends who are excited to bring their high/low contemporary music to the world!

This summer, we have been invited to play at Omaha Under the Radar, an innovative festival for experimental performance in Omaha, Nebraska. We feel honored by the opportunity to perform our repertoire in the Midwest and share the magic of soprano+double bass with a whole new audience. We cannot wait to bring this music to the Omaha community and other artists at the festival!! 

We are fundraising to cover the cost of travel for both of us and the bass to get to Omaha. 

 

 Looks like flying is the only option...

Although Omaha Under the Radar provides a generous $400 honorarium, we need $800 more to cover the cost of travel to Omaha for all three of us (two people, one bass). 

  • The numbers game: 

$450 - Nina's flights

$450 - Eddie's flights

$200 - Bass flights

$100 - Taxi to/from airport for bass

------------------------

$1200 Total

-$400 Honorarium from OUR

------------------------

$800 Grand total

Fundraising amount: $800

(Pst! Look to the right for some of the perks we've got lined up for you.) 

 

High/Low goes Middle!  

Most people in the world have never heard a concert of exclusively soprano/double bass music (we know, we were shocked too). Almost anytime we play a concert, we introduce our audience members to a whole world of repertoire they did not know existed. Even those more "in the know" are surprised by how much variety is in the music we play. People have described our concerts as "thought-provoking," "engaging," and "fun." 

We love our obscure repertoire and want to share it with everyone.

By supporting our campaign, you help to keep our music alive. Most of the music we perform does not get heard outside of our concerts. We believe in the musical viability of our duo and want to bring it to as many people as possible. Performing at Omaha Under the Radar is an amazing opportunity for us to connect with a Midwestern audience and our new music colleagues. Your donation to our campaign paves the way for more soprano/double bass repertoire to be written and more performances to happen in the future. 

Thank you for your interest in our campaign!!!!

story:
My name is Conrad Gayle and I am a 31 year old jazz pianist and composer from Toronto Ontario.  I have been playing the piano for 25 years and I have released online many recordings of my work.

In order to get airplay, exposure and further appreciation of my original music worldwide, I need to raise $3000 to reproduce 250 copies of my three albums:  Genesis, Foundations, and The Live Sessions 09/10.

Please spread the word and may the music never end.

story:
In Japanese

私たちTokyoliteはStevan AriantoとAlexander Bramonoによるバンドです。２００９年に結成し、コンテンポラリー・ポップを軸にファンクやロック等の要素を取り入れた独自の音楽で活動しているインドネシアのインディペンデント・ミュージシャンです。現在リリースされているファーストフルアルバム“Avenue”とミニアルバム“Hello”は私たちのBandcampアカウントでご清聴いただけます。私たちのプロフィールや活動は以下の写真でもご確認いただけます。

関西ミュージックカンファレンス

今度、大阪で開催される国際規模のフェス、関西ミュージックカンファレンス（以後KMCと表記）にTokyoliteの出演が決定いたしました！KMCは、世界の五大陸、十数ヶ国から、幅広いジャンルのインディペンデント・アーティスト、音楽産業関係者、音楽教育関係者、音楽ファンなどが、音楽に関する最新情報を分かち合うと共に、異文化の交流をはかり民族間の相互理解を深め世界平和に寄与するカンファレンス（展示会）です。世界の音楽文化の発展を目的とする「ミュージック・カンファレンス」を開催し、ライブ・パフォーマンスを楽しむだけでなく、音楽に関するセミナーなどを通じ、様々な民族音楽や文化を紹介する場も提供されています。

Tokyoliteが日本で万全な状態での演奏をするためには多大な支援と資金が必要です。Tokyoliteは2013年に日本のテレビ局の招待を受けて来日し、テレビを通じて日本全国の皆さんに向けてライブをしました。その甲斐あって今回の来日で、KMC出演以外でも、数多くの日本のミュージシャン仲間からライブのお誘いを頂きました。Tokyoliteにとって日本はとても大切な場所であり、日本とインドネシア、双方のインディペンデント・アーティストの交流がこのプロジェクトを通じて深まることを願っています。

チーム構成

日本に向かうチームはアディショナル・プレイヤーや撮影班、そしてTokyoliteの二人を含めた計9人となろます。撮影班は来日のための資金集めやその他の準備、そして日本滞在期間中の様子を記録し、私たちと同じように活動を行なっているたくさんのインディペンデント・アーティストに送るドキュメンタリー映像の制作を予定しています。現在、私たちはこのプロジェクト成功のための必要金額2億5千万ルピア（約200万円）をクラウドファンディングやスポンサー等の協力を元に収集しています。プロジェクトの進行状況は随時ご報告し、もちろん支援していただいた方には私たちからスペシャルな還元をご用意させていただきます！

最後に、このプロジェクトを支援していただける皆様、そして携わっている皆様に感謝の気持ちを申し上げます。併せてこのプロジェクトを拡散していただけたら幸いです。ご支援のほど、よろしくお願い致します！


In English

We are Tokyolite, Indonesian band consisting of Alexander Bramono and Stevan Arianto playing a funky flavoured pop with some added elements of alternative rock music. As a band, we are currently running independently from 2009 and we have released 1 LP titled "Avenue" and 1 EP titled "Hello, which you can check at iTunes or bandcamp.

Kansai Music Conference

We are confirmed to play at this year Kansai Music Conference (KMC), a independently run globally oriented music conference in Osaka, Japan. features a wide range of music from traditional to cutting edge performances. From America to Europe and Asia. Tokyolite is the sole representative from South East Asia to play at this year KMC.

However, to play in KMC and spread our music to the wider audience in Japan and the world there's still a lot more of works to do and funds to gather as Tokyolite is up until now still a independent band and doing the works all by ourselves.Tokyolite is no stranger to the Japanese music scene as we have already played in a japanese TV show back then in 2013. Beside playing in KMC, we also will do a little tour organized by our Japanese friends.


More Details

Tokyolite is a 2 man band, so we need to bring 2 more guys as additional players and also documentation team. We want to capture the amazing moments and making a video of our journey, to inspire another musicians. We need total US$ 20.000 to fund the journey which most of all we raise from sponsors and crowdfunding.


Thank you for your attention, please kindly share the story or be a part of our journey!


Best Regards


Tokyolite

story:
*Francais au bas de la page

We are Mj's. An original band from Trois-Rivières, Québec.

We are intensely excited to share our first full length album: Release. We have gone through the lengthy process of recording and mixing, now our 12 songs creation is ripe for the final step; Mastering!

This is where your help and generosity comes into play. Producing and sharing an album is costly business, and we want it to be exactly the way it should be, it is something so dear to our heart!

Help us break through the last hurdle and give us the pleasure to share our work and passion with you and the world! 


Here is what we need to complete the album and where you will help:

The album must go through mastering, a vital step that makes an album a complete experience, final mixing and several tedious and crucial steps.

We then take the completed "Master" album and go to printing, This includes printing the actual CD, the booklet and packaging.

To support our album and the much awaited tour we need "Merch". T-shirts and home-made jewelries will be available during our shows at every venues. These cost quite a lot of money up front but will greatly help us make a living on the road.

We are working with local artists and friends on the design and visuals. Helping with their art, we want to help them keeping making a living and a part of our funding will go towards this.

The release of our album is what we need to make a breakthrough and share our passion.

 Have a look to the following list: you can contribute many ways, either ways you will be some of the first to enjoy our first album! You can throw in a t-shirt or jewelry, even book us for a gig!

 Come see us live if we come to your town, this is what we do best and it means the world to us!



Please share and thank you for helping us sharing Release with the world!

Don't forget to LIKE and SHARE our Facebook fan page to know every updates and new releases! www.facebook.com/MJsband

Listen here: www.mjsband.bandcamp.com

Much love!

MJ's


*Bonjour, nous sommes MJ’s, un groupe localisé à Trois-Rivières, Québec.

Nous somme vraiment heureux de pouvoir maintenant vous partager ce tout premier album : Release

L’enregistrement et le mixage étant chose fait, ce projet de 12 pièces est maintenant prêt pour la dernière étape: le Mastering!

C’est ici que votre générosité nous prêtera main forte. La production et le partage d’un album est une affaire coûteuse, et nous tenons à partager un produit de qualité et à notre couleur, parce que ca nous tiens à coeur! 

Nous demandons votre aide pour nous aider à traverser cette dernière étape, et partager le fruit de notre passion!

Voici ce que nous devons faire avant de pouvoir vous partager l’album et ce en quoi vous pouvez contribuer:

L'album doit passer par la masterisation; une étape cruciale qui fait d'un album une expérience complète.

Une fois cette étape franchie, nous l’envoyons à l’impression. Cela inclus l’impression du CD, la pochette, l’emballage et la duplication.

Pour nous donner un coup de main pendant la tournée nous aurons besoin de marchandise: Des t-shirts et des bijoux fait à la mains seront en ventes lors de nos spectacles. Cela nous coute également de l’argent à produire, mais cet investissement nous aidera au bout du compte à poursuivre le projet.

Nous collaborons avec des artistes locaux pour la conception et le visuel. Nous désirons pouvoir les encourager à notre tour dans leur art et une partie des fonds amassés servira dans ce sens à les remercier.

La sortie de l’album est un morceau important pour nous aider à percer et à partager notre passion avec le monde entier!

Jetez un oeil aux contreparties; vous pouvez contribuer de plusieurs façons. Peu importe celle que vous choisirez, vous serez l’un(e) des premier(e)s à découvrir notre premier album! Vous pouvez choisir t-shirt ou bijoux, et même nous " booker" un spectacle! 

Venez nous voir en spectacle: c'est là que la magie se passe et que le retour d'énergie est le plus palpable.

Merci de partager et de nous aider à faire connaitre Release à tout le monde!

N’oubliez pas de vous abonner et de partager notre page Facebook pour rester au parfum des nouveautés.. www.facebook.com/MJsband

Notre musique ici:  www.mjsband.bandcamp.com

Affectueusement, 

MJ's

MJ's

story:
Our Story

My wife and I began UpBeat NYC in March of 2009 as a musical outreach for inner-city children, youth and adults. Since then, with the enormous help of family, friends, volunteers and partner organizations, we have established programs in Mott Haven, South Bronx and Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. Each program provides year-round music education to community residents completely free of charge. Our participants currently study piano, woodwinds, strings, guitar, percussion and voice.


Each program creates an environment that fosters personal achievement, creative self‐expression and group cooperation, empowering individuals by nurturing their unique qualities and strengthening their sense of purpose within the community. UpBeat NYC upholds the belief that every aspect of each student must be nurtured, not just their musical abilities. In communities where the social fabric is weakened by the adversities of poverty, our organization aims to empower individuals to see themselves and their peers in a different light.


The Impact

In a city that has nearly eliminated music education from its public schools, generations of families living in impoverished communities have raised children in an environment offering few realistic music education opportunities. For the 41% of Bed-Stuy children and 56% of Mott Haven children living in poverty, access to private instruction is simply unaffordable. Their hopes for music education are left to budget-pinched out-of-school time programs whose efforts leave nearly 14,000 children with no services, music or otherwise.


UpBeat addresses this need by providing free, year-round music education programming for Bed-Stuy and Mott Haven residents. Beyond music education, our services promote community engagement and offer positive alternatives during the critical after-school hours when risk to youth's health and safety are at a peak. UpBeat NYC currently serves over 50 participants ages 4 and up and is staffed by 15 dedicated volunteers.  



What We Need 


For this IndieGoGo project we are asking for your help to provide our most dedicated participants with musical instruments. The instruments will be used not only during weekly lessons and ensemble classes, but also for the students to take home for practice outside of our programs' hours of operation.


All donations are 100% tax-deductible.


We currently have nearly enough instruments to equip our students during their weekly lessons thanks to grants from Music and the Brain, the Bill Graham Memorial Foundation and gifts from individual donors. But, with a little extra funding, we would be able to reward our hardworking students with instruments of their very own, enabling them to practice as much as they wish outside of their regular lessons. Currently most students are hands-on with an instrument for only a short time each week.


We have been able to supply some of our most consistent, hardworking students with their own instruments, and the pride they take in achieving that privilege is inspiring! Owning an instrument not only enables them to become better musicians, it allows them to bring their music deeper into the community to share their love and knowledge of music with family and friends, creating and fostering positive relationships through music. The importance of these kinds of community experiences is evident when seen in context of the drug and crime-ridden streets that these children play on every day.


Project Budget


20 Yamaha PSR-E323 61-Key Entry-Level Portable Keyboards ($159.99 each)           $3,200

20 Yamaha PA 130 Power Adapters ($14.95 each)                                                              $300

  6 Yamaha CGS103A 3/4-Size Classical Guitars ($129.99 each)                                       $780

     Repair for donated string and woodwind instruments                                                  $500

     6% Fiscal sponsorship fee                                                                                               $287


     Total                                                                                                                                 $5,067



Other Ways to Help


Spread the word!  Please tell everyone and anyone about this project.  Every bit helps!  Thank you all so much!
story_txt:
Our Story
My wife and I began UpBeat NYC in March of 2009 as a musical outreach for inner-city children, youth and adults. Since then, with the enormous help of family, friends, volunteers and partner organizations, we have established programs in Mott Haven, South Bronx and Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. Each program provides year-round music education to community residents completely free of charge. Our participants currently study piano, woodwinds, strings, guitar, percussion and voice.


Each program creates an environment that fosters personal achievement, creative self‐expression and group cooperation, empowering individuals by nurturing their unique qualities and strengthening their sense of purpose within the community. UpBeat NYC upholds the belief that every aspect of each student must be nurtured, not just their musical abilities. In communities where the social fabric is weakened by the adversities of poverty, our organization aims to empower individuals to see themselves and their peers in a different light.



The Impact

In a city that has nearly eliminated music education from its public schools, generations of families living in impoverished communities have raised children in an environment offering few realistic music education opportunities. For the 41% of Bed-Stuy children and 56% of Mott Haven children living in poverty, access to private instruction is simply unaffordable. Their hopes for music education are left to budget-pinched out-of-school time programs whose efforts leave nearly 14,000 children with no services, music or otherwise.

UpBeat addresses this need by providing free, year-round music education programming for Bed-Stuy and Mott Haven residents. Beyond music education, our services promote community engagement and offer positive alternatives during the critical after-school hours when risk to youth's health and safety are at a peak. UpBeat NYC currently serves over 50 participants ages 4 and up and is staffed by 15 dedicated volunteers.  


What We Need 



For this IndieGoGo project we are asking for your help to provide our most dedicated participants with musical instruments. The instruments will be used not only during weekly lessons and ensemble classes, but also for the students to take home for practice outside of our programs' hours of operation. 


All donations are 100% tax-deductible.


We currently have nearly enough instruments to equip our students during their weekly lessons thanks to grants from Music and the Brain, the Bill Graham Memorial Foundation and gifts from individual donors. But, with a little extra funding, we would be able to reward our hardworking students with instruments of their very own, enabling them to practice as much as they wish outside of their regular lessons. Currently most students are hands-on with an instrument for only a short time each week.

We have been able to supply some of our most consistent, hardworking students with their own instruments, and the pride they take in achieving that privilege is inspiring! Owning an instrument not only enables them to become better musicians, it allows them to bring their music deeper into the community to share their love and knowledge of music with family and friends, creating and fostering positive relationships through music. The importance of these kinds of community experiences is evident when seen in context of the drug and crime-ridden streets that these children play on every day. 

Project Budget

20 Yamaha PSR-E323 61-Key Entry-Level Portable Keyboards ($159.99 each)           $3,200
20 Yamaha PA 130 Power Adapters ($14.95 each)                                                              $300
  6 Yamaha CGS103A 3/4-Size Classical Guitars ($129.99 each)                                       $780
     Repair for donated string and woodwind instruments                                                  $500
     6% Fiscal sponsorship fee                                                                                               $287

     Total                                                                                                                                 $5,067


Other Ways to Help

Spread the word!  Please tell everyone and anyone about this project.  Every bit helps!  Thank you all so much!

story:
This is Me and Why I'm Here

Hello All! My name is Max DeFrancesco and I am running this campaign to study opera for two weeks in Ischia, Italy. Last year I graduated from Montclair State University with a Bachelor of Music in Vocal Performance. Since graduating I have had some success in singing, one being a regular singer of the National Anthem for the New Jersey Devils.

Recently, I have been accepted to the Opera Ischia Program in Italy to continue my training as an aspiring opera singer. However, this acceptance has come through a last minute connection and I am in an unfortunate time crunch for funding before the program begins on July 1st.

Without these contributions, I will not be able to attend this wonderful program to further my vocal studies. Every contribution will be greatly appreciated and immensely helpful in aiding me to reach my goal and achieve my dream.

Crunching the Numbers

Tuition for the program is $1500 for two weeks and $3000 for four. I am aiming to raise $2300 at minimum for a two week long stay for the First Session of the program. These tuition prices do not include airfare, cost of living or accommodations. Hopefully with enough contributions I will able to attend the program for both sessions.

The Program

The program in Ischia will be two weeks in length and is an opportunity for me to solely focus on my technique and repertoire. The program will give me 4 lessons a week, 6 coachings, and 1 performance. All lessons in the program will be "open" as well, thereby giving students a chance to observe hours of lessons each week.

The island of Ischia is very secluded, creating the perfect environment for me to completely devote myself to my singing. My main goal during these two weeks will be to refine my set of arias for auditions in the fall. I plan to audition for Young Artist Residency Programs with Opera Houses in America and possibly Europe.

Contributing to this campaign will give my an extremely productive opportunity to refine my craft to advance me to the next level with my planned auditions in the fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions are welcome in any amount, shape or size.

(Even your love and support goes a long way!)

However, if you cannot aid this campaign by means of funding, here are a few ways you can help.

Share this campaign on any social media account you have! (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)

Contact individuals whom you think would be willing to become patrons of this campaign.

Bake me peanut butter cookies or give me hugs, cause this career ain't easy! :D

 

Thank you, One and All!

This career is by no means an easy path to take and I have only just begun my journey. I am so grateful for all of those in my life who continue to believe in me, support me, and contribute to aid me in achieving my dream. Every little bit goes a long way and I think about all that has been given to me. Thank you so much and best wishes to you all! Much Love!

story:
Our Story

Shielded By Shadows.  Formed in early 2010 as sophomores in high school, we are a 5-piece metal band from Milwaukee, Wisconsin.  Throughout the past year and a half, we have been consistently writing original material.  It has been a long, tedious process of discovering who we are, and as a band, developing our own sound has been a universal goal.

In the summer of 2011 all the hard work finally paid off.  Saving every penny we could, we entered the studio to record our 9-track debut album.  Everything turned out phenomenal.  But the next step, creating physical CDs, is where we are graciously asking for the world's help.


What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $1500, which will allow us to create top-of-the-line copies of our debut album.  The money donated to us will go directly towards funding for purchasing professional CDs.  Have no fear.  Even if we do not reach our goal, every cent will still go towards the creation of the album.

In addition, anybody who is generous enough to donate $10 or more will have their name specifically printed in the "Thank You" section of the album.  Watch with us, as our dream become reality.


Other Ways You Can Help

Send this page to all of your friends and family.  Get the word out.  FaceBook, Twitter, MySpace, you name it.  Any and all support is greatly appreciated.

story:
September 9, 1992 was a great day for country music and its fans everywhere. On that day in Martin, Kentucky Tyler Stephens was born. Martin lays nestled in the beautiful mountains of Southeastern Kentucky. Only minutes from the well known Country Music Highway, US 23.This area, known for turning out country music greats such as Keith Whitley, Billy Ray Cyrus, his daughter Miley Cyrus, Loretta Lynn, Patty Loveless, and Ricky Skaggs (to name a few) has held true to form and has produced yet another great artist whose name will remain synonymous with country music for years to come.Tyler was introduced to music at a very early age and set his sights on a successful musical career and has never looked back. At only 18 years old, with countless performances behind him and two completed albums; Tyler landed a recording deal with the independent record label: Big Appal Music. Holding true to his heritage he is already well known for his straight from the heart traditional country vocal. Hauntingly reminiscence of his idol, The Legendary Keith Whitley. If you love country music then you owe it too yourself to check out it's newest rising star:
Tyler Stephens.

What We Need & What You Get

  • After a long term of planning and organizing, Tyler is now ready to start the production of a new CD. However, to produce it correctly it will cost about $10,000. Expenses are broken down below:
    • Studio Recording, Mixing, and Mastering - $5000
    • Product Production - $2000
    • CD Release Party - $ 1000
    • Perk Fulfillment - $ 2000
  • There are alot of great perks for contributors/supporters of Tylers New CD production. These include: Free autographed CD, Free tickets to see Tyler Stephens and The Back Roads Band Live at the Mountain Arts Center on March 2, 2013, Free tickets to the CD release party where you will be recognized as a contributor, various types of a live performance at an event of your choice, and an autographed CD release poster.
  • All contributions will go toward the production and promotion of Tyler's new CD to be released on March 1, 2012. This includes: Studio time, Photo Shoots, Release Party expenses, and fulfilling contributors perks.

The Impact


  • At every show we are approached and asked, "When are you releasing a new CD?" Our reply has been, "Soon." Now, we need your appreciated support to help make it happen. We want to offer our fans new music, while making them feel involved in the making of it. We feel this is a way to keep our fans more involved and for them to receive perks in return.
  • As you probably are aware of by now, Tyler previously released his debut album, "Freedom Don't Come Free" in February of 2011 and since it has achieved tremendous success. With the title cut, "Freedom Don't Come Free" being released on CDX Volume 512 with artists Kenny Chesney and Easton Corbin, Tyler hit national airwaves and was played on over 1700 radio stations across the country. Not to mention the effect that the release on "Rollin' 18 Wheels" had on the people of the Eastern Kentucky Region and all of it came from your very appreciated support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • We understand everyone can't contribute; but, there are other ways to assist. We are always in need for good publicist. That is why we want to ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, or any other Social site. Not just on Social media, do word of mouth too. The public has to know about it for it to be successful.

 

In conclusion, we would like to take the time to say thank you, we appreciate you, and are very lucky to have family, friends, and fans like you. The past 2 years have been incredible because of the support you have given us. From the bottom of our heart, Thank You and God Bless You.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, Lovers. Lauren Eylise here.

For those of you familiar with who I am and what I do, I hope you're happy to hear from me again. For those of you not so familiar, allow me to officially introduce myself: My name is Lauren Eylise and I’m a singer-songwriter currently based in New York City by way of Cincinnati, Ohio.

I’ve been singing for as long as I can remember and my instruments of choice include an ink pen, acoustic guitar, and piano. I began performing very early in my life as music has always been a very powerful and important tool for expression for me, an outlet in which my creativity and passion could flourish without limit.

In the midst of performing in Ohio, I released “Unknown Artist” in 2012, a mixtape of original creations written while I was in college. I formed a band in which I led as lead vocalist, acoustic guitarist and pianist, playing all original music alongside original renditions of some of my all-time favorite songs. I continued to tour in Ohio, appearing at bars, lounges, festivals and a host of other venues gracing the same stage of some of music’s most talented artists including Red Wanting Blue, Def Jam’s Rudy Currence, Matt Kearney, and Train.

As I garnered experience as a performing artist and creative writer, life had plans of its own to teach me a few other things. I did a lot of writing in an attempt to not only release but to clarify lessons learned. I found myself knee deep in life itself, learning the hidden parts of love, heartbreak, and growth.

Enter “Heartbreak 101”, my upcoming debut album. “Heartbreak 101” is a 9-track creative project that explores a time in my recent past that was both simultaneously the darkest and most illuminating part of my life thus far. It dives into, around and right back within my emotions and lessons learned thus far. Heartbreak happens to us all in different ways. There is no escaping it. We experience through loss, gain, detachment. We feel it in our personal and professional lives. We re-encounter it in memory. It will happen. And the only thing we can control about it is what we decided to ascertain from the experience itself. I wrote my way out of great heartbreak into “Heartbreak 101” and it is my hope that every single ear that hears will be soothed, and if not healed, brought one step forward to claiming their own experiences and adorning their battle scars proudly.

Crowd-funding is perhaps the most fitting means to complete this project. “Heartbreak 101” is about more than me and my isolated experiences. It’s a story that binds us all together and quickly reminds that no matter how hard it is to remember in tough times, we are in fact never alone. Someone has felt that emptiness. Someone has fought that lump in the throat before the onset of tears. Someone has loved just as deeply, unafraid, and uninhibited. Someone has felt true, unwavering joy.

The idea of co-creating this experience with those who support my music and my journey truly connects me to this project in an even deeper way and allows me the opportunity to create authentically without worrying about anything but the music that will touch us all in different way. I need YOU to make this project happen and I am very excited to share OUR story with the rest of the world.

This crowd-funding campaign will run for about 60 days, during which time I'll be doing a few small live shows in New York City, planning photo shoots and a host of other pre-production activities. Following, I’ll be heading directly to Chicago, IL to complete recording. I also plan to record at least 3 music videos for the creative project. I am very passionate about the power of this project and I refuse to sell any aspect of its creation short.

I’m a very passionate, innovative, and visionary artist ready to bring an element of authenticity that’s lacking in today’s music back to the scene. There are a TON of things to offer in return for your support – so please READ ON for additional perks, giveaways and more! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 for production, travel, and other miscellaneous expenses (i.e. food, video production, etc.) to complete the Heartbreak 101 creative project. 

In exchange for your monetary contribution, there are a few unique perks! And each contribution, no matter how large or how small, comes with an opportunity to be featured live on my album.

Even if we do not reach our goal, we will still push forward to complete the project with the funds we receive. The show must always go on! 

NOTE: ALL contributions receive a live cover request to Lauren Eylise! Tweet at Lauren Eylise the song you'd like for her to cover with the hashtag '#SingMySong' on Twitter and she will post your cover request to YouTube with an mp4 download. 

The Impact

For those who know me and my art, you know that music means everything to me. And for those who aren't so familiar with me or my art, you'll very soon come to learn the same. 

This project means the world to me not only as my debut recording project, but also as my contribution to the world as an artist. As artists, I believe it is our responsibility to tell the stories we all experience in ways that connect, inspire, and uplift us all. Heartbreak 101 is the first of many of those stories I hope to create and share with the world. 

All donations are welcome. Any contribution, no matter how large or small, automatically signs you up to the Lauren Eylise Mailing List.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute funds, there are other super important ways you can help!

·  Get the word out and make some noise on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social media outlet! 

·  Email your friends! Send them the link and encourage them to hop on board!

·  Use the special Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Crossroads is pleased to announce our 4th trip to the playa!


What does it take to have a 15+ piece band perform in the challenging conditions of Black Rock City for three hours a night, four days in a row? In short, you need: months of planning and rehearsing, a camp of 150 professional artists, builders, performers, dancers, organizers, and support crew, plus the blood, sweat, and tears of devoted Crossroadians weeks before and after The Event. The Crossroads camp, for the fourth year, is happy to give all of this and more to the Black Rock City community. 


You know what else it takes? Thousands upon thousands of dollars to pay for sound equipment rentals, light rentals, transportation costs, storage costs, building material costs, cleaning of said equipment, etc. The sad fact is that the cost to produce The Crossroads has grown to be more than our camp fees can cover. The good news is that with your help and the help of the Black Rock community, we can again bring live soul, funk, and pop music out to the Playa for 2014.


For those who don’t know us, we’re a truly unique presence on the playa; we perform nightly live shows with our band of ultra-talented artists, musicians and performers. We bring magic to the playa through the sounds of funk, soul, hip hop, R&B, jazz, rock, and everything in between with a full orchestra of talented musicians, vocalists, dancers and amazing burlesque performances.

But this isn't just any fun group of individuals getting together. The band is comprised of working professionals- musicians and singers, most of whom tour and record with major acts worldwide. If you're looking for a professional show delivered by seasoned pros- in the desert, then look no further! Don't be surprised when you're on your way to deep playa to see the latest fad DJ, yet somehow find yourself stuck at our camp every night instead... We see it happen!


For those who know us, you know how epic things can get when our shows kick it into high gear.  Every year we pour our hearts, soul, and blood into our shows.  Each year we are taxed to the max.  We have the bulk of what we need already but this year we are asking for your help.  We don’t’ want anyone to be left holding the bag. 



What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will go to offsetting the cost our camp and show production. Donations will help fund sound and equipment rentals, building materials for the live stage, our always-friendly neighborhood bar, gas and transportation!

This year, our nightly shows will also include a post party with mixed-genre DJ sets to keep the party going well into the night. We’re aiming to be a true social center on the playa, and that’s why we need your help!  You aren’t just getting a show you are becoming part of the joy and camaraderie that is created on the playa.  The more we raise the better the gift we can give back to YOU!


Our unique artists, musicians and performers are some of the most talented and dedicated you will ever meet.  We give back in blood sweat and funky beats.  Come by for some cool drinks and hot beats!  Help us bring our LIVE funk back to the playa! 


Perks

Take home a piece of Crossroads!   

 We have some seriously talented musicians!  Use the links to have a listen and check out some of what our guys do all year round!  Pick one, two or take the whole list home!!  Your ears won't be disappointed!

J

Adam Theis - Jazz Mafia's "Brass, Bows & Beats" a hip-hop symphony 

www.jazzmafia.com 

Colin Tyler – “Live From Studio A”  Rock & Blues

colintyler.bandcamp.com

Steve Taylor - “Has the Size of the Road Got the Better of You” Folk Blues Rock

The Doom Patrol (Trance, Uriah & Jesse) – “Released” Rock & Soul

Jesse Brewster – “Jesse Brewster Band” Folk Rock

itunes.apple.com/us/album/jesse-brewster-band/id184237665

Adam Theis – Shot Gun Wedding Quintet “Tales from the Barbary Coast” Jazz

www.jazzmafia.com

Wesley Frederick  - “Backroom in Tulsa” Swamp Noir

wesleymorgan.bandcamp.com/album/backroom-in-tulsa

Jesse Brewster  -- “Wrecking Ball Concert Hall” Rock

itunes.apple.com/us/album/wrecking-ball-at-concert-hall/id398790686

Rich Armstrong – “Rich’s Live Pageant” Jazz Trumpet

www.cdbaby.com/cd/richarmstrong 

Chris Paxton – Whogas by Whogas Reggae Funk Rock

www.cdbaby.com/m/cd/whogas




Crossroads Rockin' Calendar

Rocking Crossroads photo calendars size 11x8.5”, featuring performance images from 2013 to remind you all year long of the fantastic live music experience you had on the playa. The calendar goes from september 2014 to august 2015 so you can alway count the days till when its time to go back home.   Photos by Anja Epkes. 

Postcard from the Playa!


Do you love mail? Postcards from exotic locations?  We will send a Printed on Playa Postcard complete with the Black Rock Postmark! Great to give as gifts to those who can't be on playa with us!  Please include your address!

Color Changing Cup!

For a $25 donation you get the new 'red version' of our Camp Cup, AND a nice Thank You Hug! It changes from white to red when you put a cool liquid into it (the cup). Hot off the press, and exclusively for Camp Members and lovely people like like you who want to donate $25. You can receive your camp cup on playa or off, but in person is best so we can give you the best hug you’ll have all season!    +PLUS+ We'll fill it up for you!  

Pro Photobooth Pairs!

Get a studio quality picture of you and a friend together on the Playa at the Crossroads Photo booth studio near the Crossroads camp stage (see these for examples from recent years http://goo.gl/1DMLOF), just show up on the Wednesday night from 9PM until just after the Crossroads performance (approx. midnight).  We post the professionally photographed and edited high resolution picture on a private web site without watermarks for you to use how you want (pictures posted approx. 1 week after the Burn).


Classic Logo Cotton Tee! 

Our classic logo on a soft pre-washed made in the USA T-shirt!  This is our original logo we landed on the playa with back in 2011.  You can say you knew us when!  You also get a Postcard from the Playa!  Please indicate your size! (S, M, L, XL etc) 

Pro Photobooth Group!

Get a studio quality picture of a group of your friends together on the Playa at the Crossroads Photo booth studio near the Crossroads camp stage (see these for examples from recent years http://goo.gl/1DMLOF ), just show up with your group of no more than 15 of you, on the Wednesday night from 9PM until just after the Crossroads performance (approx. midnight).  We post the professionally photographed and edited high resolution picture on a private web site without watermarks for you to use how you want (pictures posted approx. 1 week after the Burn).

Red Retro Cotton Tee!

Our new Red Retro design on a soft pre-washed made in the USA T-shirt!  We updated our logo and you get the Tee!  You also get a Postcard from the Playa!  Please indicate your size! (S, M, L, XL etc)

Online Lesson with Uriah Duffy!

An online one hour bass lesson with our world renown bassist Uriah Duffy! Uriah has toured the world with the likes of Whitesnake and Points North but his roots lie firmly planted in the world of funk. His vast knowledge of all genres of music and his easy nature make for a patient and immensely knowledgeable teacher. For more on Uriah Duffy check his website here: www.uriahduffy.com 

'Playa Wedding Procession' Fine Art Print By Bill Evans!

Get a large format fine art print of this beautiful photo, the “Playa Wedding Procession” of the Crossroads camp wedding party of Lacey and David.  Photo taken by camp photographer Bill Evans and printed at 13” x 19” on archival fine art paper suitable for framing.  http://goo.gl/VikWql  (Photo shipped in a tube, or available for pick-up in San Francisco).


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, that is ok, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Re-Post on your favorite social media page!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Crossroads is pleased to announce our 4th trip to the playa!
What does it take to have a 15+ piece band perform in the challenging conditions of Black Rock City for three hours a night, four days in a row? In short, you need: months of planning and rehearsing, a camp of 150 professional artists, builders, performers, dancers, organizers, and support crew, plus the blood, sweat, and tears of devoted Crossroadians weeks before and after The Event. The Crossroads camp, for the fourth year, is happy to give all of this and more to the Black Rock City community. You know what else it takes? Thousands upon thousands of dollars to pay for sound equipment rentals, light rentals, transportation costs, storage costs, building material costs, cleaning of said equipment, etc. The sad fact is that the cost to produce The Crossroads has grown to be more than our camp fees can cover. The good news is that with your help and the help of the Black Rock community, we can again bring live soul, funk, and pop music out to the Playa for 2014.For those who don’t know us, we’re a truly unique presence on the playa; we perform nightly live shows with our band of ultra-talented artists, musicians and performers. We bring magic to the playa through the sounds of funk, soul, hip hop, R&B, jazz, rock, and everything in between with a full orchestra of talented musicians, vocalists, dancers and amazing burlesque performances.But this isn't just any fun group of individuals getting together. The band is comprised of working professionals- musicians and singers, most of whom tour and record with major acts worldwide. If you're looking for a professional show delivered by seasoned pros- in the desert, then look no further! Don't be surprised when you're on your way to deep playa to see the latest fad DJ, yet somehow find yourself stuck at our camp every night instead... story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Lenny Vitulli and I'm a drummer! I've created a website for people around the world to download drum lessons from the most popular drummers on YouTube! 

I've spent hundreds of hours creating this site and need YOUR help to take it to the next level! My goal is to make the new website faster, better, stronger, kind of like Superman, if he were a drum website. :)

Arts Education needs support and as a passionate musician, I KNOW this website is a cool and affordable way to learn drums, at any level, from some of the best drummers out there!

To be the best it can be, the website needs support from people like you, who hopefully have a passion for arts and education. And maybe drummers!

What We Need & What You Get

All funding will go directly to the new website development and creating amazing content!

I will be creating a "thank you" page and listing the names of everyone who supports this project! 

All donations of $25 or more will receive gifts ranging from a lesson series to downloadable play-a-long MP3's! And of course, my undying love. 

Even the smallest donation will be appreciated and go to a great project. 

The Impact

I have put tons of time and effort into creating this website and concept, I manage it daily and my goal is to make it the best online lesson site in the world! If you know me, you know my dedication to drums and music education!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially, tweeting, Facebook, and any social media support would be awesome! It's important to get the word out that drum lessons can be easily accessed for a great price by anyone at any level of playing!

story:
Friends, as many of you may already know, our beloved Keynote Cafe has reopened in a new location just a few blocks from the the old location. The new space is larger than the old, with new amenities, including a large room behind the stage for bands to store equipment. The owner, Jill Sorrels, has worked very hard to renovate the space in order to give musicians a place to play and young people a safe place to experience live music. I personally can't thank her enough for her contributions to local music and arts.

Jill has given us so much and I feel it's time for us to give back. As mentioned, the new space is much larger than the old. This is great because more people can attend concerts, open mics, and art showings. The downside is that the PA system owned by the venue is no longer enough for the larger space. Within a few months, constantly being pushed to (and often beyond) its limits, I fear their equipment will cease to work. In order to combat this, I would like to raise money for a sound system for the new venue. The real deal. Bands can concentrate more on their music and worry less about "will it sound good tonight?" Monitors to hear themselves and overall perform better. Fans will enjoy a higher quality listening experience. No more struggling to hear the vocals over the rest of the band. Subwoofers that let you FEEL the music, not just hear it. Promoters will be able to book larger, more notable acts without worrying about finding an alternative sound system and paying someone to supply/run it.

It's a win win win.

That being said, this equipment is not cheap. That's where we come in. In addition to this indiegogo campaign, I'll be holding a show at the venue itself and all proceeds will go toward funding the sound system.


Every little bit helps. Please share this campaign with your friends, even if you can't donate yourself. We can't do this without you!

story:
Greetings! Please check out the video above, read the blurb below and check out the many ways you can help me out on the right.

I recorded the first OST album on a laptop which was held together by duct-tape. Sadly, it passed away recently. With a follow up to Invisible Ink For Sketching Ghosts on the horizon I REALLY need your help.

☻ If you contribute (to the making of what will undoubtedly be the greatest album ever recorded) you will be rewarded; just take a look at all the excellent gifts I have made available right on this very page. Wanna have a song, a music video or even an album written and recorded about you? DO YOU?! 

☻ With high rent and low pay, the battle to be a musician in New York City is quiet hard. So I call on you, my friends, family and fans(?) to come together and throw in anything you can so we can make this happen! Every little helps and any contribution will be greatly appreciated.


Here is what some people said about the first album:

''Heart-stoppingly gorgeous... extremely intimate and daringly omnipresent.'' - Sputnik Music.com

''This isn’t comparable to anything you’ve heard before'' Top 15 Albums of 2012 - Murdered by Pirates is Good

''A seriously intimate record... a bold statement of intent and musical gesture.'' - Chew Your Own Fat .com    

''...each track is a work of art leaning towards modern day poetry''  - Flicker Magazine

So imagine what I could do with a living, breathing laptop!!!   Please spread the word to anyone you think might be interested.

Without a laptop I cannot thank you, with one, I cannot thank you enough.  


Warm regards,
Shane Harrington

________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the good word
  • Talk about this in work with your friends/impress a girl or guy with talk of your ''charitable and giving nature''
