story:
My project in more detail.

My name is Zeev Nitzan Ginsburg, and I'm a musician. 
I was born in Israel, and then grew up in India for 15 years. I'm now living in LA, attending college, and trying to kick start my Music career. 
I've been playing music for several years, and have already contributed to several recordings, to bands in LA, India and Israel. I've played onstage with some of India's finest musicians, such as Elvis Lobo, Shane Ballantyne, Joe Ferrao and Carlos Gonsalves. (YouTube them, definitely worth it.)

I'm now working on my first solo record, and need a good guitar to record with. I've acquired a 1984 Fender Stratocaster, used. She's an amazing guitar, but sadly was not maintained very well, and needs a lot of work, everything from a new bridge to pickups and tone knobs. 
I've wanted to make my own music project ever since I started playing guitar, and I've written a lot of music for this album.  
I have time in a friends studio booked for October, so I need to get it done by then. It would be hugely sad if my dream fell to pieces because of this.

What can YOU do to help make this a reality? 
Contribute. Every little bit counts, and the more you can contribute, the closer I get. This project means the world to me, and you, the people, will be making my greatest dream come true! 

What your funds will be doing. 

I'm asking for 1,600$. With that, I can overhaul my guitar sufficiently for recording. 
About 550$ will go towards new Pickups. For those who don't know what those are, think of it as the guitars microphones. They are magnets, under the strings that transfer the string's vibrations into the sound you hear over an amplifier. For those who DO know what they are, I'm going to get Seymour Duncans, hopefully Zephyr Silver Wired.
200$ will be for custom electronics and wiring, a kill switch, coilsplitting, etc. 
Another 550$ is for a Floyd Rose bridge and installation, plus related labor costs. 
The last 300$, is for a new paintjob, new pickguard, and other miscellaneous expenses incurred. 

Every little bit counts. $1, $2, whatever it is you can spare. If you can't contribute, share, help me spread the word!

Perks!! What I give to YOU, for your help! 
Look to the right! Its all listed there, in its full glory!
I have listed my perks in full in the perks section, please do check them out!
-Every contribution until 50$ will be emailed a scanned, signed print of the finished guitar. 

Also, all contributions 100$ and above will be given the chance to enter a name for the finished guitar, and I will choose one.
Every bit of funds help. Even if I don't raise all of it, I can still make significant headway on the guitar. 

I am including my email address; feel free to write me with any questions, suggestions, comments, etc., you may have. 
Please only write with genuine questions or comments, try not to spam me or send me advertisements. 
Again, Every Bit Counts! 

Even if you can't contribute:

Even if you can't contribute, please feel free to share this onwards, so more people can see! Every bit of help counts, so please, share, contribute, and help me achieve my dream! 

 My email is zeevnaja@gmail.com, feel free to write me!

 My email is zeevnaja@gmail.com, feel free to write me!

story:
Drawing on a diverse range of influences from pop, electronic, and r'n'b, the Torontonians bump, grind, and bounce like nothing that came before them. And after touring sold-out theatres and festivals across the northeastern US and Canada in 2011, the world began to take notice: glowing reviews from indie-tastemakers Pitchfork (US) and la Blogotheque (France) reflected a growing global fan base; the Guardian (UK) declared them "the best band in Canada" for November of 2011. Encouragement from people like Jens Lekman, Chad Valley, and Matt Berninger (The National) blew the group's collective mind. And that was just the beginning.

Mastered by Milan Schramek at the Lacquer Channel in Toronto, "You Won't Get This Joke At All" demonstrates a newfound confidence; it reflects all the emotional upheaval and maturity that comes with one's mid-20's. Few artists can make you laugh, think, and move at the same time; First Rate People accomplish all of this and then some.


- Zachary Stockill // http://zfstockill.com // www.huffingtonpost.com/zachary-stockill

CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD NEW SINGLE "YOU WON'T GET THIS JOKE AT ALL" by FIRST RATE PEOPLE

 

illustration by Jennifer Ilett

www.jenniferilett.com

story:
http://www.emzmusic.com/

LISTEN HERE

We're bringing sexy back....

EmZ is an international woman of mystery. Born in the lush tropical heat of Northern Australia her youth was spent frolicking in the untamed wilderness underneath the warm glow of the sun. Always listening to the songs within, EmZ draws her artistic inspiration from the landscape she grew up in and from the rich life experiences she has collected on her travels across continents. 

In the past year EmZ has been hard at work writing and recording her collection of songs in collaboration with the celebrated musical genius of Sir Stephen. We need your help to complete the big sexy album "EZ Does It" in time for EmZ's New York debut at the legendary "Don't Tell Mama" in the heart Broadway.

EmZ has contributed every spare penny to record these sweet and vicious tunes but there is still a lot to do and little time to complete her vision. Now with this fabulous opportunity to showcase her talents at this wonderful venue that has launched many an artists career including Nancy LaMott and has featured in numerous TV Shows from “Friends” to “Saturday Night Live”, we need YOU!

EmZ is looking for $5,000 to complete this exciting and unique musical project that encompasses many different artistic facets.

Your financial contributions will allow EmZ to:

- Complete the recording of the album (mixing, mastering, paying musicians, getting the CD pressed) 

- Making music videos (paying editors, Director of Photography)

- Marketing costs to promote the CD and the show  

AND IT DOESN"T STOP THERE!

Ever the artist EmZ is looking to hand print and lovingly make the CD packaging in time to be on sale at "Don't Tell Mama". These costs include ink, paper, and time!!

All funds will go towards the completion of this project whether we reach the goal or not!

The Album "EZ Does IT" is going to bring a lot of beauty into this world.  

The collaboration between Sir Stephen and EmZ has resulted in some truly unique, heartfelt songs. This is a new sound that the world has never heard before! With Sir Stephen's life experience and wealth of musical experience combined with EmZ's honest and poetic lyrics these songs cross multiple genres and appeals to all ages. 

WHO are EmZ and Sir Stephen? 

STEPHEN DOWNS – a.k.a Sir Stephen – began his stage career at the age of eight From there he worked steadily in and around his home county of Surrey, England, as a singer, impressionist and ventriloquist. At the age of 12, he landed a role in the West End production of Damn Yankees, the first of many appearances in London's West End.

At age 15, Stephen signed with HMV/EMI and began a recording career that was to last for over a decade, with a top ten single, and culminating in appearing with the Beatles at the height of Beatlemania. Stephen also did extensive touring of England, Ireland, Scotland and Europe; and worked with rock and pop stars such Alice Cooper, Mickey Dolenz of the Monkees, Brenda Lee, Gerry & the Pacemakers, Harry Nilson, Donovan, and others.

At age 17, Stephen became Mel Tormé’s protégé, an achievement he rates as one of the highest moments in his career; he was also the youngest performer ever to headline at London's legendary Astor Club. 

In 1965, Merv Griffin signed Stephen and brought him to New York as a regular on his show. Sir Stephen’s music career has encompassed almost every facet of the entertainment business. He toured with legendary rock stars, wrote and produced two record albums, including a cast album of his Broadway musical, Festival. Along with his wife, Lady T, he is co-producing a CD of Ghosts of the Titanic, a mystical, musical journey. Sir Stephen considers working with EmZ one of the most musically rewarding and creative experiences of his career.

Emma Zakarevicius - a.k.a EmZ moved to New York City in 2003 to pursue her varied talents in the fine arts, EmZ made her musical debut in the now forgotten, crimson-lit basement of a downtown Soho café. Singing voodoo and crooning to the likes of Frank Sinatra, Billy Holiday and Anita O’Day, EmZ found her voice and never looked back.

In 2007 she joined the psychedelic rock and roll band Crazy Mary and continues to write and sing along side rock legend Walter Steding of the Dragon People (produced by Andy Warhol).

Ultimately, EmZ has always been a jazz child and after a chance meeting with Stephen Downs, a.k.a. Sir Stephen, it all fell into place. Working with collaborator and friend Sir Stephen, her new solo venture “EZ Does It” is a mature body of work that allows for a more personal side of EmZ to shine through. The fusion of EmZ’s sultry heartfelt lyrics coupled with Sir Stephen’s eloquent piano arrangements result in a musical experience that is both timeless and contemporary; music that is strangely familiar and reminiscent of times gone by; of memories forgotten and retold in a fresh and exciting way.

ANY CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP!

EmZ will be debuting her CD "EZ Does It' at DON'T TELL MAMA - October 13th @ 21st 

If you can’t contribute please spread the word and make some noise about your campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi! 

We are Faenimal Arm, a duo consisting of Mia Ojapalo and Emil Järnefelt. Founded in 2013, we started our cooperation by creating experimental spoken word songs. Within few months, our sound evolved into more diverse direction. Today, we want to put everything we have to create this EP in the best possible way, working with the best professionals available. 

TRU LUV about our first single Industrial Sex, which will be also part of our EP: 

"...Based in Helsinki, this electronica duo (makes) experimental electronica but retaining a pop sensibility within their sound. Début track Industrial Sex (released via Vild Recordings) has this hypnotic and sensual rhythm that playfully dances around Emil’s shoegazer vocals. The video, created by artist Nick Tulinen, mirrors the feeling the song creates beautifully." 

What We Need... 

is help! Our campaign's target is to fund our first EP. 

  • We need to be able to rent us some studio space to record the EP. We're not using actual recording studios but old wooden cottages in the countryside, to be able to give the recording sessions all the time needed. (1000 €)
  • We want to be able to finish our EP with the same team of professionals, who finished our first single Industrial sex. This includes mixing and recording engineer, producer extraordinaire Julius Mauranen... (2000 €)
  • ...and mastering by Virtalähde Mastering. (500 €) 
  • Music videos for two of the songs. (1500 €) 

... & What You Get 

  • You'll get to be part of our journey and to help us create high level art independently. We make the sound in a very ambitious way and truly put our souls to it. 
  • Depending on the amount of funding, we'll provide you with postcards from Finland, an EP download, super cool t-shirt, CD / Vinyl, or a song made just for you! 

    EP Releasing 

    We're releasing our EP via VILD Recordings (www.vildmusic.com), which is a new indie label in Finland. However, all the costs related to the recording, mixing and mastering are taken care of by us, which is the standard process with today's indie labels. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Any help along the way is hugely appreciated. If you like our music and what we're trying to accomplish, please share the love! 

    Thanks so much and hi from Helsinki! 

    xx Mia & Emil

story:
Short Summary

I'm Andrew Feyer, but you can call me by just my last name, as everyone who knows me pretty much already does. I am an aspiring musician who loves writing, producing, and performing. I am a 21-year-old student at Bard College, studying, you guessed it, music! As of now, I have already released one single and one EP on sites like SoundCloud and BandCamp, but I feel as though it is time to take my music to the next step and give it some more attention to reach a broader audience. So, I will be creating a 9-song album and releasing it in the spring of 2015. This album will include 7 brand new tracks and two instrumentals. Some additional remixes to songs may also be released. It will be self-written and self-produced. 

Don't know what my previous releases sound like? Here's a link you can follow to listen: http://feyer.bandcamp.com


What's Needed & What You Get

Like kickstarting a business, recording an album and treating it both as a work of art and as a sellable product require investors. What is still needed to achieve the most professional-sounding recording is gear for a recording studio, hiring sound engineers and producers, and publicizing and distributing the finished product. Without the proper funds, this album will sound very amateurish and will not achieve recognition due to lack of publicity. 

Aside from recording the actual album, the majority of the funds will be spent on engineering, promoting, and distributing the album. A professional recorded album is not finalized until it has a precise, refined sound. The job of the producer will be to work with these recordings and give them the proper sound features.  The sound engineer will take these recordings and master them into the finalized product. Next comes packaging; no album is complete without professional-looking physical copies and digital downloads. Both formats will require original and creative album artwork. For that, I will contact professional photographers and graphic designers. Finally comes PR and distribution. By this, we're talking about getting radio airplay, getting featured in blogs and magazines that spotlight new artists, and appearing on online music sites such as iTunes, Spotify, Pandora, Google Play, Amazon MP3, etc. To achieve this, I will need to contact and work closely with a publicist and distribution team, which will not be cheap, but is a necessary investment for giving this album exposure. 

Distribution and PR does not seal the deal, though. Once an album is out, it is very important that I do all I can to promote the release myself. The best way to do this is by playing shows. In addition to my love for recording, I also love performing and being on stage, and I really hope to spend the summer of 2015 going to as many venues as possible and sharing this album in a live setting with future listeners. This will require costs for transportation. 

Now you might be thinking, that's cool and all, but what's in it for me? Why should I donate? Well, in addition to being part of a fun music experience, there are gifts involved! If you check the perks, you will see that any donation you make will get you a prize. Prizes include personalized and privatized concerts, issued hard copies of the album before it is released, your name featured on the album as a contributor, and more!


The Impact

Music heals and saves people. It has done so for me many times. In September, when this album was just an idea in the back of my head, I suffered a very serious injury of my left foot. I broke six bones and had to get an extensive surgery. Without the surgery, I would not have a functioning foot, and therefore would never walk, let alone perform properly again. Even as this campaign is launching, I am still in the healing process. This foot fiasco brought about frustration, anger, depression, anxiety, and fear. But there was one thing that was able to lift me out of this dark mental state: MUSIC! Whenever I was at my worst physically or mentally, music was a way for me to escape and readjust my mood. Not only did I listen to music in my time of healing, but I also wrote a lot of new music, too, and what you will hear on the album are some of my latest creations. 

Although this injury was devastating, it taught me to live every day to the fullest and not be afraid to step out of my comfort zone and constantly strive to reach new heights. I now wake up every day ready to explore, learn, and create, and I do that through new music. In addition to providing a great listening experience with this album, I want people to be able to come together through the music and bring to the table whatever they are feeling, whether it be happiness or anger, and use the music to express themselves, or use the music to release any negative emotions. This album has something there for everyone, and I hope that people will connect with it and use it to dance, laugh, cry, heal, party, chill, sleep, whatever.


Risks & Challenges

Recording an album is no easy task. In addition to spending a lot of time writing and deciding how the songs should sound, I need to take into account how to make these songs the best they can be. The only way to do that is to plan each step accordingly and dedicate time to recording and producing every day. There are some actions that are currently beyond my skill level, such as intricate audio engineering, that are still a necessity for finalizing a solid piece of recorded music. That is where I turn to others to help me in this process. Once the recording is finished, it needs to be packaged and distributed, That entails an additional risk because finding a proper distributing service is a tricky and time consuming yet essential task for reaching as many people as possible. The final challenge is planning a tour and finding some local venues to showcase my songs. It can all be done! It just requires a lot of time, attention, and planning. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, there are still things you can do: share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and all of those other social media sites with all your friends! Have them share it with their friends, family, and even people they don't know! Let's spread the wonder that is music all around the world!


If you have any specific questions, please contact me at andrewfeyer@gmail.com. 

You can find this campaign on my website, www.feyermusic.com

story:
What is BLEND 2013?

At Ace Age Entertainment we are passionate about bringing the visual and performing arts to a higher level. BLEND 2013 is about creating an event that brings mindful forms of entertainment and a platform for artists and those who love the arts together by honoring the past and present while pushing the boundaries of art and music in to the future. 

BLEND 2013 combines a fusion of Visual Art and Musical Genres such as: Alt. Pop, Pop, Progressive Rock, folk, hip hop, funk, blues, jam and electronic music creating an event that is much more than just a party celebrating the arts but an experience that will be one for the record books. We look forward to becoming an outlet for inspiration and creation while promoting up and coming artists and visionaries. Ace age entertainment proudly represents a place where we expose underground artists to the rest of the world. 

We have designed BLEND 2013 for YOU the artists, and those who love the arts. We wish to have events where we can represent and showcase the best of the best and provide the cutting edge of entertainment and visual art. We ARE: innovative, creative, uplifting, professional, and inspirational and we wish to serve the art world as a pinnacle of creativity and prosperity long into the future. And, with your generous contribution you can become a fundamental part of making BLEND 2013 a success and help Ace Age Entertainment bring talented new musicians into the spotlight!

Check out the event on our website: http://www.AceAgeE.com/events/BLEND2013 

 

What BLEND 2013 Offers the Artists:

  • Free promotion on our website & printed materials
  • Free copies of their live recording
  • Free copies of the BLEND 2013 "Behind the Scenes" Documentary Film
  • The ability to reach new fans that may have never heard of them before through the awesome synergy of our lineup's diversity.

What BLEND 2013 Offers Our Contributors:

  • Exclusive opportunity to buy your ticket in advance through IndieGoGo (Only 150 available)
  • The ability to be part of a movement in independent music
  • Exclusive one-of-a-kind works of art
  • Deeply discounted advertisment opportunities

BLEND 2013 Lineup:

  • NICK (artist profile)
  • Benja (artist profile)
  • Maitland (band profile)
  • Treehouse (band profile)
  • Clayton Bryant (artist profile)

 

Event Information:

Location - The Lounge, SoHo: 154 Grand Street, New York, NY 10013

Doors - 8pm

First Act - 9pm

All Drinks - $3 (suggested donation to the artists)

 

About Ace Age Entertainment:

Ace Age Entertainment is a mixed-media company brought together by a team of talented individuals whom are passionate about Visual and Performing Arts. We believe in creating mindful not mindless forms of entertainment, by creating a platform for artists whose intentions are formed on the principles of bringing people together, by honoring the past, present, all the while pushing the arts in all of it forms to its limits.

Ace Age Entertainment develops, films, and produces content that is entertaining, inspiring, informative, and most of all creative. We enhance products with our passion, style, and uniqueness that differentiates us from any other production company.

Our Website: http://www.AceAgeE.com 

Our Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/AceAgeEnt 

Our Twitter Feed: http://www.twitter.com/AceAgeEnt
story_txt:
What is BLEND 2013?
At Ace Age Entertainment we are passionate about bringing the visual and performing arts to a higher level. BLEND 2013 is about creating an event that brings mindful forms of entertainment and a platform for artists and those who love the arts together by honoring the past and present while pushing the boundaries of art and music in to the future. 
BLEND 2013 combines a fusion of Visual Art and Musical Genres such as: Alt. Pop, Pop, Progressive Rock, folk, hip hop, funk, blues, jam and electronic music creating an event that is much more than just a party celebrating the arts but an experience that will be one for the record books. We look forward to becoming an outlet for inspiration and creation while promoting up and coming artists and visionaries. Ace age entertainment proudly represents a place where we expose underground artists to the rest of the world. 
We have designed BLEND 2013 for YOU the artists, and those who love the arts. We wish to have events where we can represent and showcase the best of the best and provide the cutting edge of entertainment and visual art. We ARE: innovative, creative, uplifting, professional, and inspirational and we wish to serve the art world as a pinnacle of creativity and prosperity long into the future. And, with your generous contribution you can become a fundamental part of making BLEND 2013 a success and help Ace Age Entertainment bring talented new musicians into the spotlight!
Check out the event on our website: http://www.AceAgeE.com/events/BLEND2013 
 
What BLEND 2013 Offers the Artists:

Free promotion on our website & printed materials
Free copies of their live recording
Free copies of the BLEND 2013 "Behind the Scenes" Documentary Film
The ability to reach new fans that may have never heard of them before through the awesome synergy of our lineup's diversity.

What BLEND 2013 Offers Our Contributors:

Exclusive opportunity to buy your ticket in advance through IndieGoGo (Only 150 available)
The ability to be part of a movement in independent music
Exclusive one-of-a-kind works of art
Deeply discounted advertisment opportunities



BLEND 2013 Lineup:

NICK (artist profile)

Benja (artist profile)

Maitland (band profile)

Treehouse (band profile)

Clayton Bryant (artist profile)


 


Event Information:
Location - The Lounge, SoHo: 154 Grand Street, New York, NY 10013
Doors - 8pm
First Act - 9pm
All Drinks - $3 (suggested donation to the artists)
 


About Ace Age Entertainment:
Ace Age Entertainment is a mixed-media company brought together by a team of talented individuals whom are passionate about Visual and Performing Arts. We believe in creating mindful not mindless forms of entertainment, by creating a platform for artists whose intentions are formed on the principles of bringing people together, by honoring the past, present, all the while pushing the arts in all of it forms to its limits.
Ace Age Entertainment develops, films, and produces content that is entertaining, inspiring, informative, and most of all creative. We enhance products with our passion, style, and uniqueness that differentiates us from any other production company.
Our Website: http://www.AceAgeE.com 
Our Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/AceAgeEnt 
Our Twitter Feed: http://www.twitter.com/AceAgeEnt

story:
Hogjim: Music Imports

We see ways to improve music accessories, so we reinvent.  We see ways to impact the world, so we reinvest.  Hogjim (хөгжим) is the Mongolian word for music, and through music we plan to transform Mongolia.  Today half of Hogjim's profits go directly to the people of Mongolia.  


The Pik-Tik

If you're a guitarist or have ever seen one with a pick in their mouth, you know that there is no place to hold your pick while playing.  With the Pik-Tik you can cut your transitioning time to tenths of a second and become a better guitarist.  This entirely new idea allows a guitarist to shift between strumming and finger picking seamlessly.

The Pik-Tik (patent pending) is a pick holder that suctions anywhere on your pick guard, keeping your pick perpendicular to the guitar's surface.  The entry slot is slightly curved, providing an excellent grabbing function for any light to medium pick.  Whether you insert the pick one millimeter or the full five millimeters, the Pik-Tik will still grasp your pick. The Pik-Tik can be easily removed after you're done playing or can be left on your guitar as a pick holder; either way it will not damage the surface. 



The Guitar Picks

Although the Pik-Tik will work with any brand of light or medium picks, we have made custom Hogjim "H" picks that are the perfect thickness for your Pik-Tik.  Our picks are light/mediums, around .71 mm.  

The Guitar Strap

As a guitarist myself, I was frustrated by guitar straps that were too hard to put on or would fall off while playing. Fixing one issue seemed to sacrifice the other. Strap locks are expensive and only work if you can replace the pegs that screw into the guitar, which is impossible for acoustic guitars with electronic pickups.  

Hogjim's guitar strap is both secure and quick to attach.  Your guitar peg clips though the silicone tabs then pulls down the key hole shaped strap ends. 



The Merchandise

At the "Music Ain't My Thing" perk, you are able to chose from one of the below items.  If you want both a hat and shirt check out the "Music Ain't My Thing Bundle"!

The Story

Hogjim: Music Imports has truly been a global adventure. A journey that began in the overpopulated streets of Hong Kong, found purpose in Mongolia and came to life in Wyoming.

The idea for the pik-tik originated in early 2012 when I was working at an international church in Hong Kong, China. As a music director myself, I was frustrated by not having place to put my pick between finger picking and strumming. After searching the guitar accessory market for a solution, I decided to develop my own. I handed the clay prototype off to a friend who worked in the manufacturing industry just before leaving for three months to work for a NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) in Mongolia. 

Working for an NGO in a foreign country left little time to develop a company, but did open my eyes to overwhelming poverty. In Mongolia’s capital of Ulaanbaatar (UB), most people live on less than $3 a day, unemployment is north of 50%, and alcoholism is about 80% among men. Nearly half of the country’s three million people live in UB and around 70% of those people live in what is called the ger district. The ger district is defined by a lack of running water, sanitation, and paved roads. Frequently dropping to negative 45 degrees Fahrenheit, Mongolia is home to one of the world’s harshest climates. The combination of these hardships leave the Mongolian people forced to suffer and merely endure life. During three months living in the ger district of UB, I witnessed more hunger, death, and hopelessness than ever before. Leaving was disheartening, for the country had captured my heart, but I knew that I’d be back. 

My transition from one of the world’s poorest countries to one of the wealthiest challenged me to combine a love for music and my heart for Mongolia. In the months following, my clay prototype transformed into a working pik-tik, and Hogjim LLC was formed in Laramie, Wyoming. There I was then encouraged to develop a company, rather than just a product. A guitar strap was next added to the accessory line; it clips on quicker and doesn’t fall off while playing. As ideas for products developed so did the vision for the company. 


The Country

When starting a company we wanted to make sure we cared about others as much as we cared about our products.  "For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul?" (Matthew 16:26)


The Crew

Hogjim was founded in early 2013 by Kyle Koster (middle) to develop the guitar accessories he wished were on the market.  Copywriter and creative, Nick Ciffone (right) is handling the marketing direction of Hogjim but is better known by his official title VP of Everything.  Eric Swanson (left) played a key role in developing the video.


The Need

I'd like to share where we're at as a company.  We have raised some money for the tooling cost but many unforeseen cost have arrisen.  I am looking to you all to help put Hogjim on the map.  We see great potential with the pik-tik and I could be a product that eventually every guitarist could own.  Even if you don't play guitar and your closet is full, please share this with your guitar playing friends. 

Building a company has been extremely challenging, and I could have never done this without the help of so many friends. Thanks Nick, Mike, Eric, Dave, Ryan, Dave, David, Mr. Witthoft and the rest of you.

We are certain we have quality products that will improve your skills and change the way you play guitar. I personally use both the Pik-Tik and the strap every day, and have been amazed by their results. I look forward to hearing feedback from the products. Thank you.

story:
We're making a CD.

Dale is an award-winning composer who writes a lot of choral music. Dr. Ian Malcolm is a producer and electronica composer. We want to know what happens when Dale's compositions for unaccompanied female voices meet Dr. Ian Malcolm's impeccable sense of rhythm and drive. We're hoping to bring choral music to electronica and electronica to choral music, creating a single album with seamless transitions and a narrative arc spanning both genres. 

We think you'll like it.

We need help.

  • A few of the expenses we need to cover: renting a recording space; paying our singers & conductor; paying album photographer Krysti Sabins; paying our recording engineer; designing, digitally distributing, and marketing the CD... 
  • That's a lot of people to pay.
  • Paying a lot of people is expensive. 
  • Raising $3,000 will allow us to cover the bare-bones minimum needed to release the CD digitally.
  • If we raise $5,500, we can afford to pay our talented musicians, conductor, recording engineer, and album-art photographer what we'd really like to pay them (they're really talented!) and release the CD digitally.
  • If we raise $7,500, we'll autmatically upgrade all backers to a gorgeous, physical album that we'll mail out when it's done, plus we'll still give you an early digital download of the CD.

You can help!

  • If you pre-order the CD for any amount over $10, you help us fund the CD now, you get the CD two weeks before the rest of the world, AND you get two bonus tracks: a choral track plus a remix. 
  • Any donation over $25 gets regular project updates accompanied by adorable photos of our studio cat-in-residence.
  • There are additional awesome perks available, like the chance to commission a new piece from Dale or Luke. A piece of music, dedicated to you for all eternity? Not bad.

It'll be awesome.

  • Dr. Ian Malcolm turned dinosaurs into this; he's going to make some crazy, wonderful remix magic happen using unaccompanied voices.
  • Dale's last recording project, Snow White Turns Sixty, raised over $4,000 through crowdfunding, was released to great reviews, and went on to a national tour. So she has high hopes for this one, too.
  • We're aiming to create an album that functions as a single piece: a cohesive, narrative journey through this music. 

...So help! 

  • Donate using the link above.
  • Share this project! Tweet it, share it on Facebook, invite it on LinkedIn, flirt with it on OKCupid...

Wait, where were we? Oh yeah. We need your help getting the word out! So pass the good news along. Choral music is mixing it up with electronica, and anything could happen.

story:
Short Summary

We are Wonderland Syndrome and we need your money! We have had to turn down several major European tour offers (most recently a 42 date tour with Marduk & Immolation) this year due to the fact that like most musicians, we are flat broke. As luck would have it, we have now been offered a smaller tour, closer to home, that is within our reach. ENDRAH, the most dangerous band in Brazil, is headlining their first US tour and they've invited us to come along. Long story short, we're fucking stoked!

Like all hard working, honest musicians, it's not about the money. All we want is to share our music with people who will (hopefully) appreciate and enjoy it.  We are hoping to break even financially on this tour, but not necessarily expecting to. If all goes well we will make enough from this tour to fund other, bigger tours.

This tour is a big opportunity for our band. Thank you all (in advance) for helping us bring our madness to a whole new group of Space Pirates!

 

What We Need & What You Get


Our goal of $1500 is to help us pay for booking fees, promotions, merchandise, guitar and bass strings, drum sticks, ramen noodles, and the biggest expense, GAS! We will be sleeping in our jeep and eating ramen (unless we can find something even cheaper!) Being the broke fuckers that we are, we don't have much to offer you in return to your help, but hopefully you'll see something here that'll catch your eye!

 

The Impact

All you Space Pirates out there are the ones that are going to make this happen! This tour is going to pave the way for many to come. If this tour isn't hitting your city, the next one will. Or the next one after that (hopefully). Wonderland Syndrome is going to share our ridiculousness with the world! We fucking love you guys and can't wait to rock the fuck out with each and every one of you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're broke like us, don't get depressed! Share this shit with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Myspace (just kidding lolol), and whatever other social networks we all waste our lives away on!!

 

Love, kisses, and METAL!
Wonderland Syndrome

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody! My name is Mekka Don and I am a hip-hop artist/songwriter originally from Columbus, OH.  I've always been passionate about music, but I come from a family who stressed the importance of education. As a result, I finished law school and worked as a lawyer before finally deciding to take the (crazy) leap to pursue my true passion.

Since I made that decision, things have gone pretty well but the road has been rocky! I've been recognized by MTV, XXL, The Source, ESPN, Ohio State, and others but we've functioned with NO investors and no major label backing.  This is an expensive business.

Although we've been able to produce some music, we've never been able to put out a full album. After all of these years, "The Dream Goes On" will be my debut album!  The (10 track) album is so important to me because it chronicles my story but also speaks for anyone who is trying to pursue their dream.  My success is your success and we all can make it...but we'll never know if we never try!

The production and promotion of an album is so expensive.  From the actual production of the music, copies of CDs, production of music videos, event planning, marketing and public relations, and radio promotion, the expenses to cover the cost of an album can be well into six figures (sometimes seven). 

Although this campaign will not raise the entire amount needed, it will go a long way in helping us achieve the goal of releasing my debut album successfully.  Without your support we will not be able to do it.

THE DREAM GOES ON!

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign we are looking to raise $12,500.  As I mentioned earlier, the release of an album can cost well into six figures.  Specifically we will use the funds for the physical production of CDs, production of 2-3 music videos, marketing and public relations for the project, and for the execution of release events. Your support is so necessary.

We have so many cool perks in exchange for your support.  You will see packages that include autographed CDs, autographed pictures, Pilot Boys tee shirts, Pilot Boys hoodies, Juice tee shirts, Fydelity bags, 'Grime and Glory' books, phone calls, Skype calls, autographed posters, social media follows, as well as Guestlist options.  Check it out!

The Impact

To date, we've had some success with having two music videos on MTV networks, music on ESPN, radio spins, major interviews and blog features, and performances in front of major crowds.  However, we believe this album is the culmination of everything we've done to get to this point.  It tells a story that we all can relate to.  Everyone has a passion...everyone has a dream.  If I can make it, we call can make it! I haven't made it yet though :)

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you cannot still help!  Spreading the word about this campaign and about the album itself is also very important.  Either way, please share with your network and feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.  

THE DREAM GOES ON!

story:
JAZZ NOIR

Exciting news: after years of refining our repertoire on the road, it's finally time for the Dmitri Matheny Group to record our popular JAZZ NOIR project—and we need your help to make it happen.

JAZZ NOIR offers a fresh spin on crime jazz, film noir and timeless classics, including:

  • cinematic themes from Touch of Evil, Laura, Chinatown, Vertigo, Taxi Driver, Blues In The Night, Twin Peaks, Toute Une Vie, High Wall, The Long Goodbye and Stormy Weather,
  • timeless classics Estate (Bruno Martino), Caravan (Juan Tizol), Here's Looking At You (Charlie Haden) and Golden Lady (Stevie Wonder)
  • Film Noir, a minor blues setting of a poem by Dana Gioia, and
  • Crime Scenes, an original suite with voiceover narration in the hardboiled style of Dashiell Hammett and Raymond Chandler.

The new Papillon/BluePort Jazz release will feature: 

  • high fidelity multi-track sessions at Megasonic Sound and David Lange Studios, 
  • liner notes by “Czar of Noir” Eddie Muller, 
  • art direction by Ballyard Design, and 
  • performances by “some of the most accomplished musicians in the western United States” (All About Jazz), including (subject to change): Bill Anschell, Matt Clark, Nick Manson, Charles McNeal, Susan Pascal, Phil Sparks, Todd Strait, Akira Tana, Jay Thomas and John Wiitala.

About The Artists

The Dmitri Matheny Group performs over 100 concerts annually on tour.

Directed by flugelhornist/composer Dmitri Matheny (“one of the most emotionally expressive improvisers of his generation”—International Review of Music), the DMG has developed an engaging repertoire and a strong international following. 

 

The group's signature sound pleases both crowds and critics, blending jazz classics, hard bop, west coast cool and favorite selections from the DMG's 10 critically-acclaimed CDs. 

“Their music is a fertile landscape without boundaries,” writes the Oakland Tribune, “earning Matheny and his cohorts a reputation as one of the most eclectic and daring ensembles on today’s jazz scene.”

All About Jazz agrees: “An all-star jazz band, the Dmitri Matheny Group is a cohesive and seamless unit, serving up equal parts soulful expression, caressing phrases, imaginative asides, and dedicated lyricism.”

What We Need

Making a record is a beautiful, intricate process that involves many weeks of devoted time and effort. 

Funds raised will directly support recording, production, mixing, mastering, artist fees, mechanical licenses and marketing costs associated with the new album.

 

What You Get

In grateful recognition of your involvement, we've put together a wonderful list of perks and premiums for you to enjoy, including VIP passes to concerts, a collection of commemorative recordings, autographed merchandise and more!

 

 

    The Power of Crowdfunding

    Crowdfunding is a powerful way to support creative projects.

    It's also very similar to jazz improvisation. 

    When we play jazz, we come together to create something which has never before existed. By contributing to this campaign you will join with us in creating a brand new work of art.

    We deeply appreciate the friends and fans who made our previous ten albums so successful, and we thank you for encouraging us to launch this campaign.

      How You Can Help

      We invite you to join us with a credit card or PayPal contribution to receive your advance copy of JAZZ NOIR and a treasure trove of VIP “thank you” gifts.

      Also, please spread the word by sharing a link to this page with your friends via email, Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms. 

      Together, we can make JAZZ NOIR our best album yet!

      We sincerely appreciate your support!

       

       

      Press

      Review: Dmitri Matheny: Jazz Noir (9/1/16)

      Review: Dmitri Matheny: Jazz Noir (6/30/16)

      Review: Dmitri Matheny’s Cast Of Thousands Drops In On Boxley’s for Jazz Noir (3/7/16)

      Review: Dmitri Matheny Presents Jazz Noir Theater For True Fans And Radio Heads (2/10/16)

      Feature: Matheny Raising Funds for Jazz Noir (8/1/15)

      Feature: Dmitri Matheny Group Crowdfunds Jazz Noir Record (7/7/15)

      Interview: Dmitri Matheny Traces Roots of His Jazz Noir Fascination (7/10/15)

      Feature: Matheny Raising Funds for Jazz Noir (8/1/15)
story_txt:
JAZZ NOIR
Exciting news: after years of refining our repertoire on the road, it's finally time for the Dmitri Matheny Group to record our popular JAZZ NOIR project—and we need your help to make it happen.
JAZZ NOIR offers a fresh spin on crime jazz, film noir and timeless classics, including:

cinematic themes from Touch of Evil, Laura, Chinatown, Vertigo, Taxi Driver, Blues In The Night, Twin Peaks, Toute Une Vie, High Wall, The Long Goodbye and Stormy Weather,
timeless classics Estate (Bruno Martino), Caravan (Juan Tizol), Here's Looking At You (Charlie Haden) and Golden Lady (Stevie Wonder)
Film Noir, a minor blues setting of a poem by Dana Gioia, and
Crime Scenes, an original suite with voiceover narration in the hardboiled style of Dashiell Hammett and Raymond Chandler.

The new Papillon/BluePort Jazz release will feature: 


high fidelity multi-track sessions at Megasonic Sound and David Lange Studios, 


liner notes by “Czar of Noir” Eddie Muller, 

art direction by Ballyard Design, and 

performances by “some of the most accomplished musicians in the western United States” (All About Jazz), including (subject to change): Bill Anschell, Matt Clark, Nick Manson, Charles McNeal, Susan Pascal, Phil Sparks, Todd Strait, Akira Tana, Jay Thomas and John Wiitala.


About The Artists
The Dmitri Matheny Group performs over 100 concerts annually on tour.

story:
The Dirty Beet Brothers - Modern Time Shine

This one is for Alan Repass. We feel the best way to truly honor our brother is to get the album out that he put his heart and soul into. We need your help getting this accomplished. The thought of crowdfunding was never something anyone in the band wanted to consider. We took pride in the fact that everything we accomplished came from our own hard work and determination.  
WE WOULD LIKE TO DISCLOSE THAT THIS IS NOT A MEMORIAL FUND FOR ALAN REPASS, BUT INSTEAD A FUND TO HELP ALAN'S MUSIC BE HEARD BY EVERYONE FOREVER. 

Our goal is to achieve $1500. This will not only pay for the CD production, but will make the CD retail ready and available for worldwide distribution through online facets. Any donations made to this fund that exceed our goal will be donated to the family of Alan Repass. If our goal is not met, the donations will be put toward the objective of getting the album released.

We truly appreciate all of our supporters, fans, and families through this difficult time. We thank you for everything you have already given us. 

We understand if you can't donate money, but you can still help us out by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

Please share the word!

Thank you all so much for all your love.

Sincerely,

The Dirty Beet Brothers

story:
Moneta is requesting our fans and friends to match our contribution to recording a new album.

Short Summary

Since forming in 2007, Moneta has been dedicated to making high quality music. 3 EP's and 1 full-length album later, we've decided that it's time for us to take it to the next level--both creatively and with production. This time, we've teamed up with renowned producer Jim Wirt (Incubus, Hoobastank, Jack's Mannequin) and will be tracking at the legendary Robert Lang Studios (Nirvana, Deathcab For Cutie, Taking Back Sunday) in Seattle starting late May 2013. We are so excited--not only about the prospect of creating a timeless record for our fans--but also for an experience we will cherish for the rest of our lives.

How You Can Make A Difference

Moneta has always been a hard-working band that has funded all of our previous records with money from shows and out of our own pockets. We have committed to funding as much of this record as possible within all of our means, but this time we are recording at a higher level studio with an acclaimed producer--we are asking for your help to meet us in the middle of the higher cost. All of your contributions will go towards recording, mixing, mastering, and duplication costs, as well as covering the cool perks we have planned. If we happen to exceed our campaign goal, the extra money will go towards the filming of a high quality music video. Thank you all for helping us in achieving this goal!

The Breakdown

 - Cost of studio, producer, engineer(s), and mixing =$16,963

- Mastering = $1200

- Album artwork, promo photos, new website design =$1000

- CD Duplication (duplication of 1000 limited edition Digipaks) = $1200

- Production of perks package items (Shirts, posters, etc) = $650

- Indiegogo fees (7%) = $700

Total cost of new album= $21,713

Moneta's personal contribution = $11,713

IndieGogo Campaign Fundraising Goal = $10,000

 

A heartfelt thank you to everyone that has ever come to a show, bought a piece of merch, or downloaded our music. We couldn't do this without you and we appreciate you all more than you can ever know. We know that times are tough. Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you still can help us by getting the word out about it.

Much love,

Jordan, Leo, Mike, Chrisgar, Ben, and Kevin

story:
Hi there!  My name is Glen Sprigg, and I am the organist at my local Catholic church.  For years I have been playing my own music at mass, and have received many compliments on my songs.  I deeply believe in my faith, and I see my musical talent as a gift from God to bring people closer to Him and His church.  I want to get my music out beyond my own church, to the greater Christian community.  So I'm going to record my music, send copies to publishers in the USA, and trust the rest to God.  God provides the inspiration, not the funding.  That's where you come in.


I've received a quote from a local recording studio, as well as a price for making the CDs themselves.  The total is $2500, which isn't much, but when you're a single-income family with three boys, it's tough to scrape the money together.  $500 is for the recording sessions themselves, both my own musical contribution as well as the soloists and the choir.  $700 is for mastering the tracks to a professional quality, and the remainder will go to physically producing the CDs themselves.

So what am I offering in return?  Well, since this is all about music, I'm going to offer copies of the music itself.  The basic perk is an mp3 and the sheet music for my first and most popular song, the Christmas song, 'Seek the Child.'  I'm also offering the sheet music for all my music in PDF or even in print, complete with autograph, for higher rewards.

Most Christian music is written from a different, non-Catholic perspective; my goal is simple: add a new perspective for people who are searching for meaning and truth in their lives. This is my first musical project, and I need your help to make it a reality. If you aren't able to help me financially, please help by getting the word out. This is a small project, but it can and will have a huge impact. Let everyone know, and please contribute anyway you can.

story:
My name is Katie Dunlap! I am a recent high school graduate ready to make my music known. An amazing and prolific opportunity has surfaced for me recently. I can finally record my debut EP. I am going to work extremely hard on this record not only for myself, but for everyone involved. If you help me reach my goal in time and you have donated at least 5 dollars for my cause, I will personally send you a signed hard copy of my EP! I hope you join me in this cause because I believe in my music more than anyone. I can see myself releasing songs that can be therapy for people's souls, as it was for me when I wrote them. Please help me reach my goal! I promise you won't regret it. If you want a taste of what I have to offer, check out my single Numb on iTunes.

https://itun.es/us/_Mpm7

It's also on Google Play!

Much love and thank you. xx

Katie Dunlap.

story:
Thank you for visiting my fundraising site! A close friend of mine has recently taken a job at one of the best studios in Saint Louis. Now, as Program Director at Vatterott College's Ex'treme Institute by Nelly, Joel Kern is offering me the opportunity of a lifetime!


Joel Kern in "Studio X" at Ex'treme Institute by Nelly


"Studio X" is a beautiful and amazing studio. Take a tour with this slide show: http://www.eibynelly.com/st-louis-recording-studio.asp


How much will it cost?

There are "perks" to donating $10 or more. If you donate $10 you get MusicEmbryo's new album. If you donate $20 you get both MusicEmbryo albums. The bigger the donation, the better the perk!

Studio Time

Because this is a top of the line studio, for an independent artist to rent, it cost $75 per hour, or $750 per 12hr-block. However, Joel is being given a rare discount, because he is producing the album as an employee of the Institute.

Discount

The most affordable way to rent this studio is by 12hr-blocks. With that, Joel is getting a $250 discount off of each 12hr-block. Plus, he is saving me even more money by not charging me for engineering the recording. We have been preparing and organizing this recording to be as efficient as possible. Three 12hr-blocks are estimated for what it will take to record four songs, mix them, and finish them. Joel is saving us $750, plus the engineer labor. Bringing us to a total of $1,500.

Physical Copies

It would be great to have physical copies of the record to distribute, unlike the first MusicEmbryo record. The number one manufacturer for independent artists is Disc Makers. They create one CD of your album for $1... if you buy one thousand of them. If you buy five hundred of them, they create one CD for $1.80.

  • 1,000 CDs for $999 (including printed jacket and disc)
  • 500 CDs for $899 (including printed jacket and disc)

Price quote here: http://www.discmakers.com/livequote/

Vinyl records would be way more interesting, but it is more expensive. So it depends on how much we have to work with. So far, it will cost approximately $2500 to record this album in a professional studio with 1000 CDs to give out.

If You Can't Donate...

If you can't donate, then please share this fundraiser on your facebook, twitter, to your email buddies, or even tell people about it! Anything helps!

If we don't reach our goal, then we will have to change our plans, but every donation and share helps.

If we reach our goal, then you will be a part of something special representing Saint Louis music.

If we surpass our goal, then vinyl records will be considered!

story:
Our Story

As four new incoming graduate students at the Eastman School of Music in the fall of 2015, we decided to form a quartet. During our first year together as a group, we found that we really enjoyed performing together and started performing around Rochester as much as possible. Our first concert at the National Museum of Play in Rochester helped us learn that we loved playing for all types of audiences in many different kinds of venues, and we have continued that trend ever since. In our second year with a lot of hard work and a little luck, we found success on the competition circuit, namely being awarded the Gold Medal at the 44th Annual Fischoff Chamber Music Competition and the 8th Plowman National Chamber Music Competition, two of the largest competitions of their types in the United States.

We have thoroughly enjoyed the past few years sharing our music with you through our recitals and community concerts. One question that consistently came up amongst our listeners was, “Do you have an album?” Now as we get ready to record our debut album, we need your help! 

The Project

After our success in the national competition circuit, three members of our group graduated from Eastman and are now scattered through the United States pursuing further graduate studies at institutions in Illinois and Georgia. While we still perform together, we wanted to have something that allows our listeners to hear us whenever they want! We decided that an album would be an exciting new endeavor for our group to pursue!

While in the very beginning stages of planning this campaign, we were contacted by Parma Recordings, who coincidentally saw our Fischoff performance on YouTube. They reached out to us expressing their interest in supporting a recording project by our group.

We then spent a few months deliberating what we wanted on our album. The more we discussed this, the clearer it became that we wanted to record two pieces that we believe helped shape our group identity, and we also wanted to record a piece that was recently written for our group!

The first piece we decided on was David Maslanka's Recitation Book. Our group cherishes this piece because it was the very first one we learned and performed together! We love how Maslanka reworks selected chorales of J.S. Bach and turns them into something that sounds familiar, yet new. This is perhaps our most frequently performed work, as we have performed it all throughout the United States at various venues including the Susan B. Anthony House in Rochester, the Chicago Cultural Center, and on radio on 98.7WFMT. Our group has spent countless hours rehearing this piece, and we love that we discover new things about it every time we perform it. We also knew this piece had to be included on the album because David Maslanka recently passed away, which we found has changed the way we think about and perform this work.

The second work we chose for this album was William Albright's Fantasy Etudes. This piece was also on our competition program, and we love how eccentric and eclectic this work is. This is also one of our favorite works to perform because it allows us to explore the extremes of the saxophone.We believe this theatric and whimsical work perfectly captures who we are as a group. Often considered one of the more difficult works of saxophone quartet music, we found that this piece taught us the value of group communication in chamber music. 

The last piece we chose is the one we are perhaps most excited to share with you all! We love performing and promoting the works of the talented composers of today, and we wanted this piece to be from a fellow Eastman colleague because of our admiration for the school and the talented musicians and composers that go there. Our soprano player, Nicki, performed one of David Clay Mettens' first works for saxophones, Everything that rises, on her first DMA recital. We all met with Clay after the performance over drinks, and the beginning of our friendship would soon spark a fruitful collaboration. The result, Ornithology S, is Clay's first work for the saxophone quartet, and our very first commission as a group! We recently premiered this work at the 2018 North American Saxophone Alliance conference in Cincinnati, and we received so much support from our saxophone colleagues surrounding the piece! Just as our group is beginning this new stage of our professional career, this piece is the new landmark that represents this transition. We are so thrilled to be recording what we think is an exceptional new work for saxophone quartet by and incredibly talented composer!

We are looking forward to this album being an important milestone for our group. We are so excited to share with you these three pieces that mean so much to us. Our biggest goal for this album is to capture the same excitement and passion that we have while performing live. We not only love performing these three pieces, but we feel that each piece has a special meaning for us.

A special thank you to Parma Recordings!

Why We Need Your Support?

Having played together for almost 3 years now, we love making music and love sharing it even more. We have spent many hours discussing how to put together an album that is not only a culmination of all the work we have put into the group, but also a representation of who we are as a group. That means that we want to our end product to not only be of the highest quality, but also a milestone in the history of our group. And with that goal in mind comes a very expensive process, including everything from the cost of commissioning of Ornithology S, to the cost of publishing, distribution and promotion fees for the album. Every single donation, no matter how big or how small, will play a part in the success of this project, and every contribution is incredibly appreciated. Additionally, any amount raised over our goal will go towards future recording projects. Below is a visualization of what the money we raise will cover:

What Do You Get For Your Support?

Be sure to check out the perks section for the full list of detailed rewards. We are really excited about these offerings including some of the following:

  • Physical copy of the CD
  • Your included in the acknowledgements of the liner notes
  • Fuego memorabilia
  • Arrangements!
  • Performances and social gatherings for our biggest donors!

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Share our campaign on social media
  • Visit our Website
  • Follow us on Facebook
  • Check out our YouTube Channel

The Project
After our success in the national competition circuit, three members of our group graduated from Eastman and are now scattered through the United States pursuing further graduate studies at institutions in Illinois and Georgia. While we still perform together, we wanted to have something that allows our listeners to hear us whenever they want! We decided that an album would be an exciting new endeavor for our group to pursue!
While in the very beginning stages of planning this campaign, we were contacted by Parma Recordings, who coincidentally saw our Fischoff performance on YouTube. They reached out to us expressing their interest in supporting a recording project by our group.
We then spent a few months deliberating what we wanted on our album. The more we discussed this, the clearer it became that we wanted to record two pieces that we believe helped shape our group identity, and we also wanted to record a piece that was recently written for our group!
The first piece we decided on was David Maslanka's Recitation Book. Our group cherishes this piece because it was the very first one we learned and performed together! We love how Maslanka reworks selected chorales of J.S. Bach and turns them into something that sounds familiar, yet new. This is perhaps our most frequently performed work, as we have performed it all throughout the United States at various venues including the Susan B. Anthony House in Rochester, the Chicago Cultural Center, and on radio on 98.7WFMT. Our group has spent countless hours rehearing this piece, and we love that we discover new things about it every time we perform it. We also knew this piece had to be included on the album because David Maslanka recently passed away, which we found has changed the way we think about and perform this work.
The second work we chose for this album was William Albright's Fantasy Etudes. This piece was also on our competition program, and we love how eccentric and eclectic this work is. This is also one of our favorite works to perform because it allows us to explore the extremes of the saxophone.We believe this theatric and whimsical work perfectly captures who we are as a group. Often considered one of the more difficult works of saxophone quartet music, we found that this piece taught us the value of group communication in chamber music. 
The last piece we chose is the one we are perhaps most excited to share with you all! We love performing and promoting the works of the talented composers of today, and we wanted this piece to be from a fellow Eastman colleague because of our admiration for the school and the talented musicians and composers that go there. Our soprano player, Nicki, performed one of David Clay Mettens' first works for saxophones, Everything that rises, on her first DMA recital. We all met with Clay after the performance over drinks, and the beginning of our friendship would soon spark a fruitful collaboration. The result, Ornithology S, is Clay's first work for the saxophone quartet, and our very first commission as a group! We recently premiered this work at the 2018 North American Saxophone Alliance conference in Cincinnati, and we received so much support from our saxophone colleagues surrounding the piece! Just as our group is beginning this new stage of our professional career, this piece is the new landmark that represents this transition. We are so thrilled to be recording what we think is an exceptional new work for saxophone quartet by and incredibly talented composer!
We are looking forward to this album being an important milestone for our group. We are so excited to share with you these three pieces that mean so much to us. Our biggest goal for this album is to capture the same excitement and passion that we have while performing live. We not only love performing these three pieces, but we feel that each piece has a special meaning for us.
A special thank you to Parma Recordings!
Why We Need Your Support?
Having played together for almost 3 years now, we love making music and love sharing it even more. We have spent many hours discussing how to put together an album that is not only a culmination of all the work we have put into the group, but also a representation of who we are as a group. That means that we want to our end product to not only be of the highest quality, but also a milestone in the history of our group. And with that goal in mind comes a very expensive process, including everything from the cost of commissioning of Ornithology S, to the cost of publishing, distribution and promotion fees for the album. Every single donation, no matter how big or how small, will play a part in the success of this project, and every contribution is incredibly appreciated. Additionally, any amount raised over our goal will go towards future recording projects. Below is a visualization of what the money we raise will cover:

What Do You Get For Your Support?
Be sure to check out the perks section for the full list of detailed rewards. We are really excited about these offerings including some of the following:

Physical copy of the CD
Your included in the acknowledgements of the liner notes
Fuego memorabilia
Arrangements!
Performances and social gatherings for our biggest donors!

Other Ways You Can Help!

Share our campaign on social media
Visit our Website

Follow us on Facebook

Check out our YouTube Channel

story:
HELLO,

We are “Kenny Taylor & The Optimistic Banjo” a guitar/banjo indie/folk band that has been steadily building momentum playing shows all over Central California. 

This is our first album and it will be recorded at Sutton Studios (Atascadero,CA) in late December 2013. It will feature 10-12 original songs by KT&TOB. We are also currently booking venues and festivals in 2014 to promote that album! But we need your help!! 

HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN

To record and promote this album the right way, we need to raise $5000.                             

*Where is your money going?*

-Studio Expenses (Engineering, Recording, Mastering,etc.) 90% of money raised

 -Promotional Materials (Advertisements,mailing materials) 7% of money raised

-Equipment (Strings) 3% of money raised

Bio's

The band consists of Kenny Taylor and Max Martinelli

Max Martinelli is a born and raised Californian and currently in his Sophomore year at Cuesta College. Max has been playing music for over 4 years and has loved becoming apart of the local music scene. It is his dream to play music and share it with everyone he meets.

Kenny Taylor is originally from Southern Minnesota , he studied Theatre Arts and Music at Moorhead State University. Kenny has been singing and writing music for over half his life and moved to California in 2007 to pursue music and theatre. He now lives on the central coast with his wife and two boys and his little dog Smokey ;)

In Conclusion:

We are asking YOU to simply join and share us as we work toward our goals. Any donation big or small, will go a long way.

We have videos on our Facebook Page.

www.soundcloud.com/ktandtheoptimisticbanjo

www.facebook.com/ktandtheoptimisticbanjo

"We cannot begin to explain how being able to record this album would help us move one step closer to fulfilling our dreams. Music is for everyone to share and helping us fund this album is helping us share our music with the world."
-KT&TOB

story:
Thank you in advance for taking the time to check out this campaign and for supporting my music!!

 

Hi there! My name is Deirdre Forrest. I'm a singer and songwriter from Asbury Park, NJ. I've been performing throughout the tristate area since 2009. I've shared the stage with amazing acts, played countless shows to fantastic crowds and shared my heart and soul with so many wonderful people. Singing is my reason for being. I'm most myself when I'm sharing my voice.  I've had the honor to work with the brilliant, Grammy nominated producer, Steve Greenwell on this project, which is my absolute best work to date. Steve has taken my sound and my vision and brought many lovely things to life within my songs. My voice shines and the emotion in my stories rings out with his direction. My new EP Fear[Less] is a departure from the stripped-down acoustic vibe of my past projects. I'm so proud of the work that has been done, but there is still more to do.

The songs are on their way to being finished and I would hope to release the first single by the end of the Summer. I'm excited for you hear these new songs, but I need your assistance to make my dream come true!!  

 

**Goals!**:

I'm looking to raise $7,500.00 for the production, to pay the extremely talented musicians and to release the music on all digital platforms: iTunes, Spotify, etc., and have CDs and some special edition vinyl records made. Anything raised from this campaign will be contributing to the future release of Fear[Less]! 

I will keep everyone updated on the progress of the record, the status of the perks and their approximate delivery dates! :)

Cool Merch & Awesome Perks!:

I'm working on a new logo design and fabulous new merch!! I will be updating contributors and asking for YOUR opinions on which designs you like the best!

Everyone who contributes will receive a Deirdre Forrest sticker and shout outs on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!

Contributors who donate $10 will receive your choice of a digital download or CD and a sticker.

Contributors who donate $25 will receive a Fear[Less] button, sticker and digital download or CD.

I have two t-shirt designs in the works for contributors that donate $50. You will also receive a digital download or CD, button and sticker. 

Contributors who donate $75  will receive a pinup poster, t-shirt, a digital download or CD, button and sticker. 

Contributors who donate $100 will receive a really cool tote bag featuring my cat, Riordan as part of the design, a t-shirt, button,  a digital download or CD and a sticker. Meowza!

Contributors who donate $150 will be able to pick out any song that they love and I will cover  it and record a video of it to send to you. Also included: t-shirt, sticker, button, a digital download or CD and a poster.

Contributors who donate $200 will receive a 1 hr. voice lesson with me, button, sticker, poster, digital download or CD and a t-shirt! Let's give those vocal chords a workout!!

Contributors who donate $300 can have their logo or Ad featured on my website and blog on DeirdreForrest.com, T-shirt, button, sticker and digital download or CD.

Contributors who donate $400  will be featured in the music video for "Timber", and will receive sticker, a t-shirt, button, poster, a vinyl copy and a digital download or CD.

Contributors who donate $500 will receive a free full band  house concert, a t-shirt, poster, button, tote bag, sticker and a vinyl copy of the EP and a digital download or CD. 

And anyone who donates $1,000 will receive a brand new ukulele with gig bag, a 1 hr. voice lesson,  a full band house concert, a t-shirt, tote bag, button, poster and a vinyl copy and digital download or CD. 

 

Follow me on Instagram: @DeirdreForrestMusic

Like my page for show info.: Facebook.com/DeirdreForrestMusic

Share this campaign & continue to live your dreams, fearlessly! 

 

All my love to you, friends!

xoxox,

Deirdre
