story:
A music REVOLUTION is at hand, & we are excited to be a part of it! With YOUR support, we can independently release ROOTS TO REVOLUTIONS, an album, unlike anything we've done before! Its essence will open your heart & connect you to the depths of your soul. It will inspire you to reach deep into your roots, RISE UP, & BE THE CHANGE!

 

“The highest goal of music is to connect one’s soul to their Divine Nature, not entertainment.”

~Pythagoras (569- 475 BC)

 

Hi, we are Randall and Kristin Brooks of Bhakti House Band, and we want to invite YOU to join us in something life-altering… world-changing… revolutionary…

 

Sunrise 108 Gayatri Meditation workshop, Fort Lauderdale, FL

 

Music Has the Power to Heal & Change the World

 

We believe that music and sacred sound have the power to change and heal the world. And our mission is to share positive, uplifting, healing music that inspires us all to rise above the mundane and joyfully live life to the fullest. Our desire is to create a soundtrack for living a life filled with purpose and passion, and then set the world on fire with love. Our music, filled with love and mantra (Sanskrit for "protective tool for the mind"), sends out positive vibes to work on us at the most subtle levels--especially in calming the sympathetic nervous system, as well as sends a positive message to reprogram our thought and emotional patterns.

 

We all live in a society that tells us that love and kindness are not the norms. We are surrounded by programming from the media, news, politicians, and advertisers all telling us that we are broken in some way. They insist that the world is full of nothing but evil and hate at every turn, that we are doomed, and only they can save us. If we accept these suggestions as truth, then our reality will follow. 

 

But... we are here to challenge all of that.

 

 

 

 

Great teachers of the past tell us that "suggestion" is the most powerful force in the universe… that life itself was born through the power of suggestion. 100% of our human behavior is a direct result of suggestion, whether that suggestion comes from ourselves or from our environment.

 

What you feed grows, and what you feed yourself is what you become.


 

This is especially true regarding music since music has been proven to be one of the fastest and most powerful ways to instill new suggestions or change thought patterns.

 

That's where we come in...

 

 

A little background...

 

Growing up, I (Randall) accepted these type of negative suggestions from my environment, and it led me to a path of turmoil, substance abuse, violence, and aggression in my teens, and the music I listened to reinforced that identity. One night, I was fortunate to hear a song that told me a different story--that I was much more than what I had been living, that I had a purpose and was worthy to live a better life. It broke me down and forced me to face the shadows within. I listened to that song over and over and over, allowing it to repeat all night while I slept. When I awoke the next morning, my trajectory had completely changed. And then my life followed. It was then that I began to realize the awesome power of music, and I wanted to be a part of that. It soon became my desire to write songs and share music that was inspiring and thought-provoking—songs to challenge dogma and invite others to stop and think for themselves a little more. 

 

 

Boy Meets Girl

 

   +     =   

 

 

Soon after, this boy from the hood met a girl from the west side (Kristin) who grew up surrounded by all types of music from classical to the Beatles, playing piano, writing music, singing in musical theatre productions and choirs as well as various  local bands, and who had even been a music major in college. Though from very different worlds, our voices and our hearts came together so effortlessly, and she shared my passion to share inspiring (and maybe a little controversial) music. So here we are now. We've been singing together for almost 25 years and married just about as long. Completely devoted to one another as well as to our dharma (life purpose) and musical mission to spread healing love through song, we have shared our music as Bhakti House Band  (which means the House of Love)  for about 10 years now. 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

 

Our country and even our world have seemed to be in an uproar lately, with many left feeling lost and in tremendous fear. United we stand; divided we fall, and our world needs healing more than ever. Music is a universal language that unifies and speaks directly to the heart. Kristin and I have personally experienced the healing power of music and are devoted to paying that forward and continuing to create more music that heals and inspires all of us to live a full and empowered life.

 

We ALL deserve to experience love. And when we feel love, we are likely to share more love in service to others while bringing forth our gifts into a greater purpose. But no one can do this alone. We are ALL here to support one another. That's why this project is so important... The more people we can reach and inspire with our music, the more people that could be inspired to heal their wounds. And when we free ourselves (and others) from our wounds, our hearts open, we feel connected to the world around us, and move with more compassion and wisdom. IMAGINE a world where LOVE and KINDNESS motivate us rather than fear; a world working in harmony to uplift and EMPOWER everyone. Welcome to the vision of Bhakti House Band music!

 

 

 

On top of all our music's healing power, proceeds from ALL our music efforts go to support impoverished children around the world with food, education, and medical care through our Peace Love OM Project, a project under CLEF (Conscious Living Empowerment Foundation) a 501(c)3 we founded.

 

 

It's time to celebrate expand the diverse and colorful world around us, as it is expressed through nature and humanity!

 

 


Holi Festival of Colors, 2016

 

 

This NEW ALBUM called ROOTS TO REVOLUTIONS

(incremental release begins February 18, 2019)...


 

This Indiegogo campaign is to create and distribute a new album, which will draw from our roots like never before. We will be integrating everything from old gospel and church hymns, to rap and hip hop, to Tibetan bowls, beloved classical Sanskrit mantras, and kirtan. We combine western and eastern instrumentation and rich harmonies, all driven by a powerful combination of drums and percussion from different cultures all over the world. These various healing musical influences represent seeds of our musical past that have brought us to THIS present moment. As we integrate our experiences and expand our world view, the music we create continues to evolve to reach out to a broader audience. 

 

 

Bhakti Fest Joshua Tree, CA 2015

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We have amazing perks and gifts in exchange for your support! So as to keep the stress down of whether or not we meet our financial goals on time here and be able to receive funds for the project and meet our deadlines, we have divided the project into several phases, and SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED PHASE 1 of $5400 and part of PHASE 2, which kept us busy in the studio for a while! BUT it will actually take about 4 times that to create and be able to do everything we hope to do with this album. We have recorded most of the album music, thanks to the funds from PHASE 1, and are in the process of completing PHASE 2, mixing and mastering!

 

Phase 1: production/recording studio fees: $5400... COMPLETE! YAY!

Phase 2: mixing and mastering fees: $5400 for a total of $10,800 (in progress...)

Phase 3: artwork design, cd production, and printing/pressing

Phase 4: perk product fulfillment, shipping, and campaign fees; tour expenses 

Phase 5: marketing and promotional campaign 

ABOVE & BEYOND... once we fund all 5 phases, anything above and beyond will go to continually boost our message and music to the next level, reaching all 4 corners of the world to a broader audience, uniting humanity, and sharing and inspiring love.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Listen up! There's a new genre of music forging its way across the globe... a heart-centered, music revolution! And it's inspiring humanity, continually calling forth MORE love, MORE authenticity, MORE healing, and MORE empowerment in our lives! The ONLY RISK here is buying into a world of negativity and then standing alone, immobilized, watching life pass you by from the sidelines. Instead, why not buy into the power and possibility of LOVE and then help us to spread that love, kindness, healing, and inspiration through uplifting music by backing this project. We choose the latter, and you can count on us to see this project through to the finish. We refuse to give up until we're done. We have completed 4 other albums prior and have gathered supporting fans now in more than 88 countries, so we are confident that we can count on YOU to help us achieve this dream! Join the revolution! 

 

 

Holi Festival of Colors, 2016

 

 

Ways You Can Help

 

1. Contribute to our campaign and receive an AWESOME PERK in return! 

2. Share our campaign on your social media pages every few days

3. Send personal messages (text, email, facebook, etc) to friends who are ready to stand up in love!

 

We understand that times can be tough, and though you may believe strongly in our project, you feel you can't contribute financially right now. AHO! Remember that there is a way you can help us tremendously by helping us get the word out:

1. share our campaign on your social media pages using the Indiegogo Share Tools

2. personally share with friends you feel could always use a boost in life (aka: everyone!)

 

 

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU! THANK YOU! LOVE!

Thank you so much for your love and support! We value it more than words could ever convey! 

 

May the Blessings Be,

Randall & Kristin

Welcome to the vision of Bhakti House Band music!   On top of all our music's healing power, proceeds from ALL our music efforts go to support impoverished children around the world with food, education, and medical care through our Peace Love OM Project, a project under CLEF (Conscious Living Empowerment Foundation) a 501(c)3 we founded.  It's time to celebrate expand the diverse and colorful world around us, as it is expressed through nature and humanity!  Holi Festival of Colors, 2016  This NEW ALBUM called ROOTS TO REVOLUTIONS(incremental release begins February 18, 2019)... This Indiegogo campaign is to create and distribute a new album, which will draw from our roots like never before. We will be integrating everything from old gospel and church hymns, to rap and hip hop, to Tibetan bowls, beloved classical Sanskrit mantras, and kirtan. We combine western and eastern instrumentation and rich harmonies, all driven by a powerful combination of drums and percussion from different cultures all over the world. These various healing musical influences represent seeds of our musical past that have brought us to THIS present moment. As we integrate our experiences and expand our world view, the music we create continues to evolve to reach out to a broader audience.   Bhakti Fest Joshua Tree, CA 2015  What We Need & What You Get We have amazing perks and gifts in exchange for your support! So as to keep the stress down of whether or not we meet our financial goals on time here and be able to receive funds for the project and meet our deadlines, we have divided the project into several phases, and SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED PHASE 1 of $5400 and part of PHASE 2, which kept us busy in the studio for a while! BUT it will actually take about 4 times that to create and be able to do everything we hope to do with this album. We have recorded most of the album music, thanks to the funds from PHASE 1, and are in the process of completing PHASE 2, mixing and mastering! Phase 1: production/recording studio fees: $5400... COMPLETE! YAY!Phase 2: mixing and mastering fees: $5400 for a total of $10,800 (in progress...)Phase 3: artwork design, cd production, and printing/pressingPhase 4: perk product fulfillment, shipping, and campaign fees; tour expenses Phase 5: marketing and promotional campaign ABOVE & BEYOND... once we fund all 5 phases, anything above and beyond will go to continually boost our message and music to the next level, reaching all 4 corners of the world to a broader audience, uniting humanity, and sharing and inspiring love.  Risks & Challenges Listen up! There's a new genre of music forging its way across the globe... a heart-centered, music revolution! And it's inspiring humanity, continually calling forth MORE love, MORE authenticity, MORE healing, and MORE empowerment in our lives! The ONLY RISK here is buying into a world of negativity and then standing alone, immobilized, watching life pass you by from the sidelines. Instead, why not buy into the power and possibility of LOVE and then help us to spread that love, kindness, healing, and inspiration through uplifting music by backing this project. We choose the latter, and you can count on us to see this project through to the finish. We refuse to give up until we're done. We have completed 4 other albums prior and have gathered supporting fans now in more than 88 countries, so we are confident that we can count on YOU to help us achieve this dream! Join the revolution!   Holi Festival of Colors, 2016  Ways You Can Help 1. Contribute to our campaign and receive an AWESOME PERK in return! 2. Share our campaign on your social media pages every few days3. Send personal messages (text, email, facebook, etc) to friends who are ready to stand up in love! We understand that times can be tough, and though you may believe strongly in our project, you feel you can't contribute financially right now. AHO! Remember that there is a way you can help us tremendously by helping us get the word out:1. share our campaign on your social media pages using the Indiegogo Share Tools2. personally share with friends you feel could always use a boost in life (aka: everyone!)  WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU! THANK YOU! LOVE!Thank you so much for your love and support! We value it more than words could ever convey!  May the Blessings Be,Randall & Kristin

story:
Short Summary

Dear friends, it's been a couple of years since I did the "Balladeer" CD campaign and raised enough funds from your generosity! Through the years many of my older worship songs have been lost because those albums are out of print. And several new worship songs have yet to be recorded. Please consider joining me in helping produce this newest collection of worshipful songs! It's great to have a team of friends together in this project! And check out the Perks! I want you to have an autographed copy! Worshipfully, Scott Wesley Brown

story:
Many have been asking, and it's almost here!


Kayla Luky recently went into the studio and recorded an album like she's NEVER done before...

That's right. Brought in the BIG-GUNS. We're talkin' accredited studios. Top-notch engineer. Award winning producer. Award winning graphic artist. Hottest players around. Big. Guns. We couldn't be happier with how things are starting to turn out. Won't you have a listen for yourself?


Now, I bet you're wondering how much this big-gun album cost? Kayla spent the last couple years in Manitoba's Parkland, workin' long and workin' hard, saving nickels and dimes. After all that saving, there were two options: A) get a new fully-loaded civic or B) make a new album. As you may have guessed, Kayla's still rockin' the 2005 Honda Civic with 360,000 + kms, but the tank is getting low.

Mixing, mastering and manufacturing still has to be tackled before 'Back to Dirt,' Kayla Luky's sixth musical offering is officially launched in the Spring of 2016.

If you like what you heard - that's just the demos! It is going to get even better yet! We're going big or going home here, people.

We're offering up a pre-sale (right in time for Christmas, may we add) in order to help finish off the project. Check out the following options on how you can help get this rocket off the ground.

In the meantime, Kayla proudly continues to work and play in her hometown (s) of Grandview (and Gilbert Plains) Manitoba while pursuing music. She greatly appreciates your support, whether it's monetarily through this indiegogo effort, helping get the word out of 'Back to Dirt' or your positive words of encouragement. Thank you.


Demo Credits:

Songs Written by Kayla Luky of Grandview, Manitoba

New Album “Back to Dirt” coming Spring 2016

Producer Murray Pulver
Engineer Don Benedictson at Unity Gain Productions
Additional Engineering, Additional Guitars & Background Vocals
Murray Pulver at Sign Post Music
Mixing & Mastering Paul Yee
Vocals & Acoustic Guitar Kayla Luky
Electric Guitar Anthony Pizzi
Bass Matthew Filopoulos
Drums Daniel Bertnick
Pedal Steel John Ellis
Piano & B3 Marc Arnould at Private Ear Recording with engineering by JP Peters

story:
My Story

For years, while a member of the band Five A.M, I have been trying to create music that speaks to not only people's hearts but their souls.  As the band begins to close the door on it's career a window has opened for me as a songwriter.  Over a year ago I was somewhat depressed as I began to realize Five A.M. was not going to rise to the heights I had wanted.  In the midst of that winter more and more songs began to pour out of me.  Not rock songs but simple - sparse songs that pointed towards the struggle of living a deeper, passionate, and spiritual life.  It was music I have been writing and setting aside for years, but was now ready to come out.  At a retreat in the mountains of Oregon I ran into an incredible violin player, Duane Whitcomb, who opened up these new songs even further.  I played  a few solo concerts and found that this music resonated people.  I received emails and had long talks with strangers who were moved by these new songs.  I was asked repeatedly where my music could be found and purchased but I didn't have anything.  After many, many restless nights I have decided to do something I have a hard time doing.....ask for help.  I don't have the money to record, so I am asking for people to pre-buy the CD or give more, if you feel so inclined.


The Music

The new record is called Birdwings.  Rumi says that throughout our life we let go of and hold things tightly.  If our hands were always a fist, or always stretched open, we would be paralyzed.  In the middle is the truth.  The songs for this record follow that theme.  I am trying to broaden what people define as spiritual - deeper - heart music.  This coming summer I have been asked to perform at a few big events.  This CD will help me to leave a message behind once the show is over.


What I Need & What You Get

At a minimum I need 5,000 bucks to pay for studio time, an engineer, guest musicians (piano, cello...etc), mixing, mastering and print fees.  No money will be used for new instruments or gas in my car to get to the studio or anything else besides direct recording.  A day in the studio costs $480.  5 days for me to record vocals and guitar tracks plus a couple days to lay piano, violin, cello and strings and the cost is already at $3,360.  Add to that two days of mxing and mastering and we are at $4320.  Print fees for 300 cd's plus itunes set up costs $600.  So as you can see I am budgeting very tight.  I will also be putting in my own money and any money I make at solo gigs to the project.  I am calling in some favors from my musician friends so many of them are donating their time to help me out.  I know money is tight for everyone so I am trying to make the most out of as little as possible but I do guarantee you will love the album once it is finished.  If it ends up people donate MORE than the $5,000 asked for, well, fantastic!  That will allow me to not have to rush as much through the studio.


I have included some cool perks for those of you that can do more than $20.  You can tell me an idea, story, or about a person you would like me to write a song about.  You can tell me all about your girlfriend or fiancée and I will write a song that expresses your feelings or story.  We can grab a beer together and talk about the music or life.  I will come to your house and play a house concert or maybe play for just you and your friends.   You can come in to the studio and observe the recording process.  Regardless of all the perks anyway you can help is appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

Send a link about this site to everyone and anyone who loves this kind of music.  Every little bit helps even taking the time to pass along the link.

story:
We are Avenue Lighthouse a Christian Rock band from Durango Colorado.

Over the next 40 days we are trying to raise $6,000 to fund the recording and production of our new album as well as acquire merchandise. Our ultimate goal is to reach as many people with the Gospel as we possibly can through our music. The world can be a dark place and we want to be a light shining in that darkness.

Our hope is that by recording this album and marketing ourselves through merchandising this campaign will be a springboard for us in the music industry and allow us to be self funding in the future.

We have some sweet perks for you ranging from autographed copies of our album to a private acoustic house show!

We are confident that we will meet our goal, however if for some reason we do not we will use the funds we have to begin recording and anyone who gives will receive a signed copy of the album and a personalized shout out on our Facebook page.

This is our first time using a crowd funding platform for a project and we are excited about the opportunity to involve you in our creative process and be a part of using the talents and gifts that we have been given to spread a message of hope to the world. no matter the outcome we are committed to seeing this project to its completion even if that means making up the difference ourselves.

That being said we still need your help and we would love to have an opportunity to partner with you in this venture.

If you are not in a place to help us meet our financial goal you can still help us by sharing our campaign and letting as many people know about us as you can.

Daniel, Caleb, Matt, and Sam

story:
"Come to walk in the rain with us"

Hola,
Soy Oscar Neira (saxofonista y compositor) de origen colombiano pero vivo en Barcelona (España).
Hace un año con la colaboración de unos grandes músicos y amigos como son Paco Weht (de Argentina/contrabajo), Gilles Estoppey (de Suiza/teclados y piano) y Santi Colomer (de Cataluña-España/batería) cree "The Quartet".
The Quartet es una banda de jazz con influencias diversas como el pop, rock, funky, folk,etc. Todos los temas que tocamos son de mi propia autoría.
Después de tocar durante un año, finalmente hemos grabado un disco que llevará por nombre "Walking in the rain".
Como he dicho el disco está grabado y hasta aquí he podido llegar con mi dinero, pero necesito tu ayuda para terminarlo.
Falta la post-producción, diseño, copias, por eso no pido demasiado dinero, sino lo justo para terminarlo y me entusiasma la idea de poder intercambiar tu ayuda por las diferentes recompensas que ofrecemos aquí.
¡Anímate a caminar bajo la lluvia con nosotros y ya solo por haber leído hasta aquí, muchas gracias!!!
¡Hasta pronto!
Oscar Neira
website: www.oscarneira.com
oscarneiramusic@gmail.com 


PARA ESCUCHAR "WALKING IN THE RAIN" Y "KIMAH" 2 temas que aparecerán en el próximo disco clica aquí: https://www.onepoint.fm/onthequartet 



"Come to walk in the rain with us!"

Hi,

I'm Oscar Neira (saxofonist and composer) from Colombia but I live in Barcelona (Spain).

One year ago I created “The Quartet”with the collaboration of great musicians and friends like Paco Weht (from Argentina/doble bass), Gilles Estoppey (from Switzerland/ keyboards and piano) and Santi Colomer (from Catalonia-Spain/ drums).

The Quartet is a jazz band with many influences from Pop, Rock, Funky, Folk music,etc. All the music we play are my own original compositions.

After playing during one year, we finally have recorded a disc to be called “Walking in the rain”.

Like I said before the disc is recorded yet, but we don't have enough money to finish it. We still have to do the postproduction work, the design and print the copies, which is why I don't require very much money, but rather just enough to complete the job. I like the idea of exchanging your help with this projet for the different perks you can see here.

So cheer up and walk in the rain with us, and thank you very much just for reading this!

Hoping to see you soon.

Oscar Neira

www.oscarneira.com

oscarneiramusic@gmail.com


AND NOW TO LISTEN TO "WALKING IN THE RAIN" AND "KIMAH", 2 themes of the new disc, just click here:https://www.onepoint.fm/onthequartet



"Come to walk in the rain with us!"


Salut,

Je m'appelle Oscar Neira, je suis saxofoniste d'origine colombienne, mais j'habite à Barcelone (Espagne).

Il y a un an, j'ai crée "The Quartet" grâce à la collaboration de grands musiciens et amis comme sont: Paco Weht (d'Argentine/contre-basse), Gilles Estoppey (de Suisse/piano et claviers) et Santi Colomer (d'Espagne/battrie).

"The Quartet" est une bande de jazz avec diverses influences comme le pop, rock, funky, folk, etc. Tous les thèmes que nous jouons sont mes propres compositions.

Après avoir joué durant un an, nous avons finalement enregistré un disque qui aura pour nom "Walking in the rain".

Comme je l'ai dit, l'album est déjà enregistré et j'ai pu arriver jusqu'ici avec mon argent, mais j'ai besoin de ton aide pour le terminer.

Il manque encore la post-production, le design, les copies, c'est pourquoi je ne demande pas beaucoup d'argent sinon juste la somme pour pouvoir le finir, et je suis très enthousiaste à l'idée de pouvoir échanger ton aide contre les récompenses que nous offrons ici.

Viens marcher sous la pluie avec nous!! Et merci beaucoup seulement pour lire jusque ici!

À bientôt


Oscar Neira

www.oscarneira.com

oscarneiramusic@gmail.com


POUR ÉCOUTER "WALKING IN THE RAIN" ET "KIMAH" 2 thèmes qui appaîtront dans le prochain album clique ici:

 https://www.onepoint.fm/onthequartet

story:
Who are these guys?

Hello there! We're The Breton Sound, a rock and roll band from New Orleans, LA. Since we started playing in 2010, we've worked really hard to write and record music that we love and that makes us feel alive. We've released two EPs, "Eudaemonia" (2011) and "Maps" (2013), and now it's time for us to start on our next record. But you can download our first two for free over at thebretonsound.bandcamp.com

This time around, we're recording in different studios through out the south. We're heading to places where some of our favorite albums have been made and some of our favorite bands have recorded.

We're hitting up Ardent Studios in Memphis (Big Star, The Replacements, Issac Hayes, The Racontours), Southern Grounds Studios in Atlanta (Zac Brown Band), FAME Studios in Muscle Shoals, AL (Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin), and The Music Shed in our home town of New Orleans (Robert Plant, REM, Dr. John).

We're recording two songs at each studio. So what we're actually doing is recording not one, but TWO new EPs!!! So you'll get one now, and one later! 

We've always prided ourselves on putting out polished, top notch quality records.  We'll continue working with our producer, Tom Drummond of Better Than Ezra, who has always pushed us to be our absolute best on our previous two EPs. Tom's been a big part of our team the last few years, and this time, we'd like to expand our team. We'd like to invite YOU to be a part of our team. 

What do these guys need?

Making a record isn't a cheap thing. Making two at the same time isn't cheap either, but we've worked our little butts off in pre-production to make our sessions as efficient and productive as possible.

We're looking to raise $15,000 for this campaign. Here's a break down of where our expenses are:

  • Studio Time, Production, Mixing - $1500 per song x 8 = $12,000
  • Mastering - $1000
  • Pressing - $1000
  • Session Expenses & Misc - $1000

What do I get out of this?

SO, now you find yourself wondering just what you'll get out this campaign....what's in it for your if you join our team? Well, a few things. If you join us on this adventure, you're able to choose from our sweet list of perks. While putting them together, we thought long and hard about the kind of things we'd want to see bands we like offer, what kind of things would be special to us. So there's a pretty expansive list to choose from at different contribution points.

Second, we're documenting the recording process and will be sharing a lot of behind the scenes footage, photographs, demos, and mixes. We're going to give you the fly on the wall perspective of what it's like to make a record. It's about as close as you can get to actually being in the studio with us.

Third, and more importantly, if you decide to join our team and become a contributor, you're not just backing our band, you're backing passion. You're backing heart. You're backing real music about real life, real feelings, played by real people. We play big, loud, guitar-based rock and roll at a time when all the talking heads are saying it's dead. But we ask, "how can something dead make you feel so alive?" That's what this music does for us. Sure, we could probably be more successful if we followed a trend, and, but we're sticking to what we love and what's real to us, and what we think is real to other people. Music played by human beings, about human experiences, and filled with that human element. From our fingertips, voices, and hearts to your ears, the way it should be. Your contribution will enable that to continue.

What's more is, you can do more than just contribute financially. Spread the word about our band and what we're doing far and wide, to everyone with ears and a heartbeat. The more people know what we're doing, the better chance we have of making this a success, and doing it together. We've always felt like a community band. You guys, our team, the ones who have supported us these last few years, make this worthwhile. We can do this together!!

Now, if we go over our goal, we'll take that money and put it towards more exciting things, pressing the record on vinyl, publicity, videos, etc.


What can I do if I can't contribute but still want to help?

If you can't make a contribution here, that's ok too. We totally understand. We know times are tough these days. Should you want to help in another way, we'd absolutely love you to share this campaign with any friends you think might be interested. 

Or you can send them to check out us and our music at:
www.thebretonsound.com

www.thebretonsound.bandcamp.com

www.facebook.com/thebretonsound

www.twitter.com/thebretonsound

You can get free downloads of our last records over there at Bandcamp, and you can follow along with all our adventures at the others.


ADDITIONAL INFO:

*As a contributor, at any level, you'll get the 2nd EP we mentioned as a digital download for free when it's released.

**All perks $10+ include the $5 perk of the early digital download.


Thanks so much for stopping by, and for making the adventure that is this band, so wonderful and exciting.

The Breton Sound

Jonathan Pretus, Stephen Turner, John Bourgeois, & Joe Bourgeois
story_txt:

Since we started playing in 2010, we've worked really hard to write and record music that we love and that makes us feel alive. story:
FULL CIRCLE IS NOW ON YOUTUBE IN ITS ENTIRETY IN 4K ULTRA HD RESOLUTION!

 

FULL CIRCLE IS OUT NOW!
Full Circle is available on our official webshop and ships worldwide.
Thank you everyone for your support and having made this possible,we couldn't have done it without you.
 

On September 11th, we returned to where it all began 11 years ago. In celebration of successful years, we are coming back to the prestigious ProgPower USA festival! Complete the Full Circle by taking part in the making of our new live album! 
 

 

UPDATE 13. SEPTEMBER:

 

The show has been played! Everything has been recorded and we want to thank everyone who attended this special one of a kind show! We will update you all with as much and as soon as we can and we hope you as excited about this as we are! 

 

UPDATE 26. AUGUST:

Due to the overwhelming success with our "Full Circle - Live At Center Stage" Indiegogo campaign, we have decided to add two more cameras to its production. With this, we will be even more convinced that we can deliver the high-class product you deserve and we want to be remembered for. There is still time left before the campaign ends, so feel free to secure your version of "Full Circle - Live At Center Stage" through Indiegogo, and you will be the first we ship to. If you already have funded, you may help us spread the word. :)

 

UPDATE 19. AUGUST:

 

Perks added and work-in-progress cover revealed. Please click "updates" tab at the top of this page for more information.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHO WE ARE
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We are Pagan's Mind, a so-called Progressive Metal band from Norway that jokingly likes to call our music "True Norwegian Hard-Hitting In-Your-Face Space Metal", and the adorable-looking brotherhood you can see below. Together we have released 5 studio albums since 2000, as well as a live album/DVD in 2009, and toured with bands like Fates Warning, Stratovarius, Sonata Arctica and Symphony X.
 
The goal with this campaign is to make our second live DVD with your help, shooting for a release in the first half of 2015. Although we have played several other amazing festivals, such as Graspop and Sweden Rock to name a few, going back to Progpower USA in Atlanta is a home-coming for us, and there is no better place for such a recording, which we intend to prove to you all. 
 
Heavenly Ecstasy - Intermission

Live Equation - United Alliance (Live DVD) 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

FULL CIRCLE

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Full Circle stands for the return to our roots, the return to ProgPower USA, and the return to an important album that helped bring us to where we are today, namely Celestial Entrance. With Full Circle, we want to give everyone access to an exclusive night with a one of a kind 2,5 hour show. 

Full Circle will feature Celestial Entrance played in its entirety plus a second set with other favorites and signature songs from our catalogue, amongst then a "new" instrumental we put together with lots of material you have never heard live. This will be the longest show ever performed in the history of Pagan's Mind, thus the challenge for us, we are motivated to make it one of the most memorable evenings in the history of our band, both for you and for us. 

 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

WHY   

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

When coming up with Full Circle, we knew we had to bring this experience to everyone. However, when doing a little research, we realized that with your help, we will be able to push the quality of this release to the point we envision. As a result, we ask you to become part of the circle, make our vision a reality, and bring this special night to everyone's screen. With your participation, Full Circle will be another live DVD for you to enjoy to the fullest, and for us to be proud of.
Our goal is to reach 20.000 Euros. This is the estimated budget we need to make a world class production and bring the experience to you "as if you were there".

 

Your investment will allow us to have great artwork, high quality editing and the kind of audio mix that we are known for; the one that you deserve to hear.  

More information about the costs estimation can be found below. 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PERKS

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

GUITARIST AND KEYBOARD KITS INCLUDED IN COMPLETE AND ULTIMATE BUNDLES!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLANNED PRODUCTION

(subject to change)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- 5 SONY PMW-EX3 XDCAM 1080p HD VIDEO CAMERAS

 

 

 

- 12' JIB/CRANE WITH PAN AND TILT HEAD
- 1 DIRECTOR
- 1 DIRECTOR STATION FOR MONITORING AND CAMERA DIRECTION
- 6 DIRECTOR <> COMMUNICATION HEADSETS
- 5 CAMERA OPERATORS
- 1 PRODUCTION ASSISTANT
- 1 RECORDING ENGINEER
- 1 AUDIO ASSISTANT (STAGE/STUDIO)
- 3 Locked down static shot cameras; Canon 5D's and a new GoPro HD low light camera

 

           

 

PLANNED CAMERA POSITIONS 

 

 

1 Jib/Camera: Down Stage Right
1 Tripod Camera: House Center
1 Tripod Camera: House Left-Middle
2 Handheld Cameras: Inside Barricade
2 Lockdown Cannon 5D mkII's: 
  - Aiming at drummer from top-side
  - Aiming at keyboard from side-front
1 Lockdown GoPro: Over Drums.

 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

COSTS

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This part of the description is dedicated to the costs of the project, basically where your money will go to. These are estimates that we will break down for you.
 
Recording (1500 euros):
Yes, this sounds like a "steal", but because the venue has everything set up and other bands will film at the festival, plus the fact that coming home to ProgPower always is welcoming, this is what we pay for the raw material.
More info regarding this can be seen above in the Production section.
 
Editing (6000 euros):
This is needed to make the 2,5 hour footage of all 8 cameras a one and coherent film to enjoy. Making sure you have a good-looking release of over 2 hours, will undoubtly be the biggest part of the "cake" shown above.
 
Artwork (1500 euros):
This includes the two-sided shirts, album cover and booklets, the photo book cover and all the massive work around this - basically many small details that you will not notice if it is done right, that would stand out like a sore thumb if it isn't... We will give you updates about the progress here through Indiegogo whenever we feel there is something to report. 

 

Distribution (2000 euros):
Eventually, though you as a funder get the release before the masses, we need to distribute this product both physically and digitally.

 

Perks (5000 euros):
Making the funder happy, is our greatest concern! This part of the budget involves all the costs to produce, print and ship all the perks that you may purchase. The 5000 might sound a bit inflated, but we know how people drop their jaws when we include shipping from one of the most expensive countries in the world. We have toyed with the idea of shipping from elsewhere, and that might be cheaper, but then we are hammered with import and export tolls as well, so we need to leave the estimated costs for perks at this level to make sure we can afford to make you proud to be a part of this. 

 

Printing (1000 euros):
We leave this in here for manufacturing costs tied to the distribution part described above.  

 

Audio Mix (3000 euros):
Last but definitely not least are the costs for the audio mixes. We intend to go for two audio streams; a 5,1 Surround Sound audiotrack and a normal AC3 2.0 audio stream, and will keep you updated.

    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    RISKS & CHALLENGES

    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

     

    A big project like this means risks and challenges. We can not deny that, but we are confident we will overcome them all. After having performed countless concerts under all kinds of circumstances, and produced and released a live album/DVD once before, we like to believe that we know the factors that come into play when producing Full Circle. Still, we want you to know what could ultimately happen if things go south.

    The release could be delayed due to many reasons, like printing/distribution/editing delays and such. In any case, you will be updated. 

    Also, there is the chance of this campaign not reaching the goal that we set. That would be a big challenge for us, but we will releaseFull Cirlce no matter what, and all perks will be delivered as long as the recording process goes the way we expect. 
    If the raw material leaves us disappointed and we know early on that this release will not be for you to cherish and for us to be proud of,  we will refund all the money to the respective owners. For you, this means no risk.

    Other than that, most challenges are on a musical level, which is for us to deal with.  

     

    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    If you are not able to help us fund at this time, you can still help in several ways!
    You may share this campaign on social media, tell your friends and help us spread the word. Any involvement from you is greatly appreciated!

story:
"The lucid instrument here is Ayla's voice, a mechanism dedicated to the running consciousness of her lyrics, their enchanted visions like a fantastical child drinking in her surroundings and blooming ideas." 

~ The Deli SF


"It's a story for Us. Of how we learn through challenge.
The tale of an afternoon's heartbreak turning us inside to know ourselves more deeply.
A winding journey through forests of giving ourselves permission
over and over again
to be exactly as we Are.
It's the sound of the wind breathing, turned into notes so we can carry them.
The images of the inner eye
dreamt by the one who dreams himself awake
the divine theater, where we sing
as though never were a limit to the reaches of the voice...
It's all that's Beheld."
~ Ayla Nereo

BeHeld

Your donation goes toward the recording, mixing, mastering, and production of BeHeld and its accompanying music videos.

If you have enjoyed Ayla's music, shared it, or want to see more of it, please consider supporting in this way.

You can donate ANY amount, and can choose whether or not to receive a gift in return for your support.

BeHeld is the third full-length album of musician, poet, and filmmaker Ayla Nereo.


It is accompanied by films telling the story of each song, and live projected video at each performance.
It is a journey of storytelling and sound, told in words and moving images.

These songs are full of life. They want to be out in the world.


But Ayla will need a little help from her friends if that's going to happen.


What You Get, and Where the Funding Goes

Every donation helps carry out the many parts of producing and distributing BeHeld, as well as funding Ayla's newest videos for the album.

You are welcome to donate as much as you are able, and can choose whether or not to receive a gift.
You can also choose ANY GIFT of equal or lesser value to what you donated.

These can also be holiday gifts, birthday presents, valentine's day surprises - any gift can be given to another!
(Songwriting lessons for your nephew... an original song about your sweetie...)
If you'd like to give a friend or family member any of these offerings for the holidays, Ayla will email you a special gift card you can give to that person, describing what they'll receive.

By helping raise these much-needed funds, you will be enabling Ayla to not only create and finish this album (costs of recording artists, mixing, mastering, and CD manufacture) but will also help to bring it and it's video components around the world.

*   *   *   *

I want to honor these songs, and all those who have supported me from the very beginnings of my songwriting, by making this album shine.

For the first time ever in my career, I am working on creating professional recordings, full color album packaging with lyrics, promotion, as well as touring nationally.
Album production and distribution costs are immense, and this fundraising campaign is actually only a small portion of those costs -- but if I can reach this goal, it will be HUGE in turning these plans into reality.

On my own, I don't have the funds needed to master and distribute these songs.
And so I reach out, to share with you the opportunity to be part of the music.

And if I surpass my $8,000 goal, I'll be able to share this music even more widely.  I work closely with children and adults, teaching songwriting and creativity workshops, and would love to incorporate a workshop event into each city in which I perform on tour.

Hear more of Ayla's music at www.aylanereo.com/music


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word!

Send an email to friends
Share with your neighbor
Post this on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter
tweet tweet your heart out!

Every word you can spread about this helps me reach this goal.

Thank You so deeply for this support.


Please email me at  ayla[at]aylanereo[dot]com  if you have any questions.


NOTE: Since many of these gifts are contingent on the completion of the album, delivery of gifts will be from 2 weeks after your donation to 3 months after album release date, unless specified otherwise directly by Ayla.

* Private concert is within a 100 mile radius of Ayla's touring routes. If much beyond that distance, I would appreciate help with travel costs beyond that radius -- otherwise an equally appealing gift will be agreed upon.

** This is a song about you, and for you -- however, Ayla retains all ownership and rights to the song created.
story_txt:
"The lucid instrument here is Ayla's voice, a mechanism dedicated to the running consciousness of her lyrics, their enchanted visions like a fantastical child drinking in her surroundings and blooming ideas."  
~ The Deli SF


"It's a story for Us. Of how we learn through challenge. 


The tale of an afternoon's heartbreak turning us inside to know ourselves more deeply. 


A winding journey through forests of giving ourselves permission


over and over again


to be exactly as we Are.


It's the sound of the wind breathing, turned into notes so we can carry them.


The images of the inner eye


dreamt by the one who dreams himself awake


the divine theater, where we sing 


as though never were a limit to the reaches of the voice...It's all that's Beheld."~ Ayla Nereo




BeHeld
Your donation goes toward the recording, mixing, mastering, and production of BeHeld and its accompanying music videos.If you have enjoyed Ayla's music, shared it, or want to see more of it, please consider supporting in this way.You can donate ANY amount, and can choose whether or not to receive a gift in return for your support.BeHeld is the third full-length album of musician, poet, and filmmaker Ayla Nereo. 
It is accompanied by films telling the story of each song, and live projected video at each performance.It is a journey of storytelling and sound, told in words and moving 
images.These songs are full of life. They want to be out in the world. 
But Ayla will need a little help from her friends if that's going to happen.



What You Get, and Where the Funding Goes
Every donation helps carry out the many parts of producing and distributing BeHeld, as well as funding Ayla's newest videos for the album.You are welcome to donate as much as you are able, and can choose whether or not to receive a gift. You can also choose ANY GIFT of equal or lesser value to what you donated.These can also be holiday gifts, birthday presents, valentine's day surprises - any gift can be given to another! (Songwriting lessons for your nephew... an original song about your sweetie...)If you'd like to give a friend or family member any of these offerings for the holidays, Ayla will email you a special gift card you can give to that person, describing what they'll receive. By helping raise these much-needed funds, you will be enabling Ayla to not only create and finish this album (costs of recording artists, mixing, mastering, and CD manufacture) but will also help to bring it and it's video components around the world. *   *   *   *

I want to honor these songs, and all those who have supported me from the very beginnings of my songwriting, by making this album shine. For the first time ever in my career, I am working on creating professional recordings, full color album packaging with lyrics, promotion, as well as touring nationally. Album production and distribution costs are immense, and this 
fundraising campaign is actually only a small portion of those costs -- 
but if I can reach this goal, it will be HUGE in turning these plans 
into reality. On my own, I don't have the funds needed to master and distribute these songs.And so I reach out, to share with you the opportunity to be part of the music.And if I surpass my $8,000 goal, I'll be able to share this music even more widely.  I work closely with children and adults, teaching songwriting and creativity workshops, and would love to incorporate a workshop event into each city in which I perform on tour.Hear more of Ayla's music at www.aylanereo.com/music



Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word!Send an email to friendsShare with your neighbor

Post this on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twittertweet tweet your heart out! 
Every word you can spread about this helps me reach this goal. Thank You so deeply for this support.Please email me at  ayla[at]aylanereo[dot]com  if you have any questions.NOTE: Since many of these gifts are contingent on the completion of the album, delivery of gifts will be from 2 weeks after your donation to 3 months after album release date, unless specified otherwise directly by Ayla.* Private concert is within a 100 mile radius of Ayla's touring routes. If much beyond that distance, I would appreciate help with travel costs beyond that radius -- otherwise an equally appealing gift will be agreed upon.** This is a song about you, and for you -- however, Ayla retains all ownership and rights to the song created.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Janie Lidey and I have been a singer-songwriter for nearly all my life. I have produced 4 albums in Alaska over the past ten years and am now producing my 5th project in Nashville, Tennessee. The album will feature 10 original songs co-written by myself and two other Nashville writers. 

This project is unique in that it combines the 10 song CD with the release of my first book, both titled, 'The Magic of A Song'.  My message: Find your passion, lose your fear, leap with faith, live the life of your dreams. 

Your gracious contributions to this project will enable me to 'leap with faith' into sharing stories and songs with a message that I believe will make a difference in people's lives.

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of this project is close to 20,000 dollars. That includes self-publishing fees for the book, art work, graphics, photos, studio time, musicians fees, mixing, mastering, duplicating... I am asking for your help in raising 10,800 dollars to cover some of those costs. 

I am putting together a fun list of perks for your contributions including  signed CDs, signed books, t-shirts, house concerts, corporate concerts and a chance to have your name and or your company logo on a special acknowledgement page in my book. If you would like to make a contribution that doesn't match the perk levels offered, simply select contribute now and enter the amount of your choice.

The Impact

At the end of one of my recent concerts, a woman came up to me and said, "I used to love to paint and I was actually pretty good at it.  I gave it up 10 years ago, but after listening to your songs and stories, I am going to go home and start painting again!".

Having that kind of impact on a person's life is what I feel my ultimate calling is about.  I am excited to ignite that spark in as many people as I can through 'The Magic of A Song'.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for considering a contribution!  If you can't help out on a financial level at this time, please consider making some noise about the campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools to let your friends, family and colleagues know about it.

story:
Short Summary

 

Till i Fall is an Alternative/Pop-Rock band from San Jose, Ca created by Brandon Leland in the Fall of 2010. The band consists on lead guitarist Jason Perry, Drummer Payam Barghi, and bassist Kevin Ristow. In March of this year, the band released an EP entitled, "Solutions, Not Answers," and this Summer they plan on touring to promote their new music. The tour will begin on July 5th in Northern California and the band will play through Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Nevada, Utah, Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona, through Southern California, and ending in their home town on July 28th.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

In order to make this tour possible, the band needs YOUR HELP to afford the following:

 

New merchandise

Gas

Money for the occasional hotel

A Van

 

Gifts to all donor's are listed below.

 

The Impact

 

As a band we have never toured outside of the state of California and it is our goal and passion to share our music with as many people across the country. By contributing to this, you are contributing to the art of music and the messages behind our music, as well as encouraging us to continue on our long and potentially rough journey.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If donating money at this time is not something you can do, emailing the band and sending words of encouragement are always welcome. You can also follow us on facebook and twitter!

 

If you happen to live in one of the many cities the band will be playing this Summer, coming out to a show, giving them a place to sleep, or even a bottle of water is a huge contribution in itself.

story:
What Up

Hey, I'm Joel. I'm a singer/songwriter living in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, and also a theatre artist! I act, write, compose, improvise, produce, etc, etc. I've played the piano since I was 7, and developed a pretty unique style - a jazz/pop/rock combination reminiscent of Billy Joel, Tom Waits, or Peter Gabriel. I'm raising money to record a 10-song debut album over the summer of 2012, for release in the fall. The songs are completely new - written on my recent four-month European/African backpacking trip, where I did the following INTERESTING THINGS THAT INSPIRED MY MUSIC:

-Walked 1000km through Northern Spain on the Camino de Santiago de Compostela

-Joined the crew of a square-rigged sailing cargo vessel, The Tres Hombres, for a month from Portugal to Madeira to the Canary Islands to Capo Verde

-Performed in Spain, Portugal, Madeira, Capo Verde, Italy, Germany, Czech Republic, and Austria

-Slept on the street. Just once, though.

I've got some older material too, which is mostly about girls and stuff.

IMPACT

Your contribution will help me to record and professionally produce a ten-song EP. With this, I can finally start marketing myself as a real singer/songwriter to festivals, radio, booking agents, and fans. But it's not just all about marketing. What? Yeah, I care about this crap and I think I'm good at it, and I want to share my music with more people. Any donation will have a huge impact on me and my career and my psychological and emotional well-being, and if you'd like more, I'm happy to let you know that this album will

SAVE THE WORLD

Where is all this money going? I'd REALLY like to know.

Check it out:

 

Recording Facility (20 hrs) -       $1500.00  
Producer -                                   $2500.00
Other Musicians -                       $1000.00
Mixing -                                       $3000.00
Mastering -                                  $1000.00

Total -                                          $9000.00

Where is it coming from?

My Pocket -                                 $4000.00
IndieGogo Campaign -                $5000.00

Now you may notice that this only takes care of recording the album! Great observation. The production, distribution, and marketing will be handled by me once this first step is underway. If this campaign exceeds its goal, the funds will go towards that!

If this campaign fails to reach its goal, as we already know, the world will end.

And after surviving the apocalypse, I will save enough Nuka-Cola caps to make the album happen anyway.

FURTHERMORE, THERE ARE REWARDS FOR GENEROSITY

Perks include:

-A pre-order of the album, so this fall you will be AMONG THE FIRST to OWN IT. Whether you are the first to listen to it is really up to you, perhaps you will choose to frame it in a shadowbox as a permanent record of your heroism!
-Free tickets to shows! Theatre and music! I do both things!
-House concerts!
-A song written for, about, or while running from you!
-Rad Resistance - 25% Radiation resistance permanently!
-Anything you want! Really, I pretend to be creative but I am nothing compared to YOU. If you have an idea for something I can do for you, let's talk. I'm totally open to that.

What else can I, devoted fan/friend/family member/zealot do?

Two main things:

 

1) Contribute to this campaign!

2) Spread the word! Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Myspace, Friendster, Netflix, Flickster, Trickster, create misleading Wikipedia entries, but DO NOT BREAK ANY LAWS. THEY ARE IN PLACE TO PROTECT YOU.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sofia Gonzalez I am a freelance performer/teaching artist/conductor. I hold a bachelor and a master’s degree from school Berklee College of Music and Longy School of Music respectively.

  I always felt passionate about classical music and for teaching.I want to change people’s perspective and re- cultivate their outlook on classicalmusic, as well as, entertain and educate as a teaching artist. Recently I founded Fughetta In Vogue Chamber Orchestra. This organization has the goal to perform at unconventional venues such as: hospitals, nursing homes, public/private schools, churches, libraries among others.

  The main goal of this fundraising campaign is tobe able to achieve our first performance on October 24, 2013. This will take place at the Kindred Assisted Living House in east Boston. The event will be recorded for marketing purposes to prospective venues. In addition, the long term goal is to establish an internship for local musicians and students through a non –profit organization, also to reach more and newer audiences,expanding to other locations eventually.

What We Need:

.We need 2,500.00 for the following expenses:


-Assistant Coordinator

-Musicians Payment

-Rehearsal space

-Meals for the musicians

-Advertisement expenses

-Recording

-Transportation


Other ways you can help?Other ways you can help?

* Please share this with friends and family through Facebook.

* All ideas are welcome for improving my project! Email me at sflute2004@hotmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Jeremy Drinkwine.  My band is called DRINKWINE cause, why not, right?  I was born and raised in Tennessee.  I have been passionately creating music and writing songs most of my life.  I have a family with four amazing kids and believe that leading by example and pursuing my dream will only give my kids the encouragement they need to do the same.  

This campaign exists to raise the money needed to complete a full length 10 song album of songs I've written over the past 2 years.  This is it ya'll, my dream in a Compact Disc.  I have several songs finished already due to the generosity of some folk's time and a small loan to get us started which will be paid back in full as our goal is met.  

If you decide to participate you will be helping me give back to the world the gift that I've been given in music and writing songs.  This is your opportunity to be a part of a dream.  Thank you so much for your contribution and support.  

What We Need & What You Get

So, in a nutshell, my goal is $22,000.  Sounds like a lot right?  It's somebody's new Honda for sure.  Well, to record 10 songs it will take $17,000 for production and studio time,  $3,000 to have it Mixed and Mastered, and another $2,000 to have the CD's other merchandise designed, pressed and released.

There are many different levels I've broken down below that give you a choice of how much you can contribute along with the perks you will receive based on the dollar amount such as signed CD's, lyric sheets, Shout Outs, T-shirts, bumper stickers, posters, signatured bottles and cases of wine, personal videos, house concerts etc...  I have done my best to make it fair but remember this is more or less like donating to a good cause, you just happen to be getting something cool in return, cause you're awesome!!

I fully believe the goal of $22,000 will be met.  However, in the event that it isn't there are plans in place to use what money we do raise to finish the project anyway.  Dreams don't die, they adjust.

The Impact

Guys, this is it!  This is where a dream meets the world.  This is where art is appreciated by more than just friends and family.  This is who I am. It's who I was born to be.  You are not only investing into the gift God has given me, but you are giving a gift to the world by funding this project into existence.  

These campaigns work.  Travel the IndieGoGo website and see for yourself.  Thousands of dreams and gifts to the world have been realized through contributions like yours.  This works!!  

I am but one artist in a sea of millions dreaming, but you can make mine a reality.  I am honored to have been given this gift of songwriting and music and can not wait to give it back with your help!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please spread the word.  Use the IndieGoGo share tools.  Facebook and Tweet about this campaign.  Get your friends excited.  Tell everyone you know about DRINKWINE and this campaign.  Sign up on my email list at www.drinkwinemusic.com.  Pray that we reach our goal.  Whatever you feel.  

Thank you for how ever you contribute and bless you...

story:
Who loves Country Music?   Meeeeeeeee

 

Hi & welcome to my first crowd-funding project.  Recording my next album in Nashville is going to be a mind boggling experience & I'm very excited about having you all involved in this next project of mine.

The idea of having the public & fans of all music contributing to my next recording and offering something in return is very appealing.  For the past year or two I have been madly writing songs for an album titled, Foolish Things and really enjoying  the process & how the songs have arrived.  Foolish Things has songs about love, loss, friendships, good times, bad times & even Windmills.  What's not to love about Windmills?

This album is very important to me because these songs come directly from my heart & what can be more personal than that? It's a very special way of connecting with absolutely anyone, anywhere in the world and I love the feeling i get when people in the crowd are singing the words to my own songs.  What a buzz! 

Foolish Things is to follow up on the success of my first album, Taking Goodbye which had some serious chart success here in Australia, scored several songwriting awards & introduced me to the industry & country music fans around the country.  

I love being an independent artist and wouldn't have it any other way but with your support & funding, which will go directly towards flights, accommodation, studio costs & film clips, I'll be able to promote my album amongst the best of em!

 

Where will The Money Go?

Good question;

*Flights from Adelaide to Nashville 

*Accommodation for 10 days in Nashville

*studio hire       

*Film clip contribution to promote the finish product

I have suggested that $5000 would be my target and I will be thrilled with any support I get.  Any $'s over that will mean I can continue to promote the album with film clips & radio releases which all cost phenomenal amounts of money.

 

My Perks

I have tried to make my perks as attractive as possible & make them unique and fun, so I hope you can find something in there that appeals so we both win!

They can be as simple as a CD order, right through to your very own gig or appearing in a film clip.

 

My Progress So Far

2009 - Toyota Starmaker Top 10 Grandfinalist

2009 - SA Achiever Award 

2009 - SA Apra Best Traditional Country Song Of The Year (Good Old Fashioned Days)

2010 - Top 30 - Rising Star (no 27)

2010 - SA Apra Best Traditional Country Song Of The Year (Taking Goodbye)

2011 - Top 30 - Taking Goodbye (no 10)

2011 - Top 30 - Close Enough duet Doug Bruce (no 13)

2011 - Top 30 - Break Even (no 5) 

2011 - Top 30 Most played songs of the year Country Music charts (Break Even)

2012 - TIARA Award - Best Vocal Collaboration - Close Enough with Doug Bruce

2012 - GMMA Awards - Best Female Vocalist Cenral West Region 

 

Festival Appearances: Tamworth Country Music Festival (CMF) 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, Mildura CMF 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012.  Boyup Brook CMF 2010, 2011.  Gympie Muster 2010. Katherine Music Muster 2010. Horsham CMF 2012, 2013, Terang CMF 2012, 2013, Cruisin' Country 2011, 2013. Bunbury 2012 And too many more to remember.

 

Or........

Hey if you can't contribute with $'s, I completely understand and there is another way you can help a girl out......spread the word, pass it on, Chinese whispers, tell the world with email, Facebook everything & anything.  Go forth and spread the good word of country music.

 

Song Title From Each Album

Taking Goodbye - Show Me, Break Even, Good Old Fashioned Days, Tiny Little Pieces, Forever Tonight, Miss Being Mrs, Rising Star, The Lovin' Is The Easy Part, Taking Goodbye, Close Enough (duet with Doug Bruce).

Honky Tonk Angels - A Coal Miners Daughter, Hey Loretta, Don't Come Home A'Drinkin, You Ain't Woman Enough, Woman Of The World, I Fall To Pieces/Walkin' After Midnight/Crazy, You're Lookin' At Country, Honky Tonk Girl, Ones On The Way/The Pill, Fist City, Happy Birthday.

Honky Tonk Queens - Somebody Somewhere, Jolene, Help Me Make It Through The Night, She's Got You, Good Girls Gonna Go Bad, Wildwood Flower, Back In Babies Arms, Here I Am Again, Silver threads & Golden Needles, Jukebox Blues, Stand By Your Man, As Soon As I Hung Up The Phone, When Will I Be Loved, Why Can't He Be You, Walked right In. 

Walkin' The Line - Get Rhythm, I Walk The Line, Jackson, It Aint Me Babe, Long Legged Guitar Pickin' Man, The Loving Is The Easy Part, Ring Of Fire, Jukebox Blues, The Man In Black, Sunday Morning Coming Down, Orange Blossom Special, Folsom Prison Blues, Daddy Sang Bass, The Eyes Of A Drunk, A Boy Named Sue.
story_txt:
Who loves Country Music?   Meeeeeeeee
 

Hi & welcome to my first crowd-funding project.  Recording my next album in Nashville is going to be a mind boggling experience & I'm very excited about having you all involved in this next project of mine.

The idea of having the public & fans of all music contributing to my next recording and offering something in return is very appealing.  For the past year or two I have been madly writing songs for an album titled, Foolish Things and really enjoying  the process & how the songs have arrived.  Foolish Things has songs about love, loss, friendships, good times, bad times & even Windmills.  What's not to love about Windmills?
This album is very important to me because these songs come directly from my heart & what can be more personal than that? It's a very special way of connecting with absolutely anyone, anywhere in the world and I love the feeling i get when people in the crowd are singing the words to my own songs.  What a buzz! 
Foolish Things is to follow up on the success of my first album, Taking Goodbye which had some serious chart success here in Australia, scored several songwriting awards & introduced me to the industry & country music fans around the country.  
I love being an independent artist and wouldn't have it any other way but with your support & funding, which will go directly towards flights, accommodation, studio costs & film clips, I'll be able to promote my album amongst the best of em!
 
Where will The Money Go?
Good question;
*Flights from Adelaide to Nashville 
*Accommodation for 10 days in Nashville 
*studio hire       
*Film clip contribution to promote the finish product
I have suggested that $5000 would be my target and I will be thrilled with any support I get.  Any $'s over that will mean I can continue to promote the album with film clips & radio releases which all cost phenomenal amounts of money.
 
My Perks
I have tried to make my perks as attractive as possible & make them unique and fun, so I hope you can find something in there that appeals so we both win!
They can be as simple as a CD order, right through to your very own gig or appearing in a film clip.
 
My Progress So Far
2009 - Toyota Starmaker Top 10 Grandfinalist

2009 - SA Achiever Award 
2009 - SA Apra Best Traditional Country Song Of The Year (Good Old Fashioned Days)
2010 - Top 30 - Rising Star (no 27)
2010 - SA Apra Best Traditional Country Song Of The Year (Taking Goodbye)
2011 - Top 30 - Taking Goodbye (no 10)
2011 - Top 30 - Close Enough duet Doug Bruce (no 13)
2011 - Top 30 - Break Even (no 5) 
2011 - Top 30 Most played songs of the year Country Music charts (Break Even)
2012 - TIARA Award - Best Vocal Collaboration - Close Enough with Doug Bruce
2012 - GMMA Awards - Best Female Vocalist Cenral West Region 
 
Festival Appearances: Tamworth Country Music Festival (CMF) 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, Mildura CMF 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012.  Boyup Brook CMF 2010, 2011.  Gympie Muster 2010. Katherine Music Muster 2010. Horsham CMF 2012, 2013, Terang CMF 2012, 2013, Cruisin' Country 2011, 2013. Bunbury 2012 And too many more to remember.
 
Or........
Hey if you can't contribute with $'s, I completely understand and there is another way you can help a girl out......spread the word, pass it on, Chinese whispers, tell the world with email, Facebook everything & anything.  Go forth and spread the good word of country music.
 
Song Title From Each Album
Taking Goodbye - Show Me, Break Even, Good Old Fashioned Days, Tiny Little Pieces, Forever Tonight, Miss Being Mrs, Rising Star, The Lovin' Is The Easy Part, Taking Goodbye, Close Enough (duet with Doug Bruce).
Honky Tonk Angels - A Coal Miners Daughter, Hey Loretta, Don't Come Home A'Drinkin, You Ain't Woman Enough, Woman Of The World, I Fall To Pieces/Walkin' After Midnight/Crazy, You're Lookin' At Country, Honky Tonk Girl, Ones On The Way/The Pill, Fist City, Happy Birthday.
Honky Tonk Queens - Somebody Somewhere, Jolene, Help Me Make It Through The Night, She's Got You, Good Girls Gonna Go Bad, Wildwood Flower, Back In Babies Arms, Here I Am Again, Silver threads & Golden Needles, Jukebox Blues, Stand By Your Man, As Soon As I Hung Up The Phone, When Will I Be Loved, Why Can't He Be You, Walked right In. 
Walkin' The Line - Get Rhythm, I Walk The Line, Jackson, It Aint Me Babe, Long Legged Guitar Pickin' Man, The Loving Is The Easy Part, Ring Of Fire, Jukebox Blues, The Man In Black, Sunday Morning Coming Down, Orange Blossom Special, Folsom Prison Blues, Daddy Sang Bass, The Eyes Of A Drunk, A Boy Named Sue.

story:
Short Summary

   Brian Bray of Louisville, Kentucky is a former UofL football player, and Jefferson county Sheriff's deputy. He's a father of two, and is in a fight for his life. Brian has been battling cancer for years, and is now in clinical trials at Vanderbilt. There is a benefit in his honor being held at Siggys in Valley Station , Kentucky July 21st 2012. This will be an all day fund raising music fest featuring some of louisvilles best up and coming bands. Names like  Beyond Doubt, Alison's Escape, Out of order, Bourbon Country, and More! We will be making a CD, and DVD of the event, and you can help Brian by pre ordering the event media. Brian has friends all over, and this is a great way for those who can't make it, to help Brian and his children is their time of need. 

   

What We Need & What You Get

   My goal is to raise as much money as we can so Brian can take one concern off of his plate, and so he can focus on his health, and his family. I set the bar at $20,000 but more is just fine! People who help out will get a CD, DVD, or both of the live stage perfomances being held at Siggys on the 21st. Who knows you may be getting an early recording of a star, and with the talent we have in the line up, it's VERY possible. Most of all you get the satisfaction of helpping a great guy when he needs it the most. Unlike most charities where you donate, and wonder where the money goes, in this instance you KNOW it is going directly to a family that needs your help! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to pitch in here, please share this with everyone you know, ot only takes secconds to post on facebook, or copy and past a link to e-mail. Please share this with everyone you know, and if you can make it, show up to the event. It will be a great time for all!

story:
Thank you for viewing the BAND COMPANY campaign:

 

Crowdfunding is the future of the music business:

BAND COMPANY- The music of Paul Rodgers comes to you from Las Vegas, NV.  If you love music in the style of "Bad Co." "Free" and "Queen" you are going to love this tribute to the Legendary Paul Rodgers.   BAND COMPANY has self funded our recording project so far and we are looking to finish the tribute CD along with a video and promotional ad campaign.  We are now turning to you for your support. Become a part of the ever growing BAND COMPANY family.  Your generosity is deeply appreciated.  BAND COMPANY is made up of 4 talented and experienced players, all with extensive stage and studio experience. BAND COMPANY is : Danny Boyle - lead vocals, Rick Sepela - Guitar/vocals, Todd Binder - Bass/vocals, Al Kerchofer - Drums

Your contribution will allow BAND COMPANY to keep moving forward on the recording of the CD. Visit our website (for windows users) www.bandcompanylive.com or (for mac and smart phone users) www.reverbnation.com/bandcompany to give a listen to the sampler tracks and Pre-Order your copy today.

 

Your contribution:

Back in the day when Record labels would fund recordings, known as an "Advance". Meaning the artist doesn't make a dime from record sales until the advance is recouped. That is why the artist/band tour, to generate an income from playing and to generate the sale of records to pay back the advance.  BUT, today it is the artist who funds these projects.  That is why we need your help. You will become our "virtual" shareholders by pre-ordering the CD or contributing to one of the "PERKS" we have set up. You help us with the funding we need to finish this CD.  Which in turn allows us get back out there and do what we love to do, PLAY LIVE and deliver to you a "HIT AFTER  HIT" "ROCK AND ROLL FANTASY"show that you "CAN'T GET ENOUGH" of. A show that will stay with you for years to come.  BAND COMPANY delivers to you the heart and soul of the music of PAUL RODGERS 

BAND COMPANY will use this funding to complete the tribute CD along with a promotional video and media ad campaign to promote the release of the CD. $15,000 is needed to complete this project, which is underway. $3,500 will be used on the video, $6,500 on the media ad campaign, manufacturing and licensing. If we reach our goal with your help we will be on our way to finish everything, even if we don't, we will make every attempt to get the perks out to everyone, be patient though, it will take a little longer to complete everything.  Thank you in advance for your support.

Why support BAND COMPANY?

With BAND COMPANY, No band will work harder to deliver to you a "NON-STOP, HIT AFTER HIT SHOW"  We thank you for your contribution and your time. But most of all we thank you for your belief in our project.  We are looking forward seeing all of you soon. 

Help us in other ways:

Even if you find yourself not able to contribute financially, you can still be a huge help, by using your social network to spread the word to your family, friends and co-workers about BAND COMPANY simply by using the indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

I've been really excited to start this campaign since the minute i heard about Indie GoGo This is such a great way to bring fans, family and friends together to create something unique and professional without those big scary record labels telling us what to do or how to do it.., and I think this is going to be an awesome and fun way to make my next full-length record.

We only have 45 DAYS to meet the goal, though, so PLEEEASE tell your friends to check out this page. Facebook ,Twitter, Emails, Letters (if anyone still does that) to help spread the word online. Everyone who donates gets a hug and a kiss ,even if your a guy so pucker up, just comes with the package. 


**Please return here often to check the "Updates" tab, where I'll be posting new videos and keeping everyone posted on the progress. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

You might be asking these questions:

What We Need

$30K may seem like a nice chunk of change, but to be honest, it's really JUST ENOUGH to make the kind of album I'm going for--an album that will compete on ANY level in today's musical world. Major labels today typically spend around $200,000 merely recording the album--I'm planning to work with 15% of that (Trust me,as an indie artist i've learned how to pinch a penny or two) Monies left over from recording (if there are any) will be put towards local radio promotion and touring.

The Impact

I'll be honest, i've slacked over the last few years ha ha. Not in my work ethic but just forget about my music. Friends and family members have told me i should record another album but i've been so busy writing for others that i became kind of lost, working with labels, a&r,managers blah blah blah. But recently the fire was sparked by my close friend and business partner Vicki Holmes who gave me a swift kick in the arse and said get out there buddy. Truly, YOUR contribution is  like helping me fly again. I've been in the studio almost everyday this past month coming up with song ideas and new sounds. Hopefully when you hear the record it will take you somewhere as well. Let's fly together!
